original: @63b #/ // / rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @63b #/ // / rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: karma siddha t'i k'a /
analyzed: karma siddha t'i k'a /
translated: Karma Siddhi Tika

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: las grub pa'i bshad pa /
analyzed: las grub pa'i bshad pa /
translated: Explanation of Establishing Karma

original: bam po dang po /
analyzed: bam po dang po /
translated: Volume One

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta.

original: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal cing /
analyzed: rtog pa'i dra ba rnam bsal cing /
translated: Having completely removed the net of concepts,

original: gzhan gyi don la nges bstan pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la nges bstan pa //
translated: and having taught for the benefit of others,

original: sems can kun gyi gnyen gcig po //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi gnyen gcig po //
translated: the sole friend of all sentient beings,

original: 'jam pa'i dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dpal la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: I pay homage to Mañjuśrī.

original: las grub rab tu byed pa ni //
analyzed: las grub rab tu byed pa ni //
translated: The establishment of karma,

original: mdor bshad 'dod pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: mdor bshad 'dod pa gang yin pa //
translated: which is explained in brief,

original: de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag dga' bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: in order to delight those who desire it,

original: mdor na de yi bshad pa bya //
analyzed: mdor na de yi bshad pa bya //
translated: I will explain it in brief.

original: mdo las las rnams ni gsum ste /
analyzed: mdo las las rnams ni gsum ste /
translated: In the sūtras, it is said: There are three types of karma.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung ba la /
translated: and so forth.

original: rab tu byed pa dgos pa dang bcas pa bshad pa ni rigs mod //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa dgos pa dang bcas pa bshad pa ni rigs mod //
translated: It is reasonable to explain the treatise along with its purpose.

original: 'di la ni dgos pa yang med de //
analyzed: 'di la ni dgos pa yang med de //
translated: But here, there is no purpose.

original: de'i phyir re zhig rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis de brtsams pa nyid kyang mi rung na /
analyzed: de'i phyir re zhig rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis de brtsams pa nyid kyang mi rung na /
translated: Therefore, if it is not suitable for those who engage in speculation to undertake it,

original: de bshad pa lta legs par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: de bshad pa lta legs par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could it be good to explain it?

original: 'di la sbyor ba yang yod de /🔽rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis ni dgos pa med pa gang yin pa de brtsams par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la sbyor ba yang yod de / rtog pa sngon du gtong ba can gyis ni dgos pa med pa gang yin pa de brtsams par mi bya ste /
translated: Here, there is also a syllogism:

original: dper na bya rog gi so brtag pa'i bstan bcos lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na bya rog gi so brtag pa'i bstan bcos lta bu yin la /
translated: One should not undertake that which is purposeless, because it is like, for example, a treatise on the examination of a crow’s teeth.

original: rab tu byed pa 'di yang dgos pa med pa yin pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'di yang dgos pa med pa yin pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: And this chapter is purposeless, because the nonobservation of a pervader is that

original: de brtsams pa la dgos pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de brtsams pa la dgos pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: its undertaking is necessarily purposeful.

original: de ltar rab tu byed pa la gzhan gyis brgal ba dang / 'dir bshad pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma grub po //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byed pa la gzhan gyis brgal ba dang / 'dir bshad pa dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs ni ma grub po //
translated: Thus, in this chapter, the opponent’s objection and the explanation here, “because it is purposeless,” are not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar 'di la lus la sogs pa'i las gsum gyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par nges par bzung ba zhes bya ba'i dgos pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di la lus la sogs pa'i las gsum gyi rang bzhin phyin ci ma log par nges par bzung ba zhes bya ba'i dgos pa yod do //
translated: It is like this: it has the purpose called “the ascertainment of the nature of the three actions, such as the bodily action, without error.”

original: de yang phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba gzhan thams cad kyis log par rtogs pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: de yang phyi rol gyi don yod par smra ba gzhan thams cad kyis log par rtogs pa'i phyir te //
translated: Moreover, all others who speak of the existence of external objects have mistaken ideas about it.

original: de'i phyir shes bya nang gi yin par smra bas de'i lugs dgag pa dang / rang gi bsam pa bstan pa'i sgo nas rab tu byed pa 'dis bsgrub par bya'o//
analyzed: de'i phyir shes bya nang gi yin par smra bas de'i lugs dgag pa dang / rang gi bsam pa bstan pa'i sgo nas rab tu byed pa 'dis bsgrub par bya'o//
translated: Therefore, this chapter should be composed in order to refute the system of those who speak of the internal object of knowledge and to establish our own position.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las las rnams ni gsum ste zhes gsungs pa dgod pa ni rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo las las rnams ni gsum ste zhes gsungs pa dgod pa ni rtsod pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Bhagavān has said in a sūtra, “There are three kinds of actions.” This is a point of contention.

original: pha rol gyi lugs bsal bas rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi lugs bsal bas rang gi ngo bo phyin ci ma log par bstan par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate its nature without error by refuting the opponent’s system.

original: de la re zhig de la kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol gyi @64a * //🔽lugs dgod pa mdzad de //
analyzed: de la re zhig de la kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas pha rol gyi @64a * // lugs dgod pa mdzad de //
translated: In that regard, first, in the passage beginning with “In this regard, some say,” he sets forth the opponent’s system.

original: de'i lugs dmigs kyis bkar te phyogs re re nas sun phyung bas ni phyis rang gi phyogs bde blag tu khong du chud par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i lugs dmigs kyis bkar te phyogs re re nas sun phyung bas ni phyis rang gi phyogs bde blag tu khong du chud par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By specifically refuting that system from each of its individual aspects, one is later able to easily understand our own position.

original: dang po ni bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dang po ni bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The first is to be known as the Vaibhāṣika position.

original: rang gi bla ma brgyud pa las bshad pa 'ongs pas bslus pa de dag ni 'di skad du lus kyis byas pa'i las ni lus kyi las yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer te /
analyzed: rang gi bla ma brgyud pa las bshad pa 'ongs pas bslus pa de dag ni 'di skad du lus kyis byas pa'i las ni lus kyi las yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa zer te /
translated: Those who have been deceived by their own gurus’ explanations say that the composition of karma by the body is physical karma and so on.

original: las gsum po dag gi tshig bsdu ba ni gzhan dang gzhan du rig par bya'o //🔽lus kyis byas pa'i las ni lus kyi las zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu ba ni gsum pa yin te /
analyzed: las gsum po dag gi tshig bsdu ba ni gzhan dang gzhan du rig par bya'o // lus kyis byas pa'i las ni lus kyi las zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu ba ni gsum pa yin te /
translated: The composition of the three karmas should be understood in other ways.🔽The composition of karma by the body is physical karma.

original: lus la brten nas zhes bya bar bsams pa yin te /
analyzed: lus la brten nas zhes bya bar bsams pa yin te /
translated: This is the third composition because it is thought that it is based on the body.

original: de ni bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽ngag nyid ni ngag gi las yin te zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu ba ni khyad par du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro // ngag nyid ni ngag gi las yin te zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu ba ni khyad par du byed pa yin te /
translated: It is not by nature action.🔽Speech itself is verbal karma.🔽This is the second composition because it is distinguished as speech.

original: dbyangs ni ngag gi yin no zhes 'byung bas de ni bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: dbyangs ni ngag gi yin no zhes 'byung bas de ni bya ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: It is by nature action because it is said that sound is speech.

original: ; so sor zhes bya ba ni re re zhing zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: ; so sor zhes bya ba ni re re zhing zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: “Individually” means “one by one.”

original: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: gnyis ka yang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: “Both” means the actions of body and speech.

original: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba de la /
translated: “Intimation” and “non-intimation” are as follows:

original: rnam par rig byed pas na rnam par rig byed de /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed pas na rnam par rig byed de /
translated: Intimation is that which intimates.

original: tha snyad rtogs pa gzhan gyi nang na yod pa'i bsam pa ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: tha snyad rtogs pa gzhan gyi nang na yod pa'i bsam pa ston par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it causes the intention existing in the mind of another to be understood.

original: rnam par rig byed gzhan du gzugs dang bya ba'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed gzhan du gzugs dang bya ba'i rang bzhin yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even though intimation is by nature form and action,

original: gzhan dag la rnam par rig par mi byed pas na rig byed ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la rnam par rig par mi byed pas na rig byed ma yin pa'o //
translated: it is not an intimation for others, and therefore it is non-intimation.

original: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid kyi las te zhes bya ba 'dir yang tshig bsdu ba ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: yid dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i las ni yid kyi las te zhes bya ba 'dir yang tshig bsdu ba ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: In the phrase “the action that is associated with mind is mental action,” the compound is a third type tatpurusa compound.

original: yid ni bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yid ni bya ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because mind is not by nature action,

original: las nyid du mi srid pas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa ni las so //
analyzed: las nyid du mi srid pas de dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems pa ni las so //
translated: Since action is impossible, the intention concomitant with it is the action.

original: de la 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis dri ba gleng bar mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'dir 'di dpyad par bya ste zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis dri ba gleng bar mdzad pa ste /
translated: Here, this should be investigated means that the master raises a question.

original: de'i phyogs gtan la phab nas phyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyogs gtan la phab nas phyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: After determining his position, he will later refute it.

original: re zhig lus kyi rnam par rig byed ces bya ba la sogs par rgya cher 'byung bas ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag rang gi phyogs rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: re zhig lus kyi rnam par rig byed ces bya ba la sogs par rgya cher 'byung bas ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag rang gi phyogs rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas set forth their own position in the passage beginning with “First, the bodily expression” and so on.

original: re zhig lus kyi rnam par rig byed ces bya ba la //
analyzed: re zhig lus kyi rnam par rig byed ces bya ba la //
translated: First, the bodily expression.

original: re zhig gi sgras ni rnam par rig byed cig shos rnam par gcod par @64b mdzad do //
analyzed: re zhig gi sgras ni rnam par rig byed cig shos rnam par gcod par @64b mdzad do //
translated: The word first excludes the other expression.

original: de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Arisen from the mind that observes that means

original: de'i sgras ni dbyibs la snyegs so //
analyzed: de'i sgras ni dbyibs la snyegs so //
translated: the word that refers to shape.

original: gang la lag pa la sogs pa dbyibs kyi dmigs pa yod pa de ni de la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang la lag pa la sogs pa dbyibs kyi dmigs pa yod pa de ni de la dmigs pa'o //
translated: That which has the observed object of shape, such as the arms, is observed in that.🔽The Vaibhāṣikas say: The body is the basis of action.

original: de ni de la dmigs pa yang yin la sems kyang yin pas de la dmigs pa'i sems te /
analyzed: de ni de la dmigs pa yang yin la sems kyang yin pas de la dmigs pa'i sems te /
translated: It is the mind that has that as its object, because it is both that and an object of the mind.

original: 'jug par byed pa'i sems so //
analyzed: 'jug par byed pa'i sems so //
translated: It is the instigating mind.

original: de las skyes pas na de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa yin te //
analyzed: de las skyes pas na de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa yin te //
translated: It is produced from the mind that has that as its object, because it arises from that.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: dbyibs kyi rnam par rig byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi rnam par rig byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is the informative form of shape.

original: 'di skad du mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus kyi las rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'i dbyibs yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du mchod rten la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems gang yin pa de'i dmigs pa ni ma 'ongs pa'i lus kyi las rnam par rig byed ces bya ba'i dbyibs yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: In other words, the object of the mind that instigates the worship of a stupa, etc., is the shape of the future bodily informative form. It is not anything else.

original: de'i phyir sems de lta bus kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rig byed ni de las skyes pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems de lta bus kun nas bslang ba'i rnam par rig byed ni de las skyes pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the informative form that is instigated by such a mind is produced from that.

original: gang gi zhes bya ba ni rgol bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi zhes bya ba ni rgol bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The opponent says, “What is that?”

original: 'di yang g-ya' g-yon 'dug pa 'ga' zhig yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di yang g-ya' g-yon 'dug pa 'ga' zhig yin gyi /
translated: This is some kind of a nitpicking opponent.

original: slob dpon ni ma yin na lus kyi yin no zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag go //
analyzed: slob dpon ni ma yin na lus kyi yin no zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag go //
translated: The Vaibhasikas say: The body is the master.

original: gal te lus kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te lus kyi yin no zhes bya ba ni rgol bar byed pa yin te /
translated: If the body is the master, this is a response.🔽The intention is this: Since the meaning is understood through the teaching of any one of the three divisions, there is no other proof apart from that.

original: de'i bsam pa ni rnam par dbye ba gang yang rung ba zhig bstan pas don rtogs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na de lus kyis byas pa'i las zhes bya zhes smos nas lus kyi zhes bya ste /🔽tha snyad gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni rnam par dbye ba gang yang rung ba zhig bstan pas don rtogs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sgrub pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar na de lus kyis byas pa'i las zhes bya zhes smos nas lus kyi zhes bya ste / tha snyad gnyi ga yang med do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore how can it be called a body karma?🔽The body is the master.

original: lus zhes bya ba spyi'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas bye brag tu smra ba pa dag tha snyad gnyi ga gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba spyi'i yan lag tu gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung bas bye brag tu smra ba pa dag tha snyad gnyi ga gzhung 'dzugs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The Vaibhasikas establish both conventions through the statement, Because the body is a general member.

original: lus ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa ste khog pa ril la bya la /
analyzed: lus ni 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa ste khog pa ril la bya la /
translated: The body is a collection of the primary elements and those derived from the primary elements and it is the entire torso.

original: las ni lag pa la sogs pa nyi tshe la yod pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: las ni lag pa la sogs pa nyi tshe la yod pa ma yin nam //
translated: Is action not found in the hand and so on?

original: ji ltar na lus kyi'am //
analyzed: ji ltar na lus kyi'am //
translated: How can it be of the body?

original: lus kyi zhes bya zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma khong na sa dbyung ba 'di sems la bsdogs nas spyi dag la yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so //🔽de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa zhes bya ba ci dgos she na zhes bya ba 'dir 'dri ba po de'i bsam pa ni sems las byung ba'i phyir //🔽sems las skyes pa zhes bya ba kho nar bstan pa'i rigs na ci'i phyir de la @65a * //
analyzed: lus kyi zhes bya zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga ma khong na sa dbyung ba 'di sems la bsdogs nas spyi dag la yod ces bya ba la sogs pa smras so // de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa zhes bya ba ci dgos she na zhes bya ba 'dir 'dri ba po de'i bsam pa ni sems las byung ba'i phyir // sems las skyes pa zhes bya ba kho nar bstan pa'i rigs na ci'i phyir de la @65a * //
translated: The opponent’s position is stated in the phrase “of the body” in the root text.🔽What is the point of the phrase “arisen from a mind that observes that”?🔽The opponent’s thought is this: It is correct to say that it is called “arisen from the mind” because it is a mental factor.

original: dmigs pa'i zhes smos pa byas she na zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i zhes smos pa byas she na zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Why did the author of the root text add the phrase “that observes that”?

original: brgal zhing brtag pa de la bye brag tu smra ba pa rnams kyis smra ba na mchu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: brgal zhing brtag pa de la bye brag tu smra ba pa rnams kyis smra ba na mchu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan btab pa yin te /
translated: The Vaibhāṣika respond to this objection in the following verse:

original: de ni de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: de ni de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni //
translated: It is not arisen from a mind that observes that.

original: mchu la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni dbyibs la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mchu la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni dbyibs la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the shape of the lips, etc. does not arise from a mind that observes shape.

original: mchu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pas ni 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: mchu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pas ni 'byed pa dang 'dzums pa la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “the shape of the lips, etc.” includes the opening and closing of the lips, etc.

original: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why does it not arise from that?

original: de'i phyir tshig la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: To answer this, the root text states, “because it arises from a mind that observes speech.”

original: 'di skad du smra bar byed pa ni 'di la tshig 'dis brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'di khong du chud par bya'o zhes tshig la dmigs nas tshig tu 'don par byed do //
analyzed: 'di skad du smra bar byed pa ni 'di la tshig 'dis brjod par 'dod pa'i don 'di khong du chud par bya'o zhes tshig la dmigs nas tshig tu 'don par byed do //
translated: The following is what is being said: One observes speech and then utters speech, thinking, “By means of this speech, this meaning that I wish to express will be understood.”

original: de'i phyir tshig la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Therefore, since it arises from a mind that observes speech,

original: mchu la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni dbyibs la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mchu la sogs pa'i dbyibs ni dbyibs la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: the shape of the lips, etc. does not arise from a mind that observes shape.

original: sngon gyi smon lam gyi sems las skyes pa yang gyur na mi rung ba ste zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mchu bim pa ltar dmar pa la sogs pa de dang de ltar gyur cig ces sngon smon lam btab pa gang yin pa de'i sems las skyes pa
analyzed: sngon gyi smon lam gyi sems las skyes pa yang gyur na mi rung ba ste zhes bya ba ni bdag gi mchu bim pa ltar dmar pa la sogs pa de dang de ltar gyur cig ces sngon smon lam btab pa gang yin pa de'i sems las skyes pa
translated: The meaning of that is: it is not suitable to arise from the mind that formerly prayed, “May my lips be red like bimba fruit and so on.”

original: yang der gyur na mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i sems gzhan las kyang skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan sngon gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa dge ba'i sems gang yin pa rgyur 'gyur ba'i khyad par thob pa de las kyang skyes so zhes bya ba'i don
analyzed: yang der gyur na mi rung ngo zhes bya ba'i don to // rnam par smin pa'i rgyu'i sems gzhan las kyang skyes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni de las gzhan sngon gyi rnam par smin pa'i rgyur gyur pa dge ba'i sems gang yin pa rgyur 'gyur ba'i khyad par thob pa de las kyang skyes so zhes bya ba'i don
translated: It is also not suitable to arise from that.🔽The meaning of that is: it also arises from another mind that is the cause of karmic maturation.🔽The meaning of that is: it also arises from another mind that is the cause of karmic maturation, a virtuous mind that obtains a special cause that becomes the cause of karmic maturation.

original: to // 'dis kyang de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i 'bras bu can du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: to // 'dis kyang de la dmigs pa'i sems las skyes pa kho na yin no zhes nges par bzung ba'i 'bras bu can du bstan pa yin no //
translated: This also teaches that it is ascertained to arise only from a mind that focuses on it.

original: ci'i phyir de rnam par rig byed ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni sgra dri ba yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir de rnam par rig byed ces bya zhe na zhes bya ba ni sgra dri ba yin no //
translated: This is the question.

original: phyi rol la bskyod pa'i 'gyur ba dag gis ni zhes bya ba ni sems las phyi rol du bskyod pas te byung ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol la bskyod pa'i 'gyur ba dag gis ni zhes bya ba ni sems las phyi rol du bskyod pas te byung ba'o //
translated: By changes in external form, means by changes that move out from the mind.

original: 'gyur ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gyur ba dag gis zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa'i g-yo ba dag gis zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: By changes, means by movements of the hands, etc.

original: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sems pa'o //
translated: Intention is the will.

original: mtsho na gnas pa'i nya ni rab gab kyang //
analyzed: mtsho na gnas pa'i nya ni rab gab kyang //
translated: Even if a fish in a lake hides well,

original: zhes bya ba la @65b sogs pas ni dpe bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la @65b sogs pas ni dpe bstan to //
translated: The example is indicated by even if, etc.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma'i don ni rtogs par zad do //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma'i don ni rtogs par zad do //
translated: The meaning of the remaining verses is self-evident.

original: de ltar rgya cher lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / slob dpon gyis de'i mtshan nyid sun dbyung bar zhes nas /
analyzed: de ltar rgya cher lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyi mtshan nyid rnam par gzhag pa dang / slob dpon gyis de'i mtshan nyid sun dbyung bar zhes nas /
translated: Thus, having presented in detail the definition of bodily informative form, the master now criticizes that definition.

original: 'o na dbyibs zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na dbyibs zhes bya ba 'di ci yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: What is this so-called shape?

original: dbyibs shig grub na ni de'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi rnam par rig byed rtogs par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dbyibs shig grub na ni de'i bdag nyid kyi lus kyi rnam par rig byed rtogs par nus kyi gzhan du ni ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: If a shape exists, then one can understand the informative form of the body that has that as its nature, but not otherwise.

original: 'di lta ste ring po la sogs pa'i zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag go //
analyzed: 'di lta ste ring po la sogs pa'i zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag go //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say, “For example, long and so on.”

original: ring po la sogs pa 'di ci yin zhes gsungs pa ni slob dpon te /
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa 'di ci yin zhes gsungs pa ni slob dpon te /
translated: The Master says, “What is this long and so on?”

original: 'di las ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na //
analyzed: 'di las ma grub pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na //
translated: This is not an established entity.

original: ji ltar dper brjod ces bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar dper brjod ces bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: What is the example?

original: gang las ring po ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag ste /
analyzed: gang las ring po ba'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say, “That which is longer and so on.”

original: ring po la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub na 'di la ci zhig the tshom za bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub na 'di la ci zhig the tshom za bar 'gyur //
translated: If long and so on are established by the valid knowledge of direct perception, what doubt can there be about this?

original: sbyor ba ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is established by the valid knowledge of direct perception exists,

original: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs lta bu yin la /
translated: like, for example, the form of blue and so on.

original: ring po la sogs pa yang mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa yin no //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa yang mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa yin no //
translated: Length, etc. are also established by the valid knowledge of direct perception.

original: yod pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa tsam nyid kyis yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so snyam du sems so //
analyzed: yod pa nyid ni mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa tsam nyid kyis yod pa nyid yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so snyam du sems so //
translated: Since existence is existence merely by the establishment of it by the valid knowledge of direct perception, it is a natural reason.

original: skye mched gang yin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis re zhig de'i phyogs kho na sun dbyung ba'i phyir bstan par mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched gang yin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis re zhig de'i phyogs kho na sun dbyung ba'i phyir bstan par mdzad pa ste /
translated: What is the source? The master states this in order to refute that position for the time being.

original: gal te dbyibs de rdzas su yod na skye mched bcu gnyis dag gis ni rdzas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir de skye mched gang du 'du zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te dbyibs de rdzas su yod na skye mched bcu gnyis dag gis ni rdzas thams cad bsdus pa'i phyir de skye mched gang du 'du zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: If that shape exists substantially, since all substances are included in the twelve sources, he thinks, “In which source is it included?”

original: gzugs kyi skye mched do zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag ste /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched do zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba dag ste /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say, “It is the form source.”

original: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' las gzugs ni rnam par gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di ltar grub pa'i mtha' las gzugs ni rnam par gnyis te /
translated: Thus it is stated in the treatise: Form is twofold:🔽color and shape.

original: kha dog dang / dbyibs so zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched du 'dus so //
analyzed: kha dog dang / dbyibs so zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir gzugs kyi skye mched du 'dus so //
translated: Therefore it is included in the form source.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni slob dpon dri ba gleng bar mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba ni slob dpon dri ba gleng bar mdzad pa yin no //
translated: “If” is the master’s question.

original: kha dog bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid grub pa kho dog gi rngul phra rab rdzas su yod pa cha shas so //
analyzed: kha dog bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi mtshan nyid grub pa kho dog gi rngul phra rab rdzas su yod pa cha shas so //
translated: “Like color” means that just as the nature of blue, etc., is established as the characteristic of color, the subtle particles of color, which are substantially existent, are not different from the color that is their collection.

original: du ma ni de 'dus pa la yang tha mi dad par 'jug pa yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: du ma ni de 'dus pa la yang tha mi dad par 'jug pa yin par 'dod na /
translated: And it is asserted that the color that is their collection is not different from the subtle particles.

original: ci dbyibs kyang de lta bur 'dod @66a * //
analyzed: ci dbyibs kyang de lta bur 'dod @66a * //
translated: So too, is shape asserted in that way?🔽Or is it a particular arrangement of subtle particles?

original: dam ; 'on te rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa zhig yin zhes bya ba ni ci de rdul phra rab kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid rnams 'dus pa zhig yin par 'dod dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dam ; 'on te rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa zhig yin zhes bya ba ni ci de rdul phra rab kyi bye brag gi bdag nyid rnams 'dus pa zhig yin par 'dod dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means: Is it asserted that shape is the collection of subtle particles that have the nature of particular arrangements?

original: 'on te kha dog la sogs pa 'dus pa la khyab pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni ci de bye brag pa rnams kyi cha shas can bzhin du /
analyzed: 'on te kha dog la sogs pa 'dus pa la khyab pa'i rdzas zhes bya ba ni ci de bye brag pa rnams kyi cha shas can bzhin du /
translated: Or is it a substance that pervades color, etc., that is the collection?🔽This means: Is it like the whole of the Vaiśeṣikas?

original: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i kha dog la khyab pa zhig tu 'dod dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dri dang / ro dang / reg bya'i kha dog la khyab pa zhig tu 'dod dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Does it pervade the color of smell, taste, and tactility?

original: de ni rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not tenable in any way.

original: nyes pa rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa gsum yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there are three faults.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gal te rdul phra rab kyi bye brag zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te rdul phra rab kyi bye brag zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If it is a particular of a subtle particle, etc.

original: 'di skad du gal te rdul phra mo'i bye brag la ring po la sogs pa de'i blo skye ba'i rgyur 'dod na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te rdul phra mo'i bye brag la ring po la sogs pa de'i blo skye ba'i rgyur 'dod na /
translated: If it is asserted that the cause of the cognition of long, etc. is a particular of a subtle particle,

original: de lta na ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa de'i cha shas re re la yang sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi rdul phra rab las ma gtogs par dbyibs de bzung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa de'i cha shas re re la yang sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog gi rdul phra rab las ma gtogs par dbyibs de bzung bar 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case, the shape would be apprehended in each part of the aggregation of the elements and those derived from the elements, apart from the subtle particles of color such as blue, etc.

original: dper na kha dog bzhin du 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na kha dog bzhin du 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: It would be like color, but that is not the case.

original: sbyor ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni med par tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de ni med par tha snyad gdags pa'i yul yin te /
translated: The application is that non-apprehension of what has become the object of apprehension is the object of the designation of non-existence.

original: dper na bong bu'i rva lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na bong bu'i rva lta bu yin la /
translated: For example, it is like the horn of a donkey.

original: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyang kha dog gi rdul phra rab las logs shig na mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyang kha dog gi rdul phra rab las logs shig na mi dmigs pas /
translated: Also, the shape of a long one, etc. is not apprehended separately from the atoms of color.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is the non-apprehension of an intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar de lta bur gyur pa yod pa la dmigs pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de lta bur gyur pa yod pa la dmigs pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that way, it is pervaded by the apprehension of what exists.

original: 'di thams cad kyis ni phyogs snga ma smra bas mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs sbyar ba de ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni phyogs snga ma smra bas mngon sum gyi tshad mas grub pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs sbyar ba de ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: All of this demonstrates that the opponent’s application of the reason, “because it is established by the valid knowledge of direct perception,” is not established.

original: gal te 'o na ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa ji ltar dmigs par 'gyur zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one says, “In that case, how is a long one, a short one, etc. apprehended?” it is not so.

original: de ni 'og nas sngon po la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa dag kho nas ring po la sogs pa'i blo skyed do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni 'og nas sngon po la sogs pa de ltar gnas pa dag kho nas ring po la sogs pa'i blo skyed do zhes sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, as will be explained below, it is only the blue and so on that exist in that way that give rise to the cognition of long and so on.

original: 'on te rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci ste dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa zhig tu 'dad na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa zhig yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ci ste dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa zhig tu 'dad na ni /
translated: If you say that it is a collection of subtle particles, then what is the difference between the collection of subtle particles of shape and the collection of subtle particles of color?🔽If you say that it is a collection of subtle particles of shape, then what is the difference between the collection of subtle particles of shape that is designated as long, short, and so on and the collection of subtle particles of color?

original: ring po dang thung ngu la sogs par ming btags pa dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa gang gis na dbyibs rdul phra rab dmigs kyis ma phye ba'i rang bzhin dag 'dus pa la dbyibs zhes bya ba de kha dog gi @66b rdul phra rab
analyzed: ring po dang thung ngu la sogs par ming btags pa dbyibs kyi rdul phra rab kyi bye brag 'dus pa gang gis na dbyibs rdul phra rab dmigs kyis ma phye ba'i rang bzhin dag 'dus pa la dbyibs zhes bya ba de kha dog gi @66b rdul phra rab
translated: The nature of the subtle particles of shape is not distinguished from the subtle particles of color.

original: kyi bye brag 'dus pa las khyad par ci yod de /
analyzed: kyi bye brag 'dus pa las khyad par ci yod de /
translated: What is the difference between the collection of subtle particles of shape and the collection of subtle particles of color?

original: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa de dag kho na 'dus pa'i khyad par las ring po la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po la sogs pa de dag kho na 'dus pa'i khyad par las ring po la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don 'di bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of this is that long and so on are due to the difference of the collection of just those blue and so on.

original: 'on te kha dog la sogs pa 'dus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du gal te dri dang // ro dang / reg bya'i kha dog la khyab pa gcig pu zhig dbyibs su 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te kha dog la sogs pa 'dus pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'di skad du gal te dri dang // ro dang / reg bya'i kha dog la khyab pa gcig pu zhig dbyibs su 'dod na /
translated: then, as it is said, “if you think that the collection of smells, tastes, and tactile objects is shape,”

original: de gcig pu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / cha shas med pa'i phyir ka ba la sogs pa'i cha shas re re la yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de gcig pu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / cha shas med pa'i phyir ka ba la sogs pa'i cha shas re re la yang dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: then, because it is a single thing, and because it is partless, it would be perceived in each part of a pillar, etc.

original: de cha shas re re la yang khyab pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de cha shas re re la yang khyab pa nyid du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would exist in each part.

original: de lta yang ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na khyab par byed pa gcig pu de yod pa ma yin pas snga ma bzhin du gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na khyab par byed pa gcig pu de yod pa ma yin pas snga ma bzhin du gang zhig dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since that single pervader does not exist, as before, the application of the non-apprehension of the pervader should be understood as “wherever the perceptible exists, etc.”

original: yang na de gcig pu ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: yang na de gcig pu ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Or, if you think that it is not a single thing, etc.,🔽then, as it is said, “if you think that shape is the collection of many colors, etc.,”

original: bsam pa ni khyab pa la cha 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir de la nges par cha yod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: bsam pa ni khyab pa la cha 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir de la nges par cha yod par bya dgos so //
translated: The intention is that, since the pervader is not mistaken with respect to the part, it must be made certain that it exists in part.

original: de bas na rdzas ni gcig pa'i rgyu can nyid du mi 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rdzas ni gcig pa'i rgyu can nyid du mi 'grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the argument: it is not established that substance has a single cause.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang la cha dang char rnam par gnas pa yod pa de dang de ni yang dag par na gcig pa nyid med de //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang la cha dang char rnam par gnas pa yod pa de dang de ni yang dag par na gcig pa nyid med de //
translated: The application is this: whatever has a part and is situated in parts does not exist as a real unity.

original: dper na dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na dmag dang nags tshal la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
translated: For example, like an army, a forest, and so on.

original: dbyibs kyang cha dang char rnam par gnas pa yin pas /
analyzed: dbyibs kyang cha dang char rnam par gnas pa yin pas /
translated: And shape is situated in parts and is a part.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the contradiction of the pervader is observed.

original: 'di ltar cha can dang / cha can ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pas 'gal ba yin ta /
analyzed: 'di ltar cha can dang / cha can ma yin pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pas 'gal ba yin ta /
translated: In this way, the whole and the partless are mutually exclusive, because they are contradictory.

original: gcig nyid la cha can ma yin pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid la cha can ma yin pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of being a whole, it is pervaded by not being partless.

original: de bas na de ni cha can 'gal ba dmigs pa na /
analyzed: de bas na de ni cha can 'gal ba dmigs pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the contradiction of the whole is observed,

original: khyab par byed pa cha can ma yin pa ldog go //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa cha can ma yin pa ldog go //
translated: the pervader, the partless, is eliminated.

original: de log na /
analyzed: de log na /
translated: If that is refuted,

original: des khyab par bya ba gcig nyid ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des khyab par bya ba gcig nyid ldog pa yin no //
translated: then the pervasion is refuted.

original: ci ste pha rol po gal te dbyibs gcig pa nyid med du zin kyang des cir 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po gal te dbyibs gcig pa nyid med du zin kyang des cir 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: But if the opponent thinks, “Even if there is no such thing as a single shape, so what?🔽”

original: de'i phyir skye mched pa bcu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'di skad du rdzas ni gcig pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pas de med na rdzas med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir skye mched pa bcu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'di skad du rdzas ni gcig pa'i rgyu can nyid yin pas de med na rdzas med pa'i phyir /
translated: then the root text says, “The ten bases are substantial,” and so on.

original: skye mched bcu ni rdzas su yod do zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye mched bcu ni rdzas su yod do zhes bya ba'i grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal lo zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is to say that the opponent’s view contradicts the tenet that “The ten bases are substantial,” because a substance must have a single cause, and if that is not possible, then the substance does not exist.

original: gzhan yang @67a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang @67a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: gzegs zan pa'i gzhung gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
analyzed: gzegs zan pa'i gzhung gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
translated: this other fault also arises from the opponent’s view.

original: spel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsos par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: spel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gsos par 'gyur bas zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “It would be increased” means it would be enhanced.

original: ci ste gzhan gal te dbyibs zhes bya ba yong ye med na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gal te dbyibs zhes bya ba yong ye med na /
translated: But if the opponent thinks, “If shape does not exist at all,

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten na grags pa ring po la sogs pa'i blo med par mi 'gyur snyam du sems par dogs nas /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten na grags pa ring po la sogs pa'i blo med par mi 'gyur snyam du sems par dogs nas /
translated: How could the cognition of long, etc., which is renowned in the world, not exist?

original: phyogs gcig gi sgor zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs gcig gi sgor zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Fearing that one might think this, he says, “In one part of the door, etc.,”

original: 'di skad du nged yong ye dbyibs med do zhes ni mi zer te /
analyzed: 'di skad du nged yong ye dbyibs med do zhes ni mi zer te /
translated: and he says, “We do not say that shape does not exist at all.

original: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba pa la sogs pas rdzas su btags pa de lta bur ni med kyi /
analyzed: ji ltar bye brag tu smra ba pa la sogs pas rdzas su btags pa de lta bur ni med kyi /
translated: It does not exist as it is imagined by the Vaibhāṣikas, as a substance.

original: 'jig rten gyi grags pa yang med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi grags pa yang med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not nonexistent in the world.🔽For this reason, you should understand that long, etc., shape does not exist as a substance.

original: 'di'i phyir yang ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs rdzas su med par gsal bar shes par gyis shig / gang gi phyir zhe na ri mo bkram pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs rdzas su med par gsal bar shes par gyis shig / gang gi phyir zhe na ri mo bkram pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Why? “Because of the appearance of a picture.”

original: khab ris la sogs pa'o //🔽de dang de lta bur snang ba la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khab ris la sogs pa'o // de dang de lta bur snang ba la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: A picture is a painting, etc.

original: ri dags dang / phag la sogs pa'i gzugs tha dad par ro //
analyzed: ri dags dang / phag la sogs pa'i gzugs tha dad par ro //
translated: “In that and that way” means in the form of a deer, a pig, etc.

original: 'di skad du 'di ni ri mo bkram pa la sogs pa dbyibs sna tshogs dmigs pa de yang nam zhig rung ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'di ni ri mo bkram pa la sogs pa dbyibs sna tshogs dmigs pa de yang nam zhig rung ste /
translated: This is what is being said: “The observation of various shapes such as a painting is possible at any time.

original: gal te dbyibs rdzas su med na ni rung gi /
analyzed: gal te dbyibs rdzas su med na ni rung gi /
translated: If shape does not exist as a substance, then that is acceptable.

original: gzhan du na de mi srid pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du na de mi srid pa kho na'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, it is absolutely impossible.”

original: brgya la gzhan dag 'di skad du rdzas su yod par khas blangs kyang /
analyzed: brgya la gzhan dag 'di skad du rdzas su yod par khas blangs kyang /
translated: If others say, “We accept that shape exists as a substance,

original: ci'i phyir de ltar mi srid ces smra bar gyur na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar mi srid ces smra bar gyur na /
translated: why do you say that it is impossible?”

original: de'i phyir dbyibs rigs tha dad pa dag ni yul gcig par rigs pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs rigs tha dad pa dag ni yul gcig par rigs pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: then the root text states, “It is also illogical for different types of shapes to exist in the same place.”

original: rigs tha dad pa dag ces bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa dag ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa dag ces bya ba ni rang bzhin tha dad pa dag ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Different types of shapes means different natures.

original: dper na kha dog dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams ni phan tshun lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bas 'gal ba'i phyir phyogs gcig tu gnas pa med do //
analyzed: dper na kha dog dag bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog rang bzhin tha dad pa rnams ni phan tshun lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal bas 'gal ba'i phyir phyogs gcig tu gnas pa med do //
translated: For example, like colors. Just as colors such as blue, which are different in nature, are mutually incompatible because of the characteristic of non-coexistence, and therefore do not exist in one place,

original: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs rnams kyang de bzhin du mi 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: ring po la sogs pa'i dbyibs rnams kyang de bzhin du mi 'dod par bya'o //
translated: so also shapes such as long, etc. should not be accepted.

original: 'on gal te mig btsums nas 'ol byir 'di skad du 'gal ba rnams kyang yul gcig pa kho na yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on gal te mig btsums nas 'ol byir 'di skad du 'gal ba rnams kyang yul gcig pa kho na yin no zhes zer na /
translated: But if, with eyes closed, one were to say, “Even incompatible things are in one place only,”

original: de'i phyir 'on kyang 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'on kyang 'gyur na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then the verse says, “But if they were, etc.”

original: 'gal ba rnams phyogs gcig na yod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'gal ba rnams phyogs gcig na yod par 'gyur na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that incompatible things would exist in one place.

original: phyogs thams cad du @67b dbyibs thams cad kyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs thams cad du @67b dbyibs thams cad kyi blo 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig na zhes bya ba ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If all shapes were in all places, then the cognition of all shapes would occur everywhere. Why?

original: dbyibs re re'i yul gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyibs re re'i yul gang yin pa de ni thams cad kyi yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of each shape is the object of all.

original: de lta bas na dbyibs zhes bya ba'i rdzas gzhan ni med kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mjug sdud pa bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na dbyibs zhes bya ba'i rdzas gzhan ni med kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ji skad du bshad pa'i mjug sdud pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore, there is no substance called “shape,” etc.

original: gal te de lta na thag ring po nas kha dog 'dus pa dmigs kyis mi phyed pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dus pa la dbyibs kyi blo 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na thag ring po nas kha dog 'dus pa dmigs kyis mi phyed pa bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te sngon po la sogs pa'i kha dog 'dus pa la dbyibs kyi blo 'byung na /
translated: If that is so, then just as one does not discern a collection of colors from a distance, etc. If the cognition of shape arises in regard to a collection of colors such as blue, etc.,

original: thag ring po nas de mi 'dzin bzhin du dbyibs 'dzin pa ji lta bu ste /
analyzed: thag ring po nas de mi 'dzin bzhin du dbyibs 'dzin pa ji lta bu ste /
translated: then just as one does not apprehend shape without apprehending that collection from a distance,

original: de 'dzin pa kho nas de 'dzin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dzin pa kho nas de 'dzin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: one thinks that one apprehends that collection by apprehending shape, and not otherwise.🔽One does not discern shapes separately,

original: re zhig dbyibs dag dmigs kyis mi phyed bzhin du /
analyzed: re zhig dbyibs dag dmigs kyis mi phyed bzhin du /
translated: but one does discern a collection of colors.

original: de'i dngar ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon nyid kyis lan ma btab par gzhan la rmed par mdzad pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i dngar ka zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon nyid kyis lan ma btab par gzhan la rmed par mdzad pa yin te /
translated: The master himself does not answer this, but rather asks another question.

original: gzhan dag yul de lta bu la brtsad pa na /
analyzed: gzhan dag yul de lta bu la brtsad pa na /
translated: What else can they say when they are challenged about such objects?

original: gzhan ci zhig smra bar 'gyur te cung zad kyang smra ba med kyi /
analyzed: gzhan ci zhig smra bar 'gyur te cung zad kyang smra ba med kyi /
translated: They can say nothing at all.

original: 'on kyang de nyid de lta bur snang ngo zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid de lta bur snang ngo zhes smra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: They can only say that it appears to be so.

original: des na kho bo'i rigs pa yang de nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na kho bo'i rigs pa yang de nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, our reasoning is just like that.

original: dbyibs dag dmigs kyis mi phyed bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang dag la dbyibs dmigs kyis mi phyed pa yod pa de dag ni dbyings dmigs kyis mi phyed pa dag go //
analyzed: dbyibs dag dmigs kyis mi phyed bzhin du zhes bya ba ni gang dag la dbyibs dmigs kyis mi phyed pa yod pa de dag ni dbyings dmigs kyis mi phyed pa dag go //
translated: With regard to the phrase “without distinguishing shapes,” those that have shapes that cannot be distinguished are shapes that cannot be distinguished.

original: dbyibs de dag dmigs kyis mi phyed bzhin du ste /
analyzed: dbyibs de dag dmigs kyis mi phyed bzhin du ste /
translated: Without distinguishing those shapes,

original: gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: what?

original: shing dag gi zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: shing dag gi zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “of the trees” is an ellipsis.

original: de'i dngar ka dang / tshogs dag gi zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: de'i dngar ka dang / tshogs dag gi zhes bya ba de la /
translated: With regard to the phrase “of the rows and the collections,”

original: dngar ka ni go rims dang tshar zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngar ka ni go rims dang tshar zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: a row is a sequence, that is, an order.

original: tshogs ni 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs ni 'dus pa'o //
translated: A collection is an aggregation.

original: shing de dag gi dngar ka dang / tshogs dag ni de'i dngar ka dang / chogs zhes bya bar tshig sbyar ro //
analyzed: shing de dag gi dngar ka dang / tshogs dag ni de'i dngar ka dang / chogs zhes bya bar tshig sbyar ro //
translated: The trunks of those trees, and the trunks of those collections, are their trunks. The word “collection” is to be applied.

original: gzhan yang 'dir brgal na gzhan dag lan ci zhig 'debs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir brgal na gzhan dag lan ci zhig 'debs par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if one were to debate with them here, what answer would they give?

original: de'i phyir / gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he says “in both cases” and so on.

original: gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang / dbyibs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang / dbyibs su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “In both cases” means in terms of color and shape.

original: dmigs kyis mi phyed la zhes bya ba ni gtan la mi phebs la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmigs kyis mi phyed la zhes bya ba ni gtan la mi phebs la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Not distinguished” means not ascertained.🔽“What is that?” means “apart from color and shape, what is that which appears? ”

original: de ni ci snang zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs las ma gtogs par snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i snang ba las gzhan ni khas ma blangs @68a * //🔽so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni ci snang zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs las ma gtogs par snang bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa'i snang ba las gzhan ni khas ma blangs @68a * // so zhes bya bar dgongs pa'o //
translated: The idea is that one does not accept any appearance other than those.

original: de lta bas na de'i tshe kha dog ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de'i tshe kha dog ces bya ba la sogs pas ni lan gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, at that time, he says “color” and so on in response.

original: 'di skad du 'u bu cag gis de na ci snang zhes dris pa na brgyangs kyang 'di skad ces de'i tshe kha dog mi gsal bar 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod dgos so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du 'u bu cag gis de na ci snang zhes dris pa na brgyangs kyang 'di skad ces de'i tshe kha dog mi gsal bar 'dzin pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di brjod dgos so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: If you ask, What appears there? they must say, At that time, the unclear apprehension of color appears, not anything else.

original: de'i phyir dbyibs kyi rnam par rig byed mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba 'dis ni bye brag tu smra ba pa'i phyogs rgya cher sun phyung nas mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs kyi rnam par rig byed mi 'grub bo zhes bya ba 'dis ni bye brag tu smra ba pa'i phyogs rgya cher sun phyung nas mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, this statement, Shape is not established as informative action, concludes the extensive refutation of the Vaibhāṣika position.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa rnams so //
translated: Others refers to the noble Saṃmatīya school.

original: de dag ni 'di skad du yang dag par na dbyibs med pa'i phyir lus g-yo ba'i gnas skabs kyi 'gro ba kho na yin gyi dbyibs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'di skad du yang dag par na dbyibs med pa'i phyir lus g-yo ba'i gnas skabs kyi 'gro ba kho na yin gyi dbyibs ni ma yin no //
translated: They say, In reality, since shape does not exist, it is only the movement of the body that is going, not shape.

original: de bas na de nyid rnam par rig byed yin par rigs kyi dbyibs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid rnam par rig byed yin par rigs kyi dbyibs ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that that very movement is informative action, not shape.

original: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub pa rnams ni grub par byed pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir kho bo cag gi phyogs la ni ji skad bshad pa'i bsgrub pa rnams ni grub par byed pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, in our own system, the proofs that have been explained are indeed proofs.

original: 'phos pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na zhes bya ba ni /🔽mngon sum gyi tshad mas sam //
analyzed: 'phos pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na zhes bya ba ni / mngon sum gyi tshad mas sam //
translated: Where is it said that this is the transmigrator?🔽Is it said by means of direct perception?

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas gtan la 'be bas sam ci na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas gtan la 'be bas sam ci na /
translated: Or is it said by means of inference?

original: gang gi phyir 'di snyam du de nyid yul gzhan du 'phos pa 'di yin gyi der gzhan kho na zhig byung ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di snyam du de nyid yul gzhan du 'phos pa 'di yin gyi der gzhan kho na zhig byung ba ni ma yin no snyam du sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because of this, it is as if one thinks, “This is the transmigrator that has gone to another place, and not that another has arisen there.”

original: khyad par nges par mi zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni lan btab bo //
analyzed: khyad par nges par mi zin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni lan btab bo //
translated: This is the reply: because the distinction is not ascertained.

original: de ni 'di skad du don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du don 'di ni rjes su dpag pas grub pa kho na yin te /
translated: This is what is being said: This meaning is established by inference alone.

original: 'di ltar gal te de 'pho bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te de 'pho bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because of this, if it were not the case that this transmigrates,

original: 'on kyang der khyad par can gzhan kho na zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'on kyang der khyad par can gzhan kho na zhig 'byung bar 'gyur na /
translated: but rather that another with a different nature arises there,🔽then the distinction would be ascertained.

original: 'o na ni khyad par 'byung ba de nges par zin par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni khyad par 'byung ba de nges par zin par 'gyur ba zhig na de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: But if the difference were ascertained, then it would not be so.

original: de bas na der gzhan mi skye ste /
analyzed: de bas na der gzhan mi skye ste /
translated: Therefore, another does not arise there.

original: 'on kyang de nyid 'pho ba yin par shes so zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid 'pho ba yin par shes so zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: But rather, it is understood that it is just that which is transferred.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las khyad par mi dmigs pa de ni de las tha dad pa med de //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang las khyad par mi dmigs pa de ni de las tha dad pa med de //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not observed to be different from something else is not different from it,

original: dper na rang bzhin gcig po de nyid rang las tha dad pa med pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na rang bzhin gcig po de nyid rang las tha dad pa med pa lta bu yin la /
translated: like that very thing itself, which is not different from itself.

original: snga ma'i rang bzhin las kyang yul gzhan du 'phos pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par mi dmigs so //
analyzed: snga ma'i rang bzhin las kyang yul gzhan du 'phos pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par mi dmigs so //
translated: And the difference of the nature of that which is transferred to another place is not observed from the nature of the original thing.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa yod pa nyid ni @68b dmigs pas khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa yod pa nyid ni @68b dmigs pas khyab pa'i phyir rang bzhin mi dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, since the existence of difference is pervaded by observation, the non-observation of nature is established.

original: me dang / nyi ma dang / chab bro ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis pha rol pos gtan tshigs sbyor ba ma nges pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: me dang / nyi ma dang / chab bro ma zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis pha rol pos gtan tshigs sbyor ba ma nges pa nyid du gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Fire, the sun, salt, and so on, the master has stated that the opponent's application of the reason is indeterminate.

original: phrad pa ni 'brel ba yin no /
analyzed: phrad pa ni 'brel ba yin no /
translated: Contact is connection.

original: kun tu reg ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun tu reg ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for complete contact.

original: phrad ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni dus ring por dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: phrad ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni dus ring por dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Immediately upon contact means in order to refute a long period of time.

original: dus ring por phrad pa la ni khyad par dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus ring por phrad pa la ni khyad par dmigs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because if there were a long period of contact, the difference would be observed.

original: bral bar gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni reg ma thag tu gyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bral bar gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni reg ma thag tu gyes zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the case of separation means immediately upon contact, it is a synonym for separation.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: me dang / nyi ma dang / chab bro ma dang tshva la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: me dang / nyi ma dang / chab bro ma dang tshva la sogs pa la'o //
translated: In the case of fire, the sun, salt, and so on.

original: stsogs pa smos pas ni bul tog la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa smos pas ni bul tog la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word and so on refers to soda and so on.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhig dang ldan pa yin zhen /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhig dang ldan pa yin zhen /
translated: What kind of difference does it have?

original: de'i phyir tshos byed las skye ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshos byed las skye ba'i rkyen zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the condition that arises from the cooking agent.

original: tshos byed las skye ba 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshos byed las skye ba 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “cause of origination from the cooking” is that.

original: tshos byed las skye ba'i rkyen gang dang phrad ma thag tu bral bar gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshos byed las skye ba'i rkyen gang dang phrad ma thag tu bral bar gyur zhe na /
translated: What is the condition of origination from the cooking that is immediately present and then ceases?

original: bum pa la sogs pa dang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dang ngo zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is “the pot, etc.”

original: de dag gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba ni gzhan yin pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “They are not nondifferent” means that they are different.

original: gzhan yang 'di'i phyir yang khyad par nges par mi zin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di'i phyir yang khyad par nges par mi zin la /
translated: Moreover, because of this, the difference is not ascertained.

original: de na gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de na gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: There is no nondifference there.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bsreg bya cha shas 'dra ba can //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bsreg bya cha shas 'dra ba can // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The fuel is similar to the burning.🔽The remainder of the sentence is “The fuel is similar to the burning.”🔽The fuel is similar to the burning.

original: me 'bar rab gzhan gang dag la bsreg bya yang yin la cha shas yang yin pa yod pa de dag ni bsreg bya cha shas 'dra ba can no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: me 'bar rab gzhan gang dag la bsreg bya yang yin la cha shas yang yin pa yod pa de dag ni bsreg bya cha shas 'dra ba can no zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The fuel is similar to the burning.

original: 'dra ba zhes bya ba smos pa ni mi 'dra ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dra ba zhes bya ba smos pa ni mi 'dra ba bsal bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term “similar” is mentioned in order to exclude the dissimilar.

original: mi 'dra ba de dag la ni chung ngu dang chen po'i khyad par gyi bye brag snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba de dag la ni chung ngu dang chen po'i khyad par gyi bye brag snang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: For in those dissimilar [cases], the difference of small and great is indeed perceived.

original: tshva zhes smos pa de ni 'gyur ba myur bas 'bar ba gzhan gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshva zhes smos pa de ni 'gyur ba myur bas 'bar ba gzhan gsal bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “salt” is mentioned because the other [flavors] are quickly transformed, and thus are understood to be manifest.

original: ring po zhes smos pa ni khyad par nges par gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ring po zhes smos pa ni khyad par nges par gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term “long” is mentioned in order to ascertain the difference.

original: thung ngu la ni res 'ga' khyad par mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thung ngu la ni res 'ga' khyad par mi dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: For in the short [case], the difference is sometimes not perceived.

original: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'brel ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term “connection” means “conjoined.”

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: dpe sna tshogs brjod pa ni don 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe sna tshogs brjod pa ni don 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The various examples are mentioned in order to clarify this meaning.

original: @69a * // 'di thams cad kyis ni 'di skad du gang gi phyir bum pa dang / me 'bar ba la sogs pa de la tshos byed las skye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par yod kyang 'du byed rnams 'dra bas bslus pas mi dmigs te /

original: ci ste gzhan gyi ltar na ni phrad pa ma thag tu 'byung ba yin gyi de la ni phrad ma thag tu tshos byed las skye ba 'byung ba med pa nyid la de bzhin du bsreg bya cha shas 'dra ba can gyi me 'bar ba gzhan rnams kyi🔽khyad par yang byung ba ma yin na ci'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin snyam du sems par dgongs nas /
