original: de gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, he says:

original: 'on te phrad ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on te phrad ma thag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “But if it is the other part of the fuel that is being burned,” etc.

original: rkyen la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rkyen la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rkyen rnams skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Because there is no difference in the conditions” means that because the conditions are not momentary, there is no difference.

original: gal te bsreg bya'i cha shas gzhan zhes bya ba ni bsreg bya'i cha shas ni bsreg bya'i cha shas so //
analyzed: gal te bsreg bya'i cha shas gzhan zhes bya ba ni bsreg bya'i cha shas ni bsreg bya'i cha shas so //
translated: “If it is the other part of the fuel that is being burned” means that the part of the fuel is the part of the fuel that is being burned.

original: de ni bsreg bya'i cha shas yang yin la gzhan yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ni bsreg bya'i cha shas yang yin la gzhan yang yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: It is the part of the fuel that is being burned and it is other, so the sentence is to be analyzed.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad spyi ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i tshig gi phrad spyi ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The general term “also” means “inclusive.”

original: de'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni bsreg bya'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni bsreg bya'i khyad par las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “From the difference in that” means “from the difference in the fuel that is being burned.”

original: tshad dang / gsal ba dang / tsha ba'i khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la tshad kyi khyad par ni ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: tshad dang / gsal ba dang / tsha ba'i khyad par med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de la tshad kyi khyad par ni ring po dang / thung ngu la sogs pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in size is the difference in length, shortness, and so on.

original: gsal ba'i khyad par ni snang ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: gsal ba'i khyad par ni snang ba chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in brightness is the difference in small, medium, and great illumination.

original: tsha ba'i khyad par ni reg pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: tsha ba'i khyad par ni reg pa chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i khyad par ro //
translated: The difference in heat is the difference in small, medium, and great contact.

original: gsum smos pa ni dbyibs dang / kha dog dang rig pa'i bye brag gi khyad par dang ldan pa'i me 'bar ba skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum smos pa ni dbyibs dang / kha dog dang rig pa'i bye brag gi khyad par dang ldan pa'i me 'bar ba skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of three is for the purpose of showing that the blazing fire, which possesses the difference of shape, color, and light, changes from one moment to the next.

original: de'i phyir khyad par nges par mi zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis ji skad du bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par nges par mi zin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis ji skad du bstan pa'i mjug bsdu ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the difference is not ascertained, etc., the master states the conclusion as taught.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyis gzhan gyi gtan tshigs sbyar ba rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / @69b yang gzhan dag ji ltar smra ba bzhin du mi rung du zin kyang /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyis gzhan gyi gtan tshigs sbyar ba rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / @69b yang gzhan dag ji ltar smra ba bzhin du mi rung du zin kyang /
translated: Thus the master has extensively refuted the argument of others, and although it is not suitable to be just as others speak,

original: 'o na 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs gzhan sems par byed de //
analyzed: 'o na 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes gtan tshigs gzhan sems par byed de //
translated: still, he thinks of another argument, “Because there is no cause for destruction.”

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de nyid yul gzhan du 'phos pa 'di yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de nyid yul gzhan du 'phos pa 'di yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: It is to be applied as “it is just that which has moved to another place.”

original: 'o na'i sgra ni ma rangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na'i sgra ni ma rangs pa'o //
translated: The word “well” is one of displeasure.

original: 'di skad du sngon gyi rang bzhin btang na ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du sngon gyi rang bzhin btang na ni /
translated: This is what is said: If the previous nature is relinquished,

original: sngon med pa'i rang bzhin thob pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i rang bzhin thob pa'i phyir //
translated: because a previous nature is obtained,

original: gzhan zhig skye bar yang 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan zhig skye bar yang 'gyur na /
translated: it would arise as another.

original: de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid med na gang gi phyir na yul gzhan du gzhan zhig skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa nyid med na gang gi phyir na yul gzhan du gzhan zhig skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not destroyed by itself because there is no cause for its destruction, then why would it arise as another in another place?

original: de bas na de nyid yul gzhan du 'phos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid yul gzhan du 'phos pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is just that which has moved to another place.

original: sbyor ba na gang dang gang la snga ma'i rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa de dang de la /🔽rang bzhin gzhan 'thob pas 'gyur ba med de dper na /
analyzed: sbyor ba na gang dang gang la snga ma'i rang bzhin 'jig pa med pa de dang de la / rang bzhin gzhan 'thob pas 'gyur ba med de dper na /
translated: When one is engaged in the practice of meditation, whatever is not destroyed by the previous nature,

original: rus sbal gyi spu lta bu yin la /
analyzed: rus sbal gyi spu lta bu yin la /
translated: that is not transformed by the attainment of another nature, like the hair of a tortoise.

original: yul gzhan na 'dug pa'i dngos po yang 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir snga ma'i rang bzhin 'jig pa med do //
analyzed: yul gzhan na 'dug pa'i dngos po yang 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir snga ma'i rang bzhin 'jig pa med do //
translated: And because the thing that exists in another place is not destroyed, the previous nature is not destroyed because there is no cause for its destruction.

original: de nyid 'jig pa dang / rang bzhin gzhan 'thob pa gnyis kyis skye ba la khyab pa'i phyir de med na khyab par bya ba de yang med pas /
analyzed: de nyid 'jig pa dang / rang bzhin gzhan 'thob pa gnyis kyis skye ba la khyab pa'i phyir de med na khyab par bya ba de yang med pas /
translated: Because that very thing is pervaded by destruction and the attainment of another nature, if that does not exist, then that pervaded also does not exist.

original: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no snyam du skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba dag sems so //🔽'dir smras ba dag sems so //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa yin no snyam du skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba dag sems so // 'dir smras ba dag sems so //
translated: Thus, the non-observation of the pervader is the thought of those who advocate non-momentariness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub ste /
translated: The reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'du byed rnams ni rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa'i phyir na /
translated: Thus, because compounded phenomena are destroyed by their very nature,

original: gang gis na skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gang gis na skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir //
translated: it is not possible for them to arise.

original: de nyid yul gzhan du 'pho bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ni med do //
analyzed: de nyid yul gzhan du 'pho bar 'gyur ba'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ni med do //
translated: There is no cause for the destruction of that which is transferred to another place.

original: ci'i phyir med ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir med ce na /
translated: Why is there not?

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “mind and mental factors, etc.”

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu yang gang yin te //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu yang gang yin te //
translated: What is the cause of destruction?

original: zhes bya ba ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is none at all.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni /
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba de dag ni /
translated: Those mind and mental factors🔽are destroyed by their own nature at every moment.

original: skad cig re re la rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa nyid du gzhan dag gis /
analyzed: skad cig re re la rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa nyid du gzhan dag gis /
translated: Others accept that.

original: bdag nyid kyi khas blangs pas de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi khas blangs pas de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir 'bad par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not strive to prove that.

original: sgra la sogs pa dang / me lce dag gis 'jig pa'i rgyu yang gang zhig yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa dang / me lce dag gis 'jig pa'i rgyu yang gang zhig yin te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: What is the cause of destruction of sound, etc., and of the flame?

original: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pa la /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pa la /
translated: The word “etc.” in “sound, etc.”

original: blo la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid du grags pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa skad cig ma nyid du grags pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: includes the understanding that the mind, etc., are momentary.

original: 'di ltar yang sgra dang / me lce la sogs pa dag kyang skad cig re re la rang gis 'jig par gzhan bye @70a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang sgra dang / me lce la sogs pa dag kyang skad cig re re la rang gis 'jig par gzhan bye @70a * //
translated: Thus, even the sound of a voice and a flame, etc. are destroyed by themselves at every moment, as the Vaiśeṣika, etc. themselves admit.

original: brag pa la sogs pas bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pas de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du 'bad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: brag pa la sogs pas bdag nyid kyis khas blangs pas de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir snga ma bzhin du 'bad par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not make an effort to prove that, as was done previously.

original: sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid du grub pa'i phyir dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di thams cad ni skad cig ma nyid du grub pa'i phyir dpe yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: All of this, beginning with “mind and mental functions,” should be understood as the example, because momentariness is established.

original: de bzhin du gzhan la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos kyi don sgrub par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni dngos kyi don sgrub par byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “In the same way, the other would not exist,” should be understood as the establishment of the actual point.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba dag bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “In the same way” means “like mind and mental functions.”

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “The other” means “a pot, etc.”

original: med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Would not exist” means “the cause of destruction.”

original: de ni 'di skad du ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa dag la ci de dag 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du byung ba dag cig gam //
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa dag la ci de dag 'jig pa'i bdag nyid du byung ba dag cig gam //
translated: This is what is being said: Just as when you analyze such things as mind and mental factors, asking whether they arise with the nature of disintegration or without the nature of disintegration,

original: 'on te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ma nyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par brtags na 'jig pa'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: 'on te 'jig pa'i bdag nyid ma nyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par brtags na 'jig pa'i rgyu mi srid pa'i phyir 'jig pa rgyu dang bcas par mi 'dod do //
translated: since it is impossible for there to be a cause of disintegration, you do not assert that disintegration has a cause.

original: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa gzhan la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa gzhan la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, it would be nonexistent in other things such as form.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dag 'dus byas yin pa de dang de dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dag 'dus byas yin pa de dang de dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa yin te /
translated: The argument is this: Whatever is a product does not depend on a cause of disintegration,

original: dper na sems dang / sems las byung ba la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na sems dang / sems las byung ba la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
translated: like such things as mind and mental factors.

original: bum pa la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyang 'dus byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dngos po thams cad kyang 'dus byas pa yin pas /
translated: But all things such as pots are products.

original: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: Thus the evidence is the observation of what is contradictory to the pervasion.

original: 'di ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dus byas dang 'dus ma byas gnyis ni /
translated: In this way, the two, the product and the nonproduct,

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin la ;
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba yin la ;
translated: They are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive.

original: 'dus ma byas kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid la khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid la khyab par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the fact that the unconditioned is not dependent on a cause of destruction is the pervader.

original: de bas na 'dus ma byas dang / 'gal ba 'dus byas dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: de bas na 'dus ma byas dang / 'gal ba 'dus byas dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when the conditioned, which is contradictory with the unconditioned, is perceived,

original: 'dus ma byas ldog go //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ldog go //
translated: the unconditioned is excluded.

original: khyab par byed pa de log na des khyab par bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa de log na des khyab par bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu la ltos pa dang bcas pa yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When the pervader is excluded, the pervaded, which is dependent on a cause of destruction, is also excluded.

original: slob dpon gyis de ltar tshad ma mdzad pa dang / de la gzhan dag gi dpe mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de ltar tshad ma mdzad pa dang / de la gzhan dag gi dpe mi 'grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the master has made a valid proof and that the example of others is not established,

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says “their” and so on.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba de dag gi'o //
translated: “Their” refers to those minds and mental factors.

original: rang nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes @70b bya ba ni bdag nyid la yod pa nyid de'i rang bzhin 'joms par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes @70b bya ba ni bdag nyid la yod pa nyid de'i rang bzhin 'joms par byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the self-nature of the mind and mental activities themselves that destroys their own existence.

original: gal te sems dang sems byung ba rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan phyir rol gyi mi srid du zin kyang /
analyzed: gal te sems dang sems byung ba rnams kyi 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan phyir rol gyi mi srid du zin kyang /
translated: Even though there is no external cause for the destruction of the mind and mental activities,

original: gang gis na de dag 'jig par byed pa rang la yod pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yod do //
analyzed: gang gis na de dag 'jig par byed pa rang la yod pa nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid yod do //
translated: there is still impermanence that exists in them and destroys them.

original: de bas na dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no snyam du sems pa la /
analyzed: de bas na dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang mi ldan no snyam du sems pa la /
translated: Therefore, the example is not established.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis slob dpon gyis ha cang thal bar ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci'i phyir mi 'dod ces bya ba la sogs pa 'dis slob dpon gyis ha cang thal bar ston par mdzad do //
translated: The Master demonstrates the absurdity of this position in the passage beginning with “Why not accept that the same is true of other things?”

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sems dang sems las byung ba dag gi mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyur 'dod pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The same is true means that just as impermanence is accepted as the cause of the destruction of the mind and mental activities,

original: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa dag la'o //
translated: “Also in other things” means in pots, etc.

original: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: “Other” means an external cause of destruction.

original: de dag la med pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la med pa zhes bya ba ni sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa dag la'o //
translated: “They do not exist in those” means that they do not exist in minds, mental factors, etc.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa dag la ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams la yang med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa dag la ste /
translated: “In the same way, they do not exist in other things” means in pots, etc.

original: mi 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi 'dod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One should not accept” is the meaning.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i rigs pa ma yin nam //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya ba dang ldan pa nyid du gzhung gzugs pa'i rigs pa ma yin nam //
translated: Isn’t it reasonable to establish the example in accordance with the thesis?

original: ha cang thal ba skabs ma yin pa gzhan ci ste smos she na /
analyzed: ha cang thal ba skabs ma yin pa gzhan ci ste smos she na /
translated: Why mention other absurd consequences that are irrelevant?

original: de ni nyes pa med de /🔽'di ltar 'di snyam du ci 'jig pa'i rgyus de nyid byed dam /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de / 'di ltar 'di snyam du ci 'jig pa'i rgyus de nyid byed dam /
translated: There is no fault here.🔽It is like this: One should investigate whether the cause of destruction creates that itself,

original: 'on te gzhan zhig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i brtags pas /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i brtags pas /
translated: or whether it creates something else, and so on.

original: ji ltar phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan mi srid pa ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: ji ltar phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan mi srid pa ltar mi rtag pa nyid kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: Just as it is impossible for there to be another external cause of destruction, so too impermanence is like that,

original: brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brgal zhing brtags pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the objection and analysis are the same.

original: 'on te de lta yin yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par khas len gyi /
analyzed: 'on te de lta yin yang sems dang sems las byung ba rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid 'jig pa'i rgyu yin par khas len gyi /
translated: But even if that is so, you accept that the impermanence of minds and mental factors is the cause of destruction,

original: phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan ni ma yin na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan ni ma yin na /
translated: but there is no other external cause of destruction.

original: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang de kho na dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes thal bar sgrub pa'i thabs kyis /
analyzed: de bzhin du bum pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang de kho na dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes thal bar sgrub pa'i thabs kyis /
translated: In the same way, it would follow that the same is true of other things such as pots.

original: dpe gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dpe gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: This is the method of establishing the treatise through consequences.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyis thal ba bsgrubs pa dang / 'dir skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba gzhan dag gal te med na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /🔽bum pa la sogs pa la phyi rol @71a * //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyis thal ba bsgrubs pa dang / 'dir skad cig ma ma yin par smra ba gzhan dag gal te med na zhes bya ba la sogs pas / bum pa la sogs pa la phyi rol @71a * //
translated: Thus the master establishes the consequence and here others who do not assert momentariness establish the treatise through the statement, If it does not exist, etc.

original: gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu yod pa nyid du gzhung 'dzugs te /
analyzed: gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu yod pa nyid du gzhung 'dzugs te /
translated: They establish the treatise through the statement, External causes of destruction exist for pots, etc.

original: gal te med na zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te med na zhes bya ba ni gal te phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If not, if there is no external cause of destruction,

original: me la sogs pa dang phrad pa'i sngon rol du yang zhes bya ba ni me dang phrad pa bas sngar te /
analyzed: me la sogs pa dang phrad pa'i sngon rol du yang zhes bya ba ni me dang phrad pa bas sngar te /
translated: prior to contact with fire, etc., prior to contact with fire, etc.,

original: me la sogs pa dang ma 'brel pa'i gnas skabs su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: me la sogs pa dang ma 'brel pa'i gnas skabs su zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, in the state of non-contact with fire, etc.

original: ji ltar de'i 'og rol bzhin du zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa dang phrad pa'i 'og ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i 'og rol bzhin du zhes bya ba ni me la sogs pa dang phrad pa'i 'og ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: Just as it is afterwards, that is, just as it is after contact with fire, etc.

original: yang na ni de'i phyis kyang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bzlog par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na ni de'i phyis kyang 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhes bzlog par bya ba ste /
translated: Or, it would be apprehended even afterwards, that is, even after the destruction of the flame, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu ni thams cad du med par 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi 'jig pa'i rgyu ni thams cad du med par 'dra ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the external cause of destruction is everywhere the same in not existing.

original: re zhig ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyis dri ba'i sgo nas mar me la sogs pa gzung ba dang / mi gzung bar grags pas de med pa kho nar sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyis dri ba'i sgo nas mar me la sogs pa gzung ba dang / mi gzung bar grags pas de med pa kho nar sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: The Master, by way of a question, “How is it that . . . ,” etc., establishes that the flame, etc., are apprehended and not apprehended, and so are nonexistent.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsnan pa bstan to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsnan pa bstan to //
translated: The word “if” and so on indicates the addition.

original: phrad pa tsam gyis bral ma thag pa na yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: phrad pa tsam gyis bral ma thag pa na yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Would it not be the case that the moment of separation immediately after contact?”

original: mi gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi gzung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The answer is, “It would not be apprehended.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rkyen la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference in the conditions.

original: gzhan yang tshos byed las skye ba'i phyi rol gyi rkyen khyad par med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang 'jig pa'i rgyu mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang tshos byed las skye ba'i phyi rol gyi rkyen khyad par med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang 'jig pa'i rgyu mi 'thad do //
translated: Moreover, the cause of destruction is not tenable because of this statement, “If there is no difference in the external conditions that arise from the cause of cooking.”

original: khyad par can dang chos khyad par can dang / ches shin tu khyad par can 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khyad par can dang chos khyad par can dang / ches shin tu khyad par can 'byung ba la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “The arising of the distinctive, the distinctive attribute, and the very distinctive” refers to

original: dmar ba dang / ches dmar ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: dmar ba dang / ches dmar ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: red, very red, and so on.

original: ji ltar 'byung ba dag la zhe na /🔽de'i phyir / phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu nyid kyis //
analyzed: ji ltar 'byung ba dag la zhe na / de'i phyir / phyi ma phyi ma'i rgyu nyid kyis //
translated: How do the elements arise?🔽Therefore it is said,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: “Because of the cause of the subsequent.”

original: dmar ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmar ba la sogs pa phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba'i rgyu'i dngos po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the phrase “the cause of the arising of the later ones, such as redness” is the cause of the arising of the later ones, such as redness.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: me la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: me la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase “fire, etc.” is a remainder of the sentence.

original: snga ma dag gi zhes bya ba ni dmar ba la sogs pa snga ma snga ma 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: snga ma dag gi zhes bya ba ni dmar ba la sogs pa snga ma snga ma 'byung ba'i zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase “the earlier ones” means the earlier ones, such as redness.

original: 'jig pa gang las 'byung zhes bya ba ni /🔽me lce la sogs pa las sam /
analyzed: 'jig pa gang las 'byung zhes bya ba ni / me lce la sogs pa las sam /
translated: From what does destruction arise?🔽The meaning of the phrase “from fire, etc.” is from fire, etc.,

original: 'on te gzhan 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'on te gzhan 'ga' zhig las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: or from some other cause.

original: ci ste gzhan ci'i phyir the tshom za 'on kyang me la sogs pa nye ba nyid de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro snyam du 'dod par dogs nas /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan ci'i phyir the tshom za 'on kyang me la sogs pa nye ba nyid de dag gi 'jig pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro snyam du 'dod par dogs nas /
translated: If you ask, “Why is there doubt about something else?,” the meaning of the phrase “but it is asserted that” is that it is asserted that the mere presence of fire, etc. is the cause of their destruction.

original: gang kho na las gang yod pa de kho na las med pa ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya @71b ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang kho na las gang yod pa de kho na las med pa ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya @71b ba gsungs so //
translated: In response to that, the root text states, “It is not logical that something arises from that very thing from which it does not exist.”

original: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not logical?

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis kyi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba gnyis kyi rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The cause of the two contradictory…”

original: rgyu tha dad na ni dngos po rnams kyang tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad na ni dngos po rnams kyang tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: If the cause is different, then things would be different.

original: gal te gzhan gyi rgyu gzhan yin na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi rgyu gzhan yin na /
translated: If the cause of another is another,

original: gzhan gyi gzhan yin no zhes so sor nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gzhan yin no zhes so sor nges par 'gyur ro //

original: de bas na gang skye ba la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par byed par ji ltar 'gyur te //
analyzed: de bas na gang skye ba la phan 'dogs par byed pa gang yin pa de nyid 'jig par byed par ji ltar 'gyur te //

original: de ni 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba yin no //

analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa gzung bar ji ltar mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: da dung du khyod kyis brgal ba de'i la na ma btab po snyam du sems par dogs nas /

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

analyzed: de'i phyir smad kyi khyad par med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /

translated: Impermanence, which is the cause of the destruction of minds and mental factors,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba las logs shig na yod par mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas cung zad kyang grub pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba las logs shig na yod par mngon sum la sogs pa'i tshad mas cung zad kyang grub pa med do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: is not established in the least by any valid cognition, such as direct perception, as existing separately from minds and mental factors.

original: gzhan yang rgyu'i khyad par las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu'i khyad par las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, he says, “From the specific cause, etc.”

original: rgyu'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “From the specific cause” means from the specific cause of the arising of minds and mental factors.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu'i khyad par las so //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu'i khyad par las so //
translated: from the specific cause of destruction.

original: de'i khyad par yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i khyad par yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i khyad par yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa'i khyad par yod par 'gyur te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The specific nature of that would exist, that is, the specific nature of destruction would exist.

original: ci 'dra ba'i khyad par yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba'i khyad par yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What kind of specific nature would exist?

original: de'i phyir mi dang / nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽dngos po la ni khyad par ram /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dang / nyi ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // dngos po la ni khyad par ram /
translated: Therefore he says, “the sun, the moon, etc.”

original: khyad par med par 'gyur mod /
analyzed: khyad par med par 'gyur mod /
translated: In regard to an entity, a specific nature or a non-specific nature would exist.

original: 'jig pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: 'jig pa ni dngos po thams cad kyi mtshan nyid dang bral ba yin te /
translated: But destruction is devoid of the characteristics of all entities.

original: cung zad kyang med pa ma yin nam ji ltar rgyu'i khyad par las de la yang khyad par yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: cung zad kyang med pa ma yin nam ji ltar rgyu'i khyad par las de la yang khyad par yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since it is nothing whatsoever, how could a specific nature exist in it from the specific cause?

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe skye ba bzhin du de yang blo gros rnam par rmongs pa gzhan dag gis rgyu dang bcas par dam bcas pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe skye ba bzhin du de yang blo gros rnam par rmongs pa gzhan dag gis rgyu dang bcas par dam bcas pa na /
translated: For, when it is asserted by others whose intellects are confused, as is the case with arising, that it has a cause,

original: de ci zhig gis na /
analyzed: de ci zhig gis na /
translated: what is the cause of that?

original: 'jig pa de cung zad kyang med pa nyid yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa de cung zad kyang med pa nyid yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that there is no destruction at all.🔽Moreover, there is this other error:🔽It would possess destruction,

original: gzhan yang 'jig pa dang ldan par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig pa dang ldan par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: and so on.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it has a cause,

original: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: like form and so on,

original: 'jig pa yang dngos po nyid du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jig pa yang dngos po nyid du gyur pa yin la /
translated: destruction would become a thing.

original: de yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: de yang 'dus byas yin pa'i phyir 'jig pa ste /
translated: And because it is a conditioned phenomenon, destruction

original: 'jig pa gzhan dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa gzhan dang yang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: would possess another destruction.

original: de'i phyir de yang 'jig pa gzhan dang ldan pa nyid pas @72b thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang 'jig pa gzhan dang ldan pa nyid pas @72b thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because it would possess another destruction, there would be an infinite regress.🔽Therefore, it is said:🔽The cause of destruction is not any other thing,

original: de lta bas na 'jig pa'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung bas /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'jig pa'i rgyu ni 'ga' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung bas /
translated: and so on at length.

original: 'di skad du gsungs pa'i mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gsungs pa'i mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: This is the conclusion of the statement.

original: gang dang gang dag 'dus byas yin pa de dang de dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma snga ma'i don kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang dang gang dag 'dus byas yin pa de dang de dag ni 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshad ma snga ma'i don kyang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the previous valid cognition should be applied, such as “whatever is a conditioned phenomenon does not rely on a cause of destruction.”

original: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams skad cig ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gzugs la sogs pa'i 'du byed rnams skad cig ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, conditioned phenomena such as form are momentary.🔽The syllogism is: Subject: conditioned phenomena such as form🔽Predicate: are momentary

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dag 'jig pa'i rgyu las mi ltos pa de dang de dag ni /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang dag 'jig pa'i rgyu las mi ltos pa de dang de dag ni /
translated: Reason: because they do not rely on a cause of destruction🔽Example: like minds and mental factors

original: rang gi dang gis 'jig pa dag yin te dper na sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa de dag nyid lta bu yin la /🔽gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed rnams kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa yin no //🔽rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi dang gis 'jig pa dag yin te dper na sems dang sems las byung ba la sogs pa de dag nyid lta bu yin la / gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed rnams kyang 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa yin no // rang gi ngang gis 'jig pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the previous valid cognition should be applied, such as “whatever does not rely on a cause of destruction is destroyed by its own nature, like minds and mental factors.”

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin pas /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu la mi ltos pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin pas /
translated: The mere fact that conditioned phenomena such as form do not rely on a cause of destruction is related to the fact that they are destroyed by their own nature.

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is a reason of nature.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyis gzhan gyis sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / yang skad cig pa ma yin par smra ba gzhan dag 'gro ba rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'o na de gzhan du skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs gzhan sems so //
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyis gzhan gyis sbyar ba'i gtan tshigs gnyis pa yang rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / yang skad cig pa ma yin par smra ba gzhan dag 'gro ba rab tu sgrub pa'i phyir 'o na de gzhan du skye ba'i rgyu med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs gzhan sems so //
translated: If it is said, “Because there is no cause for arising elsewhere,” and so on.

original: 'di skad du rgyu gzhan yod na 'byung ba nyid kyis de la rag las pa'i phyir yul gzhan der gzhan skye bar rtag pa zhig na gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di skad du rgyu gzhan yod na 'byung ba nyid kyis de la rag las pa'i phyir yul gzhan der gzhan skye bar rtag pa zhig na gang gi tshe /
translated: This is stated as follows: If there were another cause, it would arise due to the existence of a cause, and because it would depend on that, it would arise elsewhere.

original: rgyu de nyid med pa de'i tshe de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid med pa de'i tshe de med pa'i phyir /
translated: But when that very cause does not exist, at that time it does not exist.

original: ji ltar gzhan skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan skye bar 'gyur /
translated: How could it arise elsewhere?

original: de bas na de nyid 'pho bar mngon no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de nyid 'pho bar mngon no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is evident that it is just that which moves.

original: sbyor ba ni gang /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang /
translated: What is the syllogism?

original: rgyu dang bral ba de ni 'byung ba med de /
analyzed: rgyu dang bral ba de ni 'byung ba med de /
translated: That which is devoid of a cause does not arise,

original: dper na bong bu'i rva lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na bong bu'i rva lta bu yin la /
translated: like the horn of an ass.

original: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i dngos po yang rgyu dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan na gnas pa'i dngos po yang rgyu dang bral ba yin no //
translated: and the thing that exists in another place is also devoid of cause.

original: de ni rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir de med na de yang med pas /
analyzed: de ni rgyu la rag las pa'i phyir de med na de yang med pas /
translated: Since it is dependent on a cause, if that does not exist, it also does not exist.

original: rgyu mi dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems so //
analyzed: rgyu mi dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems so //
translated: Therefore, the non-observation of a cause is the reason.

original: de ltar gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma btsugs pa dang ; 'dir slob dpon gyi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bsnyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag gi phyogs snga ma btsugs pa dang ; 'dir slob dpon gyi gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid du bsnyad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having established the opponent’s position in this way, the master states the reason is indeterminate.

original: snga ma ni phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu yin bas yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: snga ma ni phyi ma skye ba'i rgyu yin bas yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: The former exists because it is the cause of the latter’s arising.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /🔽gal te logs shig na rgyu gzhan med du chug na yang dngos po yul gzhan na @73a * //
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te / gal te logs shig na rgyu gzhan med du chug na yang dngos po yul gzhan na @73a * //
translated: The intended meaning is this:

original: gnas pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu skad cig ma snga ma snga mas bsdus pa yin pa na /
analyzed: gnas pa'i skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu skad cig ma snga ma snga mas bsdus pa yin pa na /
translated: Even if it is allowed that there is no other cause apart from it, the thing that exists in another place is included in the prior moment of the homogeneous cause.🔽In that case, why is it refuted that it is devoid of cause?

original: 'di ltar de rgyu dang bral ba yin no zhes ci'i phyir bzlog / dpe mang po smos pa ni don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de rgyu dang bral ba yin no zhes ci'i phyir bzlog / dpe mang po smos pa ni don de gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The many examples are stated in order to clarify that meaning.

original: de bas na 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Therefore, “because of the characteristic of transference” and so on, concludes.

original: 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni khyad par du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba ni khyad par du byed pa yin te /
translated: “There is no going whatsoever because of the characteristic of transference” is a specification,

original: bar chad med par yul gzhan du 'byung ba la 'gro ba btags par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bar chad med par yul gzhan du 'byung ba la 'gro ba btags par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that going is a designation for the uninterrupted occurrence of an entity in another place.

original: 'di ltar yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang /
translated: Thus,

original: dngos po gnas na 'gro ba med//
analyzed: dngos po gnas na 'gro ba med//
translated: there is no going for a presently existing entity.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang dngos po rnams kyi 'gro ba med par khong du chud par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang dngos po rnams kyi 'gro ba med par khong du chud par bya ba'o //
translated: And because of this, “there is no going for a presently existing entity,” and so on, one should understand that entities do not go.

original: 'di skad du 'dir gzhan ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du 'dir gzhan ni 'di lta ste /
translated: In this way, one might think, “Here, only this much is conceived:

original: dngos po gnas pa'am /🔽mi gnas pa zhig la 'gro ba yod do snyam du de tsam zhig gi rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dngos po gnas pa'am / mi gnas pa zhig la 'gro ba yod do snyam du de tsam zhig gi rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: either a presently existing entity or🔽a non-presently existing entity goes.”

original: de la re zhig gnas pa la 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: de la re zhig gnas pa la 'gro ba med do //
translated: In response to that, first, there is no going for a presently existing entity.

original: gnas pa dang / 'gro ba phan tshun du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa dang / 'gro ba phan tshun du 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because going and a presently existing entity are mutually exclusive.

original: 'o na mi gnas pa la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mi gnas pa la yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it exists in that which is not yet gone,

original: de yang med de /
analyzed: de yang med de /
translated: that also is not so.

original: 'gro ba med par ni mi gnas pa nyid mi srid do //
analyzed: 'gro ba med par ni mi gnas pa nyid mi srid do //
translated: For it is impossible that that which is not yet gone should not be going.

original: ci'i phyir 'gro ba mi sred ce na /🔽de ni / 'gro ba med dang rtag tu gnas gnas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gro ba mi sred ce na / de ni / 'gro ba med dang rtag tu gnas gnas /
translated: Why is it impossible that that which is not yet gone should not be going?

original: zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: This is indicated by the line: “That which is not going always abides in going.”

original: de ltar slob dpon gyis skad cig re re la 'du byed rnams 'byung bar rab tu bsgrubs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyis skad cig re re la 'du byed rnams 'byung bar rab tu bsgrubs pa dang / mngon par zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the Master has established that every moment conditioned factors arise, and in order to refute the attachment to the idea that they are permanent,

original: gal te de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang rgol bar byed do //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas yang rgol bar byed do //
translated: he says, “If that were so, etc.”

original: gzhan na snang ba de ci yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid snang ngo zhes bya bar bsams ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan na snang ba de ci yin zhes bya ba ni de nyid snang ngo zhes bya bar bsams ba'o //
translated: “What is that which appears in another place?” He means, “What is that which appears as that?”

original: de nyid snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis 'gog par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyis 'gog par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “It is not that which appears as that,” the Master refutes.

original: 'o na ci zhe na zhes zer ba ni gzhan no //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na zhes zer ba ni gzhan no //
translated: “What then?” he asks.

original: yul dang yul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: yul dang yul du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
translated: “In different places, etc.” is the Master’s response.

original: gsar dang gsar ci zhe na /
analyzed: gsar dang gsar ci zhe na /
translated: “What is new?”

original: snang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: snang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Appears” is to be supplied.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na /🔽de'i phyir rtsva me lta bu'am /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na / de'i phyir rtsva me lta bu'am /
translated: What is it like?🔽Therefore, it is said, “like a firebrand-wheel”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'di skad du ji ltar khyad par mngon par mi rtogs pa'i phyir /🔽me 'bar ba na me de nyid 'gro zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ba de bzhin du mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / 'di skad du ji ltar khyad par mngon par mi rtogs pa'i phyir / me 'bar ba na me de nyid 'gro zhes mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung ba de bzhin du mi 'gro'o //
translated: and so on.🔽This is what is being said: Just as when a firebrand is whirled around, the conceit “that fire is moving” arises, but it is not moving.

original: grib ma 'gro'o snyam du ste /
analyzed: grib ma 'gro'o snyam du ste /
translated: Likewise, the conceit “the shadow is moving” arises,

original: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: but it is not moving, because it is momentary.

original: don dam par me 'bar ba dang / gri ba @73b ma la 'gro ba med do //
analyzed: don dam par me 'bar ba dang / gri ba @73b ma la 'gro ba med do //
translated: In reality, the firebrand and the shadow do not move.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba dag la yang de bzhin du 'dod par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed skad cig re re la gzhan dang gzhan 'byung ba dag la yang de bzhin du 'dod par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It should be understood that the same is true of the arising of each moment of form and so on.

original: mngon ches pa'i phyir me 'bar ba'i 'gro ba lta mngon pa'i nga rgyal du chug na /
analyzed: mngon ches pa'i phyir me 'bar ba'i 'gro ba lta mngon pa'i nga rgyal du chug na /
translated: Since the movement of the firebrand is obvious, it can be accepted as an example of conceit.

original: grib ma ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du brtsad pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grib ma ni gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du brtsad pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But the shadow is not obvious, like form and so on.

original: ji lta bu yin snyam du dogs pas /
analyzed: ji lta bu yin snyam du dogs pas /
translated: Therefore, it is asked, “How is it?”

original: grib ma yang skad cig ma nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: grib ma yang skad cig ma nyid du rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to prove that even a shadow is momentary, he says:

original: grib ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grib ma zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: “Shadow” and so on.

original: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni grib ma dang ldan pa'i mi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni grib ma dang ldan pa'i mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Endowed with that” means endowed with a shadow, a person and so on.

original: de skye ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de skye ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because its arising, waning, and changing are seen.

original: grib ma skye ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grib ma skye ba dang / 'grib pa dang / 'gyur bar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the arising, waning, and changing of a shadow are seen.

original: 'di skad du nyi ma thag ring na grib ma skye bar snang /
analyzed: 'di skad du nyi ma thag ring na grib ma skye bar snang /
translated: In this way, when the sun is far away, the arising of a shadow is seen.

original: nye na ni grib ma 'grib par snang /
analyzed: nye na ni grib ma 'grib par snang /
translated: When it is near, the waning of a shadow is seen.

original: 'gyur bas ni 'gyur bar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'gyur bas ni 'gyur bar snang ba yin no //
translated: When it changes, it is seen to change.

original: gal te grib ma yul gzhan du 'pho na ;
analyzed: gal te grib ma yul gzhan du 'pho na ;
translated: If a shadow were to move to another place,

original: de ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na grib ma dang ldan pa'i mi la sogs pa 'dug bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni ngo bo gcig pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar na grib ma dang ldan pa'i mi la sogs pa 'dug bzhin du /
translated: then how could a person endowed with a shadow, while sitting still,

original: de nyi ma 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gyur ba bsten par 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyi ma 'gyur ba'i rjes su 'gyur ba bsten par 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: be seen to follow the changing sun?

original: rgol ba gang zhig grib ma yul gzhan du 'pho ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: rgol ba gang zhig grib ma yul gzhan du 'pho ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: But if the opponent maintains that the shadow moves to another place,🔽then it is not a transformation of the elements, and in that case, it is not momentary because it is a single entity.

original: 'byung ba ni ma yin par lta ba de'i ltar na de ni gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skad cig pa yang ma yin na de ci'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba ni ma yin par lta ba de'i ltar na de ni gcig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir skad cig pa yang ma yin na de ci'i phyir /
translated: Why is it not possible?

original: de dang ldan pa 'dug bzhin du //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa 'dug bzhin du //
translated: The phrase “while the one possessing it remains”

original: zhes bya ba ni khyad par smos /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyad par smos /
translated: is a special assertion.

original: de la ni gnas 'gyur bas kyang 'gyur ba yod par mi srid do zhe na /
analyzed: de la ni gnas 'gyur bas kyang 'gyur ba yod par mi srid do zhe na /
translated: But if the place changes, it is impossible for the shadow to change.

original: de ni bden te 'on kyang rdza ma dang / 'bru mar bzhin du de la brten pa de tsam gyis gnas kyi dbang gis grib ma de 'gyur ba yin du ni chug na /
analyzed: de ni bden te 'on kyang rdza ma dang / 'bru mar bzhin du de la brten pa de tsam gyis gnas kyi dbang gis grib ma de 'gyur ba yin du ni chug na /
translated: That is true, but just as a pot or oil lamp is supported by its base, the shadow is supported by that, and it is possible that the shadow changes due to the power of the base.

original: de dang ldan par 'dug bzhin du de dag gcig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dang ldan par 'dug bzhin du de dag gcig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But while the one possessing the shadow remains, it is not possible for the shadow to change due to the movement of the sun, because they are one.

original: nyi ma'i 'gyur bas 'gyur bar mi rung ngo zhes zhal gyis bzhes nas bshad do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'gyur bas 'gyur bar mi rung ngo zhes zhal gyis bzhes nas bshad do snyam du dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Thus the master accepts that it is not possible for the shadow to change due to the movement of the sun.

original: snang ba'i phyogs gzhan du bsgribs na 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyogs gzhan du bsgribs na 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: because it appears in another place when the light is obstructed.

original: grib ma de nyid yul gzhan du snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: grib ma de nyid yul gzhan du snang ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning is that the shadow itself does not appear in another place.

original: dgongs pa ni gal te grib ma de nyid yul gzhan du 'pho ba na /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni gal te grib ma de nyid yul gzhan du 'pho ba na /
translated: The intended meaning is this: if the shadow itself moves to another place,

original: 'o na ni re lde dang / rtsig pa la sogs pas snang ba'i phyogs gzhan du @74a * //
analyzed: 'o na ni re lde dang / rtsig pa la sogs pas snang ba'i phyogs gzhan du @74a * //
translated: then when the light is obstructed by a fence, wall, etc. in another place,

original: bsgribs na de 'byung bar dmigs par mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsgribs na de 'byung bar dmigs par mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: the shadow would not be observed to appear there.

original: 'on kyang thams cad dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te /🔽de ni snang ba'i phyogs ma bsgribs pa gzhan du yang /
analyzed: 'on kyang thams cad dmigs pa kho nar 'gyur te / de ni snang ba'i phyogs ma bsgribs pa gzhan du yang /
translated: But rather, it would be observed everywhere,

original: 'pho bar khyad par du med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'pho bar khyad par du med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no difference between the place where the light is obstructed and the place where the light is not obstructed.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir grib ma yang me 'bar ba dang / tshul 'dra bar grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir grib ma yang me 'bar ba dang / tshul 'dra bar grub pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it changes from one instant to the next, it is established that a shadow is similar to a blazing fire.

original: de ltar 'du byed rnams skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: de ltar 'du byed rnams skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur bar bsgrubs nas /
translated: Thus, having established that compounded phenomena change from one instant to another,

original: slob dpon gyis rgol ba gzhan gyis smras pa la yang /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rgol ba gzhan gyis smras pa la yang /
translated: the master [Nāgārjuna] responds to the opponent’s statement

original: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa sla chos kyis rtsis mgos bsgre bar mdzad do //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa sla chos kyis rtsis mgos bsgre bar mdzad do //
translated: with the easy method of calculation beginning with “Whatever . . .”

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni rgol ba'o //
translated: “ Whatever” refers to the opponent.

original: brtsad pa zhes bya ba ni brgal pa ste /
analyzed: brtsad pa zhes bya ba ni brgal pa ste /
translated: “ Disputed” means disputed.

original: skad cig pas smra bas zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: skad cig pas smra bas zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: “ By the proponent of momentariness” is an ellipsis.

original: ji ltar rgol zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rgol zhe na /
translated: How is it disputed?

original: de'i phyir 'di ga las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ga las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says “Why is that?” and so on.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan na snang ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan na snang ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: “ That” refers to the appearance in another place.

original: de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: de nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba gang yin pa zhes bya ba tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: “ It is not that very thing” is an ellipsis of “that which was seen before.”

original: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ga las zhes bya ba ni ci'i phyir ro //
translated: “ Why is that?” means “for what reason?”

original: phyir rgol bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyir rgol bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ It becomes the object of dispute” means

original: skad cig par smra ba de nyid la de rtsod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de nyid khungs yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: skad cig par smra ba de nyid la de rtsod par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de nyid khungs yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase it would be a dispute with those who advocate momentariness means that it would be a dispute with the Sautrantikas.🔽The phrase that itself is the source means that

original: bshad ma thag pa de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba'i yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa de nyid gzhan du 'gyur ba'i yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the source is the very thing that was just explained.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it says in this way and so forth.

original: gzhan yang tshos byed las skye ba rnams kyi phyi rol gyi rkyen tha dad pa med pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tshos byed las skye ba rnams kyi phyi rol gyi rkyen tha dad pa med pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it says because there is no difference in external conditions for those that arise from cooking and so forth.

original: 'di skad du me la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rkyen rnams ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du me la sogs pa phyi rol gyi rkyen rnams ni /
translated: This is saying that external conditions such as fire

original: skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir tha dad med do //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir tha dad med do //
translated: are not different because they are not momentary.

original: gal te yang de dang phrad ma thag kho nar bum pa la sogs pa sngon gyi gzugs 'dzin pas phyi ma'i gzugs kyi khyad par 'byung bar mi 'gyur na ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang de dang phrad ma thag kho nar bum pa la sogs pa sngon gyi gzugs 'dzin pas phyi ma'i gzugs kyi khyad par 'byung bar mi 'gyur na ni phyis kyang mi 'gyur te /
translated: If, however, the pot and so on did not take on the special features of the later state immediately upon contact with the dye, then it would not do so later either.

original: rkyen rnams ni snga ma bzhin du sngon gyi rang bzhin ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen rnams ni snga ma bzhin du sngon gyi rang bzhin ma btang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the conditions are the same as before, not having given up their previous nature.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'on kyang khyad par dmigs so //
analyzed: 'on kyang khyad par dmigs so //
translated: However, a special feature is observed.

original: de lta bas na phyi ma'i khyad par gzung ba 'di nyid tshos bya dang / tshos byed kyi rdzas rnams skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i @74b khungs te /
analyzed: de lta bas na phyi ma'i khyad par gzung ba 'di nyid tshos bya dang / tshos byed kyi rdzas rnams skad cig re re la gzhan du 'gyur ba'i @74b khungs te /
translated: Therefore, this very observation of a special feature in the later state is the reason, the proof, that the substances of the dye and the dyed object change from one moment to the next.

original: gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: gzhan yang re zhig nged kyi gzhan du 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs rgya cher bshad zin mod kyi khas blangs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang re zhig nged kyi gzhan du 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs rgya cher bshad zin mod kyi khas blangs te /
translated: Moreover, although we have already extensively explained the reason for change, accepting it,

original: yang gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “If, however, the pot” and so on.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gyur bar bsgrub par bya ba'i'o //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i zhes bya ba ni gzhan du 'gyur bar bsgrub par bya ba'i'o //
translated: “In the case of transformation” means in the case of the establishment of transformation.

original: khungs med pas zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med pas so //
analyzed: khungs med pas zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med pas so //
translated: “Without a basis” means without a reason.

original: dngos por rtog par byed na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dngos por rtog par byed na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “If one conceives of an entity” means

original: de nyid yin no snyam du sems pa ni dngos po ste /
analyzed: de nyid yin no snyam du sems pa ni dngos po ste /
translated: if one thinks that it is just that.

original: gang las de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang las de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya bar shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is known that “this is just that.”

original: yang na de nyid kyi dngos po ni de'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: yang na de nyid kyi dngos po ni de'i dngos po ste /
translated: Or, the entity of that is the entity of that.

original: gnas pa'i 'gro ba ni dngos po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pa'i 'gro ba ni dngos po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that the course of abiding is an entity.

original: de'i dngos po yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig pa'i dngos po ste /
analyzed: de'i dngos po yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gcig pa'i dngos po ste /
translated: “In the case of the entity of that” means in the case of the entity of the same nature.

original: rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin tha mi dad pa'i dngos po'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that in the case of the entity of the undifferentiated nature.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: “Therefore” and so on concludes.

original: gang gi phyir ci gcig pa nyid yin nam /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ci gcig pa nyid yin nam /
translated: The meaning is that because of what?

original: 'on te gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin zhes the tshom za ste /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin zhes the tshom za ste /
translated: Or is it something else?

original: khungs med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de bas na gnyi gar nges par mi gzung bar thal bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: khungs med pa'i phyir ro // de bas na gnyi gar nges par mi gzung bar thal bar 'gyur bas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because there is no basis for it.🔽Therefore, it follows that it cannot be ascertained as either of the two.

original: phyogs gnyi gar nges par mi gzung bar thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar nges par mi gzung bar thal bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It follows that it cannot be ascertained as either of the two,

original: de'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: de'i dngos po'am /
translated: as that very thing or as something else.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos por nges par gzung du med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos por nges par gzung du med par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because it follows that it cannot be ascertained as either that very thing or as something else.

original: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: dngos po gcig la de'i dngos po dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po phan tshun 'gal ba dag dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la de'i dngos po dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba'i dngos po phan tshun 'gal ba dag dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: One thing cannot possess both that very thing and something else, which are mutually exclusive.

original: 'pho ba ni ma grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'pho ba ni ma grub pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not established that there is transference.🔽This means that transference is not at all established.

original: 'pho ba ni gting mi tshugs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'pho ba ni gting mi tshugs pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The syllogism is:

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang / gang dag skad cig pa yin pa de dang / de dag la yul gzhan du 'pho ba med de /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang / gang dag skad cig pa yin pa de dang / de dag la yul gzhan du 'pho ba med de /
translated: Whatever is momentary does not transfer to another place,🔽as, for example, a flame.

original: dper na me 'bar ba dang / grib ma la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na me 'bar ba dang / grib ma la sogs pa lta bu yin la /
translated: For example, it is like the blazing of fire and the casting of shadows.

original: gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig pa yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal bar dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa 'du byed rnams kyang skad cig pa yin pas khyab par byed pa 'gal bar dmigs pa'o //
translated: And since compounded phenomena such as form and so on are momentary, the observation of a contradictory pervasion is established.

original: 'di ltar skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa ni phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skad cig pa dang / skad cig pa ma yin pa ni phan tshun spangs te /
translated: Thus, being momentary and not being momentary are mutually exclusive.

original: gnas pas 'gal ba yin la /
analyzed: gnas pas 'gal ba yin la /
translated: They are contradictory because of abiding.

original: 'pho ba yang skad cig pa ma yin pas khyad pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dang 'gal ba skad cig @75a * //
analyzed: 'pho ba yang skad cig pa ma yin pas khyad pa'i phyir ro // de dang 'gal ba skad cig @75a * //
translated: And because of the contradiction of being momentary and not being momentary, movement is also momentary.

original: pa dmigs pa na /
analyzed: pa dmigs pa na /
translated: When the observation of that contradiction, momentariness, is found,

original: skad cig ma yin pa ldog go //
analyzed: skad cig ma yin pa ldog go //
translated: not being momentary is eliminated.

original: de log na des khyab par bya ba 'pho ba yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de log na des khyab par bya ba 'pho ba yang ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: When that is eliminated, that which is pervaded by it, movement, is also eliminated.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyis rgya cher 'gro ba rnam par rig byed ma yin no zhes 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa dag gi phyogs sun phyung ba dang / 'dir mdo sde pa'i khyad par rnams las /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyis rgya cher 'gro ba rnam par rig byed ma yin no zhes 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa dag gi phyogs sun phyung ba dang / 'dir mdo sde pa'i khyad par rnams las /
translated: Thus, the master has extensively refuted the position of the noble Saṃmatīya school that nonindicative form is not a mover.

original: nyi ma 'char ka pa zhes bya ba la la dag chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin zhig rnam par rig byed yin par brjod pas na /🔽nyi ma 'char ka pa dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka pa zhes bya ba la la dag chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin zhig rnam par rig byed yin par brjod pas na / nyi ma 'char ka pa dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Some say that the nature of another phenomenon is indicative.

original: nyi ma 'char ka pa dag na re zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nyi ma 'char ka pa dag na re zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Sūryagarbha Sūtra says,🔽“The Sūryagarbha Sūtra says that the nature of another phenomenon is indicative form.”

original: gnas brtan gzhon nu len gyis byas pa'i bstan bcos nyi ma 'char ka zhes bya ba des tha snyad brjod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nyi ma 'char ka pa dag go //
analyzed: gnas brtan gzhon nu len gyis byas pa'i bstan bcos nyi ma 'char ka zhes bya ba des tha snyad brjod pa gang dag yin pa de dag ni nyi ma 'char ka pa dag go //
translated: The Sūryagarbha Sūtra was composed by the elder Kumāralāta.

original: gal te kha cig na re 'on kyang 'du byed rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'i phyir 'pho ba med la /
analyzed: gal te kha cig na re 'on kyang 'du byed rnams ni rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'i phyir 'pho ba med la /
translated: Some say: Still, because formations disintegrate by their very nature, they do not move.

original: des na de med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed kyang med na /🔽'jig rten na 'gro ba'i tha snyad dam /
analyzed: des na de med pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed kyang med na / 'jig rten na 'gro ba'i tha snyad dam /
translated: Since they do not move, indicative form does not exist.🔽How can the conventions of going and

original: rnam par rig byed kyi tha snyad ji ltar 'byung zhes zer ba 'dis dogs nas /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed kyi tha snyad ji ltar 'byung zhes zer ba 'dis dogs nas /
translated: indicative form exist in the world?

original: de'i phyir yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the cause of the arising of another object, etc.”

original: yul gzhan du 'du byed rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'du byed rnams 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cause of the arising of another object means the cause of the arising of other formations in another place.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i phyir chos gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chos gzhan zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “another dharma.”

original: rang bzhin gzhan dang dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan dang dngos po gzhan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means another nature and another entity.

original: de yang rgyu ci las byung ba zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rgyu ci las byung ba zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: de'i phyir sems kyi khyad par gyi rgyu can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kyi khyad par gyi rgyu can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says, “the cause of a special mind.”

original: sems kyi khyad par ni de 'dod pas rab tu bcug pa'i sems so //
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par ni de 'dod pas rab tu bcug pa'i sems so //
translated: A special mind is a mind that is engaged by the desire for that.

original: chos gzhan gang la rgyu de yod pa de ni chos gzhan sems kyi khyad par gyi rgyu can no //
analyzed: chos gzhan gang la rgyu de yod pa de ni chos gzhan sems kyi khyad par gyi rgyu can no //
translated: That other dharma which has that cause is another dharma that has the cause of a special mind.

original: de lta bur gyur pa de yul gang du 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa de yul gang du 'byung zhe na /
translated: In what place does that arise?

original: de'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir lag pa la sogs pa la zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “in the hand, etc.”

original: de ni 'gro ba zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de ni 'gro ba zhes kyang bya /
translated: It is also called going.🔽

original: rnam par rig byed ces kyang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ces kyang bya'o zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is also called “going” and “indicative action.🔽”

analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa'i chos gzhan de nyid ni / 'jig rten na 'gro ba'am /
translated: This other entity of that kind

original: rnam par rig byed ces bya'i /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ces bya'i /
translated: is called “going” in the world🔽and “indicative action” in the treatises.

original: de las ma gtogs pa'i yul gzhan du 'byung bar byed pa gzhan dang / de'i 'bras bur gyur pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs pa'i yul gzhan du 'byung bar byed pa gzhan dang / de'i 'bras bur gyur pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no other entity that is its cause or its effect.

analyzed: 'o na @75b zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi chos gzhan sun dbyung ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Now, in order to refute the other entity of the master, he says, “But if it is a form . . . ” and so on.
