analyzed: 'di skad du gal te chos gzhan de gzugs kyi skye mched du gtogs pa yin na / gzugs kyi skye mched ni blta bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He means to say, “If that other entity belongs to the form base,

original: der gtogs pa de yang kha dog bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: der gtogs pa de yang kha dog bzhin du mthong bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: then, because the form base is visible, that which belongs to it would be seen, like color.

original: ; de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ; de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: de bas na med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na med pa nyid do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it does not exist.”

original: sngar dbyibs gsal ba'i tshad ma'i don gang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar dbyibs gsal ba'i tshad ma'i don gang dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa de nyid 'dir yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the earlier statement, “Whatever is observed as the object of valid knowledge that ascertains shape,” and so on, should be applied here as well.

original: gal te mngon par zhen pa'i phyir gzhan dag na re ;
analyzed: gal te mngon par zhen pa'i phyir gzhan dag na re ;
translated: The meaning of the above passage from the Compendium of the Mahāyāna, “The measure of the clarity of shape is whatever is observed as the object of valid knowledge,” and so on, should be applied here as well.

original: gal te gzung ba ma yin du chug na /
analyzed: gal te gzung ba ma yin du chug na /
translated: If you ask, “Why is it not observed?”🔽If you say, “Even if it is not observed,

original: chos gzhan de gzung bar bya ba ma yin yang yod pa nyid yin no zhes zer du dogs nas /
analyzed: chos gzhan de gzung bar bya ba ma yin yang yod pa nyid yin no zhes zer du dogs nas /
translated: it exists as a phenomenon that is not observed,”

original: mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: to anticipate that response, he says, “If it is not seen,” and so on.

original: gzhan la rnam par rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed ces bya na /
analyzed: gzhan la rnam par rig par byed pas na rnam par rig byed ces bya na /
translated: If it is called indicative because it makes known to another,

original: de ji ltar gzhan la rnam par rig par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji ltar gzhan la rnam par rig par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: how could it make known to another?

original: gal te gzung ba zhig srid na ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzung ba zhig srid na ni 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were something to be observed, it could.

original: gang gi tshe de la gzung ba nyid med pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de la gzung ba nyid med pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when there is no observation of it,🔽how could it make known to another?

original: ji ltar gzhan la rnam par rig par byed par 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan la rnam par rig par byed par 'gyur snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the thought.

original: gzhan yang khyed kyis de yod par yang tshad mas ngo bo dmigs kyis ma phyed bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyed kyis de yod par yang tshad mas ngo bo dmigs kyis ma phyed bzhin du /
translated: Moreover, you do not distinguish the nature of the object of valid knowledge that you claim to exist.🔽

original: ji ltar khong du chud pa gzhan 'di yang brjod par 'os te /
analyzed: ji ltar khong du chud pa gzhan 'di yang brjod par 'os te /
translated: Moreover, you should also state how you understand the existence of that other phenomenon without distinguishing it by valid knowledge.

original: chos gzhan de ji ltar yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos gzhan de ji ltar yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the statement “How could that other phenomenon exist?” is as follows.

original: ci ste gzhan dag chos gzhan de dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad mas khong du chud par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang 'bras bus rdzes su dpag pas /🔽khong du chud par bya bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dag chos gzhan de dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi tshad mas khong du chud par bya ba ma yin du zin kyang 'bras bus rdzes su dpag pas / khong du chud par bya bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems shing de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: If that other phenomenon is not an object of comprehension by the valid knowledge of direct perception because it is beyond the senses, then it is ascertained by inference from its effect.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smros te /
translated: In order to teach that, he says, “If that were not so . . .”

original: 'di skad du /🔽gal te chos gzhan med na /
analyzed: 'di skad du / gal te chos gzhan med na /
translated: This is what he means.🔽If that other phenomenon did not exist,

original: de med par yul gzhan du lus 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de med par yul gzhan du lus 'byung bar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: how could the body arise in another place without it?

original: de bas na yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i chos gzhan zhig yod par khas blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that one should accept that there is another phenomenon that is the cause for the arising of the body in another place.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na 'byung ba de ni rgyu de sngon du song ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang yod na 'byung ba de ni rgyu de sngon du song ba yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever arises when something exists is preceded by that as its cause,

original: dper na sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba lta bu yin la /🔽yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba yang chos gzhan @76a * //
analyzed: dper na sa bon yod na myu gu 'byung ba lta bu yin la / yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba yang chos gzhan @76a * //
translated: like a sprout arising when a seed exists.

original: yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yod na 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The arising of the body in another place also arises when another phenomenon exists.

original: rgyu de sngon du song ba can de ni de yod na 'byung ba tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu de sngon du song ba can de ni de yod na 'byung ba tsam du 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Since that which is preceded by that cause is merely something that arises when it exists,

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no snyam du nyi ma 'char ka pa dag sems so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs yin no snyam du nyi ma 'char ka pa dag sems so //
translated: it is a natural inference. This is what Sūryyakara thinks.

original: de ltar gzhan dag gis tshad ma btsugs pa dang / 'dir slob dpon gyis gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan dag gis tshad ma btsugs pa dang / 'dir slob dpon gyis gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, others posit a valid cognition, and here the master teaches that the reason is not established.

original: sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The element of wind that arises from a special mind, and so on.

original: 'di skad du de yod na 'byung ba nyid kyi rgyu chos gzhan sngon du song ba nyid du bsgrub par bya ba de yang nam zhig na rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad du de yod na 'byung ba nyid kyi rgyu chos gzhan sngon du song ba nyid du bsgrub par bya ba de yang nam zhig na rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being said: if that exists, then the cause of the elements is established as another phenomenon that precedes them. But when would that be appropriate?

original: gal te de yod na 'byung ba nyid de /
analyzed: gal te de yod na 'byung ba nyid de /
translated: If that exists, then the elements

original: kho na grub na ni rung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: kho na grub na ni rung bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: would be established as just that.

original: 'on kyang de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni ma grub ste /
translated: But that is not established.

original: sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams kho nas yul gzhan du lus 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams kho nas yul gzhan du lus 'byung bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Because the element of wind that arises from a special mind alone causes the body to arise in another place.

original: 'di lta ste yul gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don 'di nyid don dang mthun pa'i ming bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad do //
analyzed: 'di lta ste yul gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don 'di nyid don dang mthun pa'i ming bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhung 'dzugs par mdzad do //
translated: In this way, the meaning is established by the text that begins with “in another place” and so on.

original: rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i ji ltar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of “and so on”?

original: yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “cause of the arising of things in another place” is to be supplied.

original: 'dis ni gzhan dag gis rlung gi khams la 'khrul pa yod par bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhan dag gis rlung gi khams la 'khrul pa yod par bstan pa yin te /
translated: This verse shows that others have erred in regard to the element of wind.

original: khyod yul gzhan du dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu ni rlung gi khams yin par 'dod la /
analyzed: khyod yul gzhan du dngos po 'byung ba'i rgyu ni rlung gi khams yin par 'dod la /
translated: You assert that the element of wind is the cause of the arising of things in another place.

original: rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa la ni /
analyzed: rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa la ni /
translated: But in the case of grass, leaves, etc.,

original: khyod kyi sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
analyzed: khyod kyi sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams yod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams so //
translated: you do not admit that the element of wind arises from a special state of mind.

original: g-yo bar byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa dang / phrad pa'i rlung gi khams las so zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: g-yo bar byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa dang / phrad pa'i rlung gi khams las so zhes bya ba ni ci zhe na /
translated: From the element of wind that moves, propels, and contacts.

original: rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i yul gzhan du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa'i yul gzhan du 'byung ngo zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase “arising in another place” is to be supplied.

original: 'di ni slob dpon gyis lan btab pa yin no //🔽de la g-yo bar byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa ni 'gul ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon gyis lan btab pa yin no // de la g-yo bar byed pa dang 'phen par byed pa ni 'gul ba ste /
translated: This is the master’s reply.🔽Among these, that which moves and propels is that which causes vibration.

original: gang la zhig gis gnas pa spyod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: gang la zhig gis gnas pa spyod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: That is, it is that which causes the movement of what is at rest.

original: ;'phen par byed pa ni brdeg par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ;'phen par byed pa ni brdeg par byed pa ste /
translated: The “propelling” is the striking,

original: shugs dang ldan pas rdzas dang sprod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shugs dang ldan pas rdzas dang sprod par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that it is endowed with force and it causes the substance to come together.

original: de gnyis las byung ba'i rlung gi khams gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: de gnyis las byung ba'i rlung gi khams gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig bsdu'o //
translated: The meaning of the compound “that which arises from those two” is understood.

original: don ni gal te nged yul gzhan du skye ba thams @76b cad kyi rgyu sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams kho na yin par smra na ni /
analyzed: don ni gal te nged yul gzhan du skye ba thams @76b cad kyi rgyu sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams kho na yin par smra na ni /
translated: If we say that the wind element that arises from the special mind is the cause of all the movement of objects,

original: de'i tshe rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa la ji ltar 'gyur zhes 'khrul bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa la ji ltar 'gyur zhes 'khrul bar 'gyur na /
translated: then there would be the error that it would also occur in grass, leaves, and so on.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar srid par smra ste /🔽kha cig tu ni sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar srid par smra ste / kha cig tu ni sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams yin la /
translated: But we say that it occurs as is possible.🔽In some cases, it is the wind element that arises from the special mind.

original: kha cig la ni g-yo bar byed pa la sogs pa dang phrad pa yin pas /
analyzed: kha cig la ni g-yo bar byed pa la sogs pa dang phrad pa yin pas /
translated: In other cases, it is the contact of the moving faculty and so on.

original: de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'gal ba med do zhes bstan pa 'di yin no //
translated: Therefore there is no contradiction.

original: yang na gang las zhes bya ba ni rgyu rlung gi khams las so //
analyzed: yang na gang las zhes bya ba ni rgyu rlung gi khams las so //
translated: Or else, “from which” means from the cause, the wind element.

original: 'gro ba 'byung bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi 'gro ba 'byung bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gro ba 'byung bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyi 'gro ba 'byung bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “The occurrence of going” means the occurrence of another phenomenon, which is what is meant by “going.”

original: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan 'byung ba'i rlung gi khams kho na las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid las zhes bya ba ni chos gzhan 'byung ba'i rlung gi khams kho na las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “From that itself” means from the wind element that is the cause of the occurrence of another phenomenon.

original: nus pa dmigs kyis ma phye ba can gyi 'gro ba brtags te ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nus pa dmigs kyis ma phye ba can gyi 'gro ba brtags te ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la /
translated: What is the use of imagining a going that is not distinguished by capacity?

original: 'gro ba gang la tshad mas dmigs kyis ma phye zhing /
analyzed: 'gro ba gang la tshad mas dmigs kyis ma phye zhing /
translated: That going is not distinguished by valid knowledge,

original: nges par ma byas pa'i nus pa ste byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: nges par ma byas pa'i nus pa ste byed pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: and its capacity, or activity, is not ascertained.

original: de lta bu brtags te ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu brtags te ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of imagining such a going?

original: dgos pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /🔽// / bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: dgos pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /🔽// / bam po gnyis pa /
translated: It is completely useless.

original: 'o na yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos gzhan sun phyung ba'i phyir yang nyi ma 'char ka pa dag phyogs gzhan sems pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba'i rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chos gzhan sun phyung ba'i phyir yang nyi ma 'char ka pa dag phyogs gzhan sems pa yin te /
translated: Now, the sun-like Vaibhāṣikas think of another position, because of the words, “The cause of the arising of the body in another place, etc.”

original: 'di skad du /🔽gal te chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad du / gal te chos gzhan gyi rang bzhin ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: They say,

original: rnam par rig byed du mi rung bar gyur na /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed du mi rung bar gyur na /
translated: “If you say that informative form is not possible because the nature of another entity is not established,

original: 'o na sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams de nyid lus 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du yu bu cag la grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams de nyid lus 'byung ba'i rgyu nyid du yu bu cag la grags pa'i phyir /
translated: then the element of wind that arises from a special mind is the cause of the arising of the body, because it is renowned to us as such.

original: rnam par rig byed du 'gyur mod ce na zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed du 'gyur mod ce na zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is informative form.”

original: ji ltar na rnam par rig par mi byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis dgag pa mdzad do //
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam par rig par mi byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis dgag pa mdzad do //
translated: The master says, “How can that which is not informative form, etc.”

original: rlung gi khams ni reg bya'i skye mched yin pas /🔽bltar rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni reg bya'i skye mched yin pas / bltar rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The element of wind is the sense base of tangibility.🔽It is not visible,

original: rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: so it is not informative.

original: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang de'i rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang de'i rang bzhin yin na /
translated: If the form that is the object of the eye consciousness is the nature of that consciousness,

original: rnam par rig par byed pa las de ji ltar rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig par byed pa las de ji ltar rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: how could it be the object of that consciousness?🔽Moreover, this other fault would also exist:

original: gzhan yang reg bya'i skye mched dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //🔽sh'akya'i @77a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang reg bya'i skye mched dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do // sh'akya'i @77a * //
translated: “The form that is the object of the eye consciousness is not the nature of that consciousness,

original: sras po'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sras po'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is the object of the eye consciousness, like the form that is the object of the eye consciousness of a son of the Śākya.”

original: sh'akya ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //🔽de'i sras po ni de'i slob ma'o //
analyzed: sh'akya ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so // de'i sras po ni de'i slob ma'o //
translated: The son of the Śākya is a disciple of the Blessed Buddha Śākya.

original: de rnams kyi gang yin pa de ni sh'akya'i sras po'i'o //🔽sh'akya'i sras po'i ma yin pas /
analyzed: de rnams kyi gang yin pa de ni sh'akya'i sras po'i'o // sh'akya'i sras po'i ma yin pas /
translated: The form that is the object of the eye consciousness of a son of the Śākya is the form that is the object of the eye consciousness of a disciple of the Blessed Buddha Śākya.🔽The form that is the object of the eye consciousness of a son of the Śākya is not the nature of that consciousness,

original: sh'akya'i sras po'i ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras po'i ma yin pa'o zhes bya bar tshig bsdu'o //
translated: because it is the object of the eye consciousness, like the form that is the object of the eye consciousness of a son of the Śākya.

original: de lta bu de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is that like?🔽Therefore, it is said: “The form that is the object of the eye consciousness is not the nature of that consciousness,

original: de'i phyir reg bya'i skye mched dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir reg bya'i skye mched dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: because it is the object of the eye consciousness, like the form that is the object of the eye consciousness of a son of the Śākya.”

original: rlung gi khams ni reg bya'i skye mched du gtogs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni reg bya'i skye mched du gtogs pa'i phyir /
translated: The wind element is included in the sense base of tactility.

original: gcig tu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: gcig tu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is not obscured and neutral.

original: rnam par rig byed ni de lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ni de lta bu ma yin te /
translated: But expression is not like that.

original: de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because its characteristics are different.

original: de bas nad rlung gi khams de'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gal ba dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin par rung bar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o //🔽phyogs snga mas smras ma thag pa yang rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / yang nyi ma 'char ka pa dag 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: de bas nad rlung gi khams de'i rang bzhin du ji ltar 'gal ba dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin par rung bar 'gyur zhes dgongs pa'o // phyogs snga mas smras ma thag pa yang rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / yang nyi ma 'char ka pa dag 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: Therefore, how could it be proper for the wind element, which is of that nature, to be virtue and so on, which are incompatible with it?🔽The opponent just mentioned also refutes the Vaibhasikas extensively.

original: phyogs gzhan sems par byed de /
analyzed: phyogs gzhan sems par byed de /
translated: The sunripening Vaibhasikas think about another position and say,

original: rlung gi khams ni rnam par rig par mi byed pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur bas rnam par rig byed nyid du mi rung na /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni rnam par rig par mi byed pa la sogs par thal bar 'gyur bas rnam par rig byed nyid du mi rung na /
translated: If the wind element is not suitable to be expression because it would follow that the wind element would not express and so on,

original: yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba gang yin pa sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams de nyid kyis bskyod pa de kho na skyon med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul gzhan du lus 'byung ba gang yin pa sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa'i rlung gi khams de nyid kyis bskyod pa de kho na skyon med pa'i phyir /
translated: The element of wind that arises from a special mind and moves the body to another place is itself the unimpeded movement.

original: rnam par rig byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by “it becomes informative form.”

original: rnam par rig byed btags pa can yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis sun phyung ba mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed btags pa can yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis sun phyung ba mdzad pa'o //
translated: The master Buddhapālita refutes this in the following way:

original: lus ni rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed de'i rang bzhin yin na rdzas nyid nyams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus ni rdzas du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed de'i rang bzhin yin na rdzas nyid nyams so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “If the body were by nature informative form, then substance would be impaired, because the body is the nature of many substances.”

original: gzhan yang rnam par rig byed ni rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par rig byed ni rnam par rig par byed pa ma yin par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
translated: Moreover, this other fault would also apply: “Informative form would not be informative.”

original: 'dir ni dri la sogs pa phyogs gcig gi sgo nas /
analyzed: 'dir ni dri la sogs pa phyogs gcig gi sgo nas /
translated: Here, smell and so on are not informative form because they are not like form.

original: rnam par rig par mi byed pa nyid kyi skyon yod pa'i gzugs kyi sgo nas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rig par mi byed pa nyid kyi skyon yod pa'i gzugs kyi sgo nas ni ma yin te /
translated: not by way of form, because the fault of non-perception would exist.

original: de ni bltar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni bltar rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For that is visible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: dri la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: dri la sogs pa zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: he says, “smell, etc.”

original: dri la sogs pa'i skye mched dge ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no /🔽'o na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: dri la sogs pa'i skye mched dge ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no / 'o na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The sense-spheres of smell, etc., are wholesome, etc., as before.

original: yang de dang de dag nyid phyogs @77b gzhan la sems pa yin no //
analyzed: yang de dang de dag nyid phyogs @77b gzhan la sems pa yin no //
translated: Now, he begins the consideration of another aspect of those same sense-spheres.

original: slob dpon gyis phyogs de yang yi mi rung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis phyogs de yang yi mi rung ba'i phyir //
translated: The Master criticizes that position as unacceptable,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun dbyung ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun dbyung ba gsungs te /
translated: saying, “That is not so,” etc.

original: rang gi sa bon dang / rlung gi khams kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon dang / rlung gi khams kyi khyad par las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: From the special features of its own seed and the wind element.

original: kha dog de'i rang gi sa bon ni skad cig ma snga mas bsdus bskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: kha dog de'i rang gi sa bon ni skad cig ma snga mas bsdus bskal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The seed of that color is the homogeneous cause subsumed by the prior moment.

original: rlung gi khams ni yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni yul gzhan du 'byung ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: The wind element is the cause of its arising in another place.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no //🔽rang gi sa bon dang rlung gi khams ni /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no // rang gi sa bon dang rlung gi khams ni /
translated: The co-operating conditions are the seed and the wind element.

original: rang gi sa bon dang rlung gi khams dag go //
analyzed: rang gi sa bon dang rlung gi khams dag go //
translated: The seed and the wind element are the co-operating conditions.

original: de gnyis kyi khyad par ni /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi khyad par ni /
translated: The difference between these two is

original: rang gi sa bon dang / rlung gi khams kyi khyad par te /
analyzed: rang gi sa bon dang / rlung gi khams kyi khyad par te /
translated: the difference between the seed and the wind element.

original: de ni de kho na las skyes pa yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni de kho na las skyes pa yin gyi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The seed is the cause of the sprout, not anything else.

original: thog mar yul gzhan du bskyod par bya'o snyam pa'i sems 'byung la /
analyzed: thog mar yul gzhan du bskyod par bya'o snyam pa'i sems 'byung la /
translated: First, the mind arises with the thought, “I will go to another place.”

original: de las ni rtsol ba 'byung ba /
analyzed: de las ni rtsol ba 'byung ba /
translated: From that, effort arises.

original: de las kyang rlung 'byung /
analyzed: de las kyang rlung 'byung /
translated: From that, wind arises.

original: rlung las kyang lag pa 'byung ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rlung las kyang lag pa 'byung ba ma yin nam /
translated: Doesn’t the hand arise from wind?

original: de ji ltar lag pa la gnas pa'i kha dog sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar lag pa la gnas pa'i kha dog sems kyi khyad par las skyes pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the color of the hand, which is based on the hand, does not arise from a special mind?

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: 'di ltar gzhan gyis de ni de'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes mngon sum gyi rgyu nyid kyis kha dog sems kyi khyad par las skyes par 'dod kyi brgyud pas ni ma yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan gyis de ni de'i dbang gis dge ba la sogs par 'gyur ro zhes mngon sum gyi rgyu nyid kyis kha dog sems kyi khyad par las skyes par 'dod kyi brgyud pas ni ma yin pas so //
translated: Thus, others assert that form is generated from the mind due to the cause of direct perception, since it becomes virtuous and so on due to the power of the mind.

original: kha dog dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs kyi skye mched ni dge ba la sogs par 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kha dog dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzugs kyi skye mched ni dge ba la sogs par 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: They assert that the form base is virtuous and so on because it is asserted that color is virtuous and nonvirtuous and so on.

original: ji ltar der gtogs pa'i kha dog dge ba la sogs pa'i gzugs ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar der gtogs pa'i kha dog dge ba la sogs pa'i gzugs ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that color that is included in that is not virtuous and so on?

original: bshad pa 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: bshad pa 'gal ba med de /
translated: There is no contradiction in this explanation.

original: 'di ltar kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis /
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas slong ba'i dbang gis /
translated: Thus, due to the power of motivation,🔽indicative form is virtuous and so on.

original: de la rnam par rig byed dge ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya bas de'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs la dge ba la sogs pa'i gzugs zhes bya'i /
analyzed: de la rnam par rig byed dge ba la sogs pa'o zhes bya bas de'i rang bzhin gyi gzugs la dge ba la sogs pa'i gzugs zhes bya'i /
translated: Therefore, form that is its nature is called virtuous and so on,

original: sngon po la sogs pa kha dog gi rang bzhin gcig tu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa kha dog gi rang bzhin gcig tu ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yang yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that color such as blue is exclusively unobscured neutral, which is one type of color.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i phyogs kyang sun phyung ba kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i phyogs kyang sun phyung ba kho na'i phyir /
translated: Because the immediately preceding condition has just been refuted.

original: kha dog ltar ma yin yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gzhan sems pa yin no //
analyzed: kha dog ltar ma yin yang rung zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gzhan sems pa yin no //
translated: “Even if it is not like color,” etc. refers to the consideration of another position.

original: lha rnams dga' ba zhes bya la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyi bsting tshig gis sun 'byin par mdzad pa'o //🔽gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yang ma mthong la zhes bya bas ni mngon sum @78a * //
analyzed: lha rnams dga' ba zhes bya la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyi bsting tshig gis sun 'byin par mdzad pa'o // gzugs la sogs pa bzhin du yang ma mthong la zhes bya bas ni mngon sum @78a * //
translated: “The gods rejoice,” etc. refers to the refutation by the Master’s ridicule.

original: gyi tshad mas gzung bar bya ba med par ston te /
analyzed: gyi tshad mas gzung bar bya ba med par ston te /
translated: “Nor do we see it as form, etc.,” refers to the nonapprehension of the object by the valid cognition of direct perception.

original: nus pa yang ma mthong zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nus pa med pas rjes su dpag pa med par ston to //
analyzed: nus pa yang ma mthong zhes bya bas ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i nus pa med pas rjes su dpag pa med par ston to //
translated: “Nor do we see its capacity,” refers to the nonapprehension of the object by the valid cognition of inference, since there is no causal efficacy.

original: mi mthong na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mi mthong na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “If it is not seen,” etc.

original: 'byung ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir bltar mi rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni gzugs kyi rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir bltar mi rung ba nyid do //
translated: The elements are not visible because they are not by nature form.

original: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang de'i rang bzhin yin na ni de yang rnam par rig par mi byed pa yin te bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig byed kyang de'i rang bzhin yin na ni de yang rnam par rig par mi byed pa yin te bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If the informative form also has that nature, then it would not be informative, because it would not be suitable to be seen.🔽Moreover, there is this other error: If color were virtuous or nonvirtuous,

original: gzhan yang kha dog dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang kha dog dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid yin na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
translated: and so on.🔽Color is not like that.

original: kha dog ni de lta ma yin no zhes de ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha dog ni de lta ma yin no zhes de ni bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This has already been explained.🔽This is also not the opinion of the son of the Śākyas.

original: kha dog dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa 'di yang sh'akya'i sras po'i ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'das ma thag pa 'dis so //🔽'di skad du 'byung ba ni kha dog la rag las pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis ni /
analyzed: kha dog dge ba dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa 'di yang sh'akya'i sras po'i ma yin no zhes bya ba la 'das ma thag pa 'dis so // 'di skad du 'byung ba ni kha dog la rag las pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis ni /
translated: This is stated by the immediately preceding passage.

original: dge ba la sogs par 'gyur yang srid na /
analyzed: dge ba la sogs par 'gyur yang srid na /
translated: The following is stated: It is possible that the elements would be virtuous and so on by the power of color, because they depend on color.

original: gang gi tshe de nyid dge ba la sogs par mi srid pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid dge ba la sogs par mi srid pa de'i tshe /
translated: But when it is not possible that they are virtuous and so on,

original: 'byung ba de ltar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba de ltar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya bstan pa yin no //
translated: how could the elements be like that?

original: rnam par rig byed rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba pa dag phugs thug nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa tsam zhig yod na yang drag go snyam nas /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed rgya cher sun phyung ba dang / bye brag tu smra ba pa dag phugs thug nas rnam par rig byed ma yin pa tsam zhig yod na yang drag go snyam nas /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas, having been defeated, think that it is better to have just non-informative form.

original: 'o na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa tsam zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rig byed ma yin pa tsam zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, they say, “What is this so-called non-informative form?”

original: slob dpon rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang sun dbyung bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: slob dpon rnam par rig byed ma yin pa yang sun dbyung bar bzhed nas /
translated: The Master, wishing to refute non-informative form,

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhes rgyas par dris pas rgol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhes rgyas par dris pas rgol bar mdzad do //
translated: asks, “What is this so-called non-informative form?” and so on, and he refutes it.

original: sdom pa la sogs pa'i gzugs chos kyi skye mched pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sdom pa la sogs pa'i gzugs chos kyi skye mched pa yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas say that the form of vows and so on is a phenomenon base.

original: bye brag tu smra ba pa dag rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o //🔽sdom pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba pa dag rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin rnam par 'jog par byed pa'o // sdom pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: They posit the nature of non-informative form.

original: sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma yin pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “vows and so on” includes non-vows and so on.

original: ji ltar na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: How is there nonindicative form in the desire realm?

original: rnam par rig byed sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed sun phyung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated because indicative form is refuted.

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa zhes smos pa ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa zhes smos pa ni /
translated: The phrase in the desire realm is stated

original: gzugs na spyod pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: to refute that it exists in the form realm.

original: de ni bsam gtan gyi sems la rag las pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed gzhan la @78b ltos par mi byed do //🔽'di la rnam par rig byed med pa yod pas na /🔽rnam par rig byed med pa ste /
analyzed: de ni bsam gtan gyi sems la rag las pa'i phyir rnam par rig byed gzhan la @78b ltos par mi byed do // 'di la rnam par rig byed med pa yod pas na / rnam par rig byed med pa ste /
translated: That is because it does not depend on other indicative form since it depends on the mind of absorption.🔽It is called nonindicative because it exists without indicative form.

original: rnam par rig byed yod pa ma yin pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed yod pa ma yin pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called nonindicative because it exists without indicative form.🔽If it is, what is the problem?

original: gal te yin na ci 'gyur zhe na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag go //
analyzed: gal te yin na ci 'gyur zhe na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag go //
translated: This is said by Vaibhasikas.

original: gal te yin na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gal te yin na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: If it is,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa can yin na'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam par rig byed ma yin pa can yin na'o //
translated: if nonindicative form in the desire realm has indicative form,

original: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: cir 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /
translated: what is the problem?

original: skyon cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: skyon cir 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: What is the fault?

original: sems kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It would follow the mind.

original: slob dpon gyis skyon brjod par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis skyon brjod par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Master has stated the fault.

original: ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?🔽Therefore, he says,

original: de'i phyir / dper na gzugs na spyod pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / dper na gzugs na spyod pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: For example, like the one in the form realm.

original: gal te bye brag tu smra ba dag skyon 'di ni yod du zad de kho bo cag khas kyang len na /
analyzed: gal te bye brag tu smra ba dag skyon 'di ni yod du zad de kho bo cag khas kyang len na /
translated: If the Vaibhāṣikas say, “This fault exists, but we accept it,”

original: de ltar gyur pa la skyon gzhan ci yod ces zer du dogs nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa la skyon gzhan ci yod ces zer du dogs nas /
translated: fearing that they might say, “What other fault is there in that case?”

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, he says,

original: sems gzhan dang sems med pa pa dag la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sems gzhan dang sems med pa pa dag la zhes bya ba la /
translated: In other minds and in mindless states.

original: de la sems gzhan dag ni sdom pa la sogs pa len pa dge ba la sogs pa'i sems las logs shig pa ni sems gzhan dag go //
analyzed: de la sems gzhan dag ni sdom pa la sogs pa len pa dge ba la sogs pa'i sems las logs shig pa ni sems gzhan dag go //
translated: Among them, other minds are those that are different from the virtuous mind that takes up vows and so on.

original: sems med pa pa dag ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sems yod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems med pa pa dag ni 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i sems yod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: Mindless states are those in which the mind does not exist, such as the meditative attainment of cessation and so on.

original: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang /
analyzed: sdom pa dang sdom pa ma yin pa gnyis med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni 'dir yang /
translated: And there would be neither vows nor non-vows.

original: dper na bsam gtan gyi sdom pa lta bu zhes dpe khong nas drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na bsam gtan gyi sdom pa lta bu zhes dpe khong nas drang bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the example should be drawn from within the text, “For example, like the absorption vow.”

original: dus yongs su bzung bas 'phangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: dus yongs su bzung bas 'phangs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Because it is projected by the complete assumption of the vow, etc.

original: bye brag tu smra ba pa dag gis thal bar 'gyur ba la lan btab pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba pa dag gis thal bar 'gyur ba la lan btab pa yin no //
translated: This is the response to the consequence by the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: 'di skad du gal te dus kyi mtshams yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems 'phen par byed pa med na ni /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te dus kyi mtshams yongs su 'dzin pa'i sems 'phen par byed pa med na ni /
translated: They say, “If the mind that completely assumes the vow does not project it,

original: de'i tshe gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzugs na spyod pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa bzhin du /
translated: then, like the non-informative form of the form realm,

original: sems gzhan dang sems med pa dag la sdom pa la sogs pa med do //
analyzed: sems gzhan dang sems med pa dag la sdom pa la sogs pa med do //
translated: vows, etc., would not exist in other minds or in mindless states.

original: zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: zhes bya bar thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: This would be the consequence.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: 'on kyang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog go snyam pa de ni yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gcod pa la sogs pa las ldog go snyam pa de ni yod pa kho na'o //
translated: However, the thought, ‘I will refrain from taking life and so on for as long as I live,’ definitely exists.

original: de bas na des 'phangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na des 'phangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is projected by that.🔽

original: thal ches par ga la 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: thal ches par ga la 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, how can it be an overextension to say that nonindicative form arises from that?🔽This is the explanation.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i @79a * //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo bstan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i @79a * //
translated: And because of the teaching of the Sūtra on Individual Liberation,

original: phyir yang / rnam par rig byed med par yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: phyir yang / rnam par rig byed med par yang rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: you should understand that nonindicative form also occurs without indicative form.

original: gal te rnam par rig byed sngon du song ba kho na las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rig byed sngon du song ba kho na las rnam par rig byed ma yin pa 'byung na /
translated: If nonindicative form arises only from prior indicative form,

analyzed: de med par yang so sor thar pa'i mdo bstan pa dang / ltung ba bcabs pas dge 'dun slu bar byed pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'i rang bzhin brdzun du smra ba'i kha na mtho ba ji ltar 'byung snyam du bsams so // 'o na ni rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas /

original: slob dpon gyis skyon gzhan du ston par mdzad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis skyon gzhan du ston par mdzad do //
translated: The master Vasubandhu demonstrates another fault in the assertion that nonindicative form is a substance with the line, “Since nonindicative form is twofold,” and so on.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge dang mi dge zhes bya bar mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i skabs med do //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa rnam pa gnyis yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni dge dang mi dge zhes bya bar mtshan nyid gsungs pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i skabs med do //
translated: Because nonindicative form is of two types, it is said that it is virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: gzhan yang de'i skad cig pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba yang rnam par rig byed ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang de'i skad cig pa'i dge ba dang mi dge ba yang rnam par rig byed ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar sbyar ro //

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ni rjes su 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: rjes 'brang gang zhes bya bar mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: rjes 'brang gang zhes bya bar mtshan nyid bstan pa'i phyir na /

analyzed: skad cig ma gcig gis bsdus pa la rnam par rig byed ma yin pa nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

original: lus dang ngag gi las gzugs can ni /

original: slob dpon nyid kyis gsungs pa yin te /

analyzed: 'di skad du / bdag cag gis rnam par rig byed 'di ci dbyibs kyi bdag nyid can yin nam /

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa'am /

original: 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ltos nas /
analyzed: 'bras bu 'byung bar 'gyur ba la ltos nas /

analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa nyid du ji ltar 'grub par 'gyur zhes bstan pa yin no //
