analyzed: de dang 'dra ba smos pa ni 'bras bu mthun pa 'phen pa la bya ste /
translated: The reason for saying “another effect similar to that” is that a cause projects an effect that is similar to itself.

original: rgyu thams cad ni 'bras bu thams cad 'phen par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu thams cad ni 'bras bu thams cad 'phen par byed pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that not all causes project all effects.

original: re zhig ji ltar 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni //
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni //
translated: “How is it an effect?” and so forth.

original: slob dpon nyid kyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir rmed par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir rmed par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Master himself asks this in order to refute them.

original: skye bar 'jog pa rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bar 'jog pa rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “it is suitable to posit arising” and so on indicates that the Vaibhāṣikas present the definition of projecting.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis mtshan nyid 'khrul bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis mtshan nyid 'khrul bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “but if that is so” and so on indicates that the Master teaches that the definition is mistaken.

original: de la dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i tshe'i skad cig ma'i mtha' ste /
analyzed: de la dgra bcom pa yongs su mya ngan las 'da' pa'i tshe'i skad cig ma'i mtha' ste /
translated: In that regard, the final moment of an arhat who is entering nirvāṇa

original: tha ma gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'phen no //
analyzed: tha ma gang yin pa de ni lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi 'phen no //
translated: is not projected because the causes that would produce its effect are incomplete.

original: gzhan yang las gang zhig gi 'bras bu so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pas 'gags pa de yang 'phen par byed pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: gzhan yang las gang zhig gi 'bras bu so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pas 'gags pa de yang 'phen par byed pa ma yin pas /
translated: Moreover, any karma whose effect is obstructed by the cessation that is not a state of discernment is also not projected.

original: de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor brtags pa ma yin pas pas 'gog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore the phrase “cessation that is not a state of discernment” and so on is stated.

original: rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi skye bar @81a * //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan ma tshang ba'i phyir 'bras bu mi skye bar @81a * //
translated: Because other causes are incomplete, the effect does not arise.

original: zad kyi / tha ma la sogs pa des ni 'phangs pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: zad kyi / tha ma la sogs pa des ni 'phangs pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t the last moment projected by that?

original: ji ltar na 'bras bu 'phen pa ma yin zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'bras bu 'phen pa ma yin zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How could it not project an effect?

original: de ltar ni med de /
analyzed: de ltar ni med de /
translated: It is not like that.

original: 'di ltar gang gis na rgyu gzhan ma tshang yang de la de 'phen pa'i nus pa yod par yid ches par 'gyur pa de lta bu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ni 'ga' yang mi dmigs pas de ni gyi na'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis na rgyu gzhan ma tshang yang de la de 'phen pa'i nus pa yod par yid ches par 'gyur pa de lta bu las 'bras bu 'byung ba ni 'ga' yang mi dmigs pas de ni gyi na'o //
translated: Because the arising of an effect is never observed when other causes are incomplete, even though it has the capacity to project it.

original: de 'phen pa'i nus pa med du zad mod /
analyzed: de 'phen pa'i nus pa med du zad mod /
translated: It is just that it does not have the capacity to project it.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What follows from that?

original: de'i phyir thog ma nyid nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma nyid nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “From the very beginning,” and so on.

original: 'di skad du gzhan gyis bya ba byed pa'i gnas skabs zhig pas dngos po zhig pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi rang gi ngo bo cad pas ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gzhan gyis bya ba byed pa'i gnas skabs zhig pas dngos po zhig pa nyid du rnam par gzhag gi rang gi ngo bo cad pas ni ma yin na /
translated: This is what is said: Since the state of activity by another is destroyed, the thing is posited as destroyed, but not by the destruction of its own nature.

original: tha ma la sogs pa la yang bya ba byed pa'i gnas skabs nyid med pas ji ltar zhig pa nyid du 'gyur /
analyzed: tha ma la sogs pa la yang bya ba byed pa'i gnas skabs nyid med pas ji ltar zhig pa nyid du 'gyur /
translated: Since the last moment of existence and so on do not have the state of performing an action, how could they be destroyed?

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu par byed do //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug bsdu par byed do //
translated: Thus, he concludes with “Therefore, etc.”

original: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rang bzhin can zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Having such a nature” means “having such a type.”

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag go //
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na zhes zer ba ni bye brag tu smra ba pa dag go //
translated: The Vaibhāṣikas ask, “If that is so, then how?”

original: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis 'phen pa'i mtshan nyid phyin ci ma log par ston pa yin no //
translated: The Master teaches the unerring characteristics of impulsion with “That which, etc.”

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni las kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyus so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni las kyi rang bzhin gyi rgyus so //
translated: “That which” refers to the cause that is the nature of action.

original: 'bras bu'i sa bon gso bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni nang na 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i sa bon gnas pa brtag par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i sa bon gso bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni nang na 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i sa bon gnas pa brtag par byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “It nourishes the seed of the effect” means that it causes the seed that is related to the effect to remain in the inner continuum.

original: 'dir yang sngon med pa'i sa bon 'byung ba ni 'phen pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang sngon med pa'i sa bon 'byung ba ni 'phen pa ma yin no //
translated: Here, the arising of a seed that did not exist previously is not impulsion.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la gnas pa kho na gso bar byed pa yin par rig par bya'o//
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud la gnas pa kho na gso bar byed pa yin par rig par bya'o//
translated: It should be understood that the life faculty heals the life stream of consciousness.

original: de lta ma yin na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs rnam par gzhag pa rgyud so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na nyan thos la sogs pa'i rigs rnam par gzhag pa rgyud so sor nges par mi 'gyur ro /
translated: Otherwise, the classification of lineages of disciples and so on would not be determined by individual life streams.

original: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis kyang gang gis 'bras bu'i sa bon gso bar byed pa zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis kyang gang gis 'bras bu'i sa bon gso bar byed pa zhes gsungs so //
translated: For that reason, the Master also says, “It heals the seed of the result.”

original: gang gi ltar na 'das pa yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon nyid kyis gzhan gyi phyogs ha cang thal bar ston pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi ltar na 'das pa yod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon nyid kyis gzhan gyi phyogs ha cang thal bar ston pa yin te /
translated: The Master himself demonstrates the extreme absurdity of the opponent’s position in the line, “If you say that the past exists, etc.”

original: ma 'ongs pa yang da ltar byung ba bzhin du grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa yang da ltar byung ba bzhin du grub pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the future would be established as having an intrinsic reality just like the present,

original: 'bras bu 'phen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phen par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it would project a result. This is the meaning of the passage.

original: gzhan yang rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do //
translated: Moreover, this other error would also occur, as stated in the line, “It would be permanent, etc.”

original: gang las @81b de'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang brjod pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: gang las @81b de'i 'bras bu 'di yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang brjod pa'i rigs so //
translated: It would be reasonable to say that this is the result of that, and so on.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “therefore” and so on concludes the discussion.

original: slob dpon gyis lus la sogs pa'i las gzugs can dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin pa rgya cher bkag pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba pa dag 'o na ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gzhan sems so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis lus la sogs pa'i las gzugs can dge ba la sogs pa nyid yin pa rgya cher bkag pa dang / bye brag tu smra ba pa dag 'o na ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gzhan sems so //
translated: The Master has extensively refuted the claim that virtuous and so on are physical actions such as bodily actions and so on, and the Vaibhāṣikas consider another position, namely, that virtuous and nonvirtuous are mental factors.

original: phung po'i rgyud la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phung po'i rgyud la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “in the stream of the aggregates” means

original: sems kyi rgyud la yin gyi /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud la yin gyi /
translated: in the stream of mind.

original: bdag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not mean in the self,

original: de ni yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that the self exists.

original: chos gzhan zhig bskyed de zhes bya ba ni sems dang / sems las byung ba las ma gtogs par rang bzhin gzhan kho na zhig skyed kyi /
analyzed: chos gzhan zhig bskyed de zhes bya ba ni sems dang / sems las byung ba las ma gtogs par rang bzhin gzhan kho na zhig skyed kyi /
translated: The phrase “it generates another phenomenon” means that it generates a different nature, something other than mind and mental factors.

original: de nyid la bsgo bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de nyid la bsgo bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It does not mean that it controls those.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don 'di nyid sde pa gzhan la grags pa'i rnam grangs kyis ston pa yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni don 'di nyid sde pa gzhan la grags pa'i rnam grangs kyis ston pa yin te /
translated: Some say it is a heap, and so on. This is the same point taught by the synonyms accepted by other schools.

original: de la nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nges pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates certainty.

original: kha cig na re bstsags pa zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun phal chen sde pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: kha cig na re bstsags pa zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun phal chen sde pa rnams yin te /
translated: Some say it is a heap. This refers to the Mahāsāṃgika school,

original: de dag ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin la bstsags pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis tha snyad rjod par byed do //🔽gzhan dag na re chud mi za ba zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin la bstsags pa zhes bya ba'i sgra 'dis tha snyad rjod par byed do // gzhan dag na re chud mi za ba zhes zer ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: because they use the term “heap” to refer to that kind of nature.

original: 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa dag ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa mang pos bkur ba'i sde pa dag ste /
translated: Others say it is nonexpiration. This refers to the noble school of the Saṃmitīyas,

original: de dag kyang rang gi sde pa dag gi nang na chung mi za ba zhes bya ba 'dis tha snyad rjod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag kyang rang gi sde pa dag gi nang na chung mi za ba zhes bya ba 'dis tha snyad rjod par byed do //
translated: because they use the term “nonexpiration” to refer to that kind of nature.

original: ci ste gzhan de lta bu'i chos gzhan yod par tshad ma gang las mngon snyam du sems par dogs nas /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan de lta bu'i chos gzhan yod par tshad ma gang las mngon snyam du sems par dogs nas /
translated: If you wonder what valid knowledge reveals the existence of such a phenomenon,

original: de ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i rjes su dpag pas grub par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is established by inference called effect,

original: gang las tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang las tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, “because of the effect called future life,” and so on.

original: gang zhig gang yod na 'byung ba de ni rgyu de sngon du song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshad ma'i don yang 'dir blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig gang yod na 'byung ba de ni rgyu de sngon du song ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bshad pa'i tshad ma'i don yang 'dir blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the valid cognition explained above, “that which occurs when something exists is called preceded by that cause,” and so on, should be understood here.

original: 'di'i phyir yang ji ltar 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa 'grub par nus pa'i chos gzhan kho na zhig skyed par yid ches par gyis shig ces bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang ji ltar 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa 'grub par nus pa'i chos gzhan kho na zhig skyed par yid ches par gyis shig ces bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that for this reason as well, you should believe that it produces another phenomenon that is capable of establishing a pleasant effect, and so on,

original: gal te sems kyi rgyud la chos gzhan zhig mi skyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te sems kyi rgyud la chos gzhan zhig mi skyed na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, “if it does not produce another phenomenon in the continuum of the mind,” and so on.🔽This concludes the summary.

original: gdon mi za bar de 'dod par bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni mjug sdud pa yin no //🔽'o na zhes bya ba la @82a * //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar de 'dod par bya'o zhe na zhes bya ba 'dis ni mjug sdud pa yin no //🔽'o na zhes bya ba la @82a * //
translated: If you say, “It is not necessary to accept that,”

original: la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis chos gzhan 'khrul pa yod pa'i sgro nas /
analyzed: la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis chos gzhan 'khrul pa yod pa'i sgro nas /
translated: The phrase “and so on” indicates that the master has eliminated the error of other phenomena.

original: gtan tshigs mi 'grub par ston pa yin no //🔽'di skad du re zhig nged la ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi 'grub par ston pa yin no // 'di skad du re zhig nged la ni /
translated: and so on, the master shows that the reason is not established because of the fallacy of another property.🔽This is what he is saying:

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: First, for us,

original: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa skye ba ni chos gzhan yod na 'byung ba yin no zhes grags pa'i don 'di nyid ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba la sogs pa skye ba ni chos gzhan yod na 'byung ba yin no zhes grags pa'i don 'di nyid ma grub pa yin te /
translated: the meaning of the statement “the arising of a pleasant effect and so on occurs when another property exists” is not established.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de ni bag chags sngon du song bar yang srid pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bag chags sngon du song bar yang srid pas /
translated: Because it is possible that it is preceded by latent potentialities.

original: gtan tshigs mi 'grub pa yin no /🔽gzhan yang 'bras bu skye ba ni /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi 'grub pa yin no / gzhan yang 'bras bu skye ba ni /
translated: The reason is not established.

original: bag chags sngon du 'gro ba kho na yin par rtogs par nus te /
analyzed: bag chags sngon du 'gro ba kho na yin par rtogs par nus te /
translated: Moreover, the arising of an effect can be understood to be preceded by latent potentialities.

original: 'di ltar de ni gzhung la sogs pa'i yul la yang 'byung bas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni gzhung la sogs pa'i yul la yang 'byung bas so //
translated: Because it occurs even in regard to such objects as texts.

original: de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin no //
translated: It is not like that.

original: gzhan gyis de'i yul la chos gzhan las ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyis de'i yul la chos gzhan las ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because another does not accept that its object is another property.

original: ji ltar 'bras bu 'byung zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu 'byung zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: How can an effect arise?

original: gzhung la goms pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhung la goms pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase to be familiar with the scriptures means🔽.

original: 'dris pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dris pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “familiar with the scriptures” means “habituated to the scriptures.”

original: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: mthong ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The phrase “with regard to other objects, such as those that are seen” means

original: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don dag la ste /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / bye brag phyed pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i don dag la ste /
translated: with regard to objects that are seen, heard, discerned, or known.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: dran pa skye ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: dran pa skye ba zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “the arising of memory” is supplied.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhung la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gzhung la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The phrase “with regard to that” refers to the scriptures, etc.

original: goms pa des chos ci zhig skyed par byed ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: goms pa des chos ci zhig skyed par byed ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase “what dharma does that familiarity generate?” means

original: gzhan gyis dge ba la sogs pa'i yul las ma gtogs par chos gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de mi skyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dge ba la sogs pa'i yul las ma gtogs par chos gzhan khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de mi skyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that it does not generate anything, because others do not accept any dharma that is not included among the objects of virtue, etc.

original: gzhan yang skad cig ma gang la zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang skad cig ma gang la zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be said that “with regard to which moment”?

original: skyed par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “it generates” is supplied.

original: don ni 'di skad du ci skad cig ma dang po la skyed dam /
analyzed: don ni 'di skad du ci skad cig ma dang po la skyed dam /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Does it generate in the first moment?

original: 'on te gnyis pa dag la skyed /
analyzed: 'on te gnyis pa dag la skyed /
translated: Or does it generate in the second moment?

original: gal te re zhig skad cig ma dang po la yin no zhe na /🔽de lta na 'o na ni lan cig goms pa na /
analyzed: gal te re zhig skad cig ma dang po la yin no zhe na / de lta na 'o na ni lan cig goms pa na /
translated: If you say that it is the first moment,

original: chos gzhan de skyed pas /
analyzed: chos gzhan de skyed pas /
translated: then, in that case, since it generates that other phenomenon,

original: de'i 'og tu goms pa don med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu goms pa don med pa nyid yin no //
translated: the subsequent moment of habituation would be pointless.

original: 'on te skad cig ma gzhan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma gzhan gnyis pa la sogs pa dag la'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is the second moment and so on,

original: de ni mi 'thad de /🔽rkyen la khyad par med pa'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi 'thad de / rkyen la khyad par med pa'i phyir bstan pa yin no //
translated: that is not tenable,🔽because the condition would not be different.

original: skad cig ma gang la zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: skad cig ma gang la zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: This is stated because the condition would not be different.

original: skad cig pa ma yin par smra ba dag sun dbyung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skad cig pa ma yin par smra ba dag sun dbyung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand that this is a refutation of those who do not accept momentariness.

original: de lta ma yin na ni /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ni /
translated: If that were not so,

original: skad cig ma nyid kyis rkyen la khyad par yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid kyis rkyen la khyad par yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then because of momentariness, the condition would be different.

original: de ji ltar sun dbyung bar rung mthong ba la sogs pa des @82b zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ji ltar sun dbyung bar rung mthong ba la sogs pa des @82b zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How could it be refuted?

original: chos ci zhig gam skad cig ma gang la skyed par byed ces bya bar sbyar la /
analyzed: chos ci zhig gam skad cig ma gang la skyed par byed ces bya bar sbyar la /
translated: What phenomenon or what moment generates that?

original: 'di yang snga ma dang mthun par thams cad la sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di yang snga ma dang mthun par thams cad la sbyar ro //
translated: This is applied to all in the same way as before.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan no //
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni dus gzhan no //
translated: “Later” means at another time.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i sems kyis kyang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa'i sems kyis kyang zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: “By the mind that is entering the meditative attainment of cessation, etc.” means what?

original: chos ci zhig gam /
analyzed: chos ci zhig gam /
translated: What dharma?

original: skad cig ma gang la skyed par byed ces bya ba thams cad la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: skad cig ma gang la skyed par byed ces bya ba thams cad la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In what moment does it generate? All of this must be applied.

original: 'dir yang bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang bshad pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Here also the explanation is the same as before.🔽You must also state this other point:

original: ma du lung ga'i me tog ces bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang khyed kyis brjod dgos so //
analyzed: ma du lung ga'i me tog ces bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang khyed kyis brjod dgos so //
translated: “The flower of the madūka tree, etc.”

original: bsgos pa ni zhen par byas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgos pa ni zhen par byas pa'o //
translated: “Perfumed” means impregnated.

original: de dang lhan cig tu 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni ma du lung ga'i me tog dang lhan cig tu 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu 'gags pas zhes bya ba ni ma du lung ga'i me tog dang lhan cig tu 'gags pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “By its cessation together with it” means by the cessation together with the flower of the madūka tree.

original: de'i 'bras bu la zhes bya ba ni ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu la ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu la zhes bya ba ni ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu la ste /
translated: “In its fruit” means in the fruit of the madūka tree.

original: chos ci zhig skyed par byed do zhes mi skyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos ci zhig skyed par byed do zhes mi skyed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What dharma does it generate? It does not generate anything. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar na re zhig slob dpon gyis bye brag tu smra ba pa'i phyogs la chos gzhan skyed pa ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar rgya cher bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig slob dpon gyis bye brag tu smra ba pa'i phyogs la chos gzhan skyed pa ji ltar mi 'thad pa de ltar rgya cher bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the master has extensively established how it is untenable that another phenomenon is produced, in the standpoint of the Vaibhāṣikas.

original: da ni mdo sde pa dag gi phyogs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir de bas na ji ltar kun tu brtags pa'i chos gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni mdo sde pa dag gi phyogs gzhan bstan pa'i phyir de bas na ji ltar kun tu brtags pa'i chos gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to present the standpoint of the Sautrāntikas, he says, Therefore, how could another phenomenon be imagined, and so on.

original: ma du lung ga'i me tog rgya skyegs kyi khu bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe yin te go bar sla'o //🔽'o na lus dang ngag gi las kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: ma du lung ga'i me tog rgya skyegs kyi khu bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe yin te go bar sla'o // 'o na lus dang ngag gi las kyis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The example, “the flower of the madūka tree is dyed with lac juice,” and so on, is easy to understand.🔽Now, the Vaibhāṣikas object, “But also by the actions of body and speech,

original: bye brag tu smra ba pa dag phyir rgol bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba pa dag phyir rgol bar byed pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di skad du sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos gzhan dang / 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyur ma rung na ma rung du zad do //
analyzed: 'di skad du sems dang mi ldan pa'i chos gzhan dang / 'bras bu skye ba'i rgyur ma rung na ma rung du zad do //
translated: They say, “If it is untenable that another phenomenon that is not associated with the mind is the cause of the arising of the effect, then so be it.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar sems pas sems kyi rgyud la bsgo bar byed ces bya ba de bzhin du lus dang / ngag gi las kyis kyang ci'i phyir bsgo bar mi byed ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar sems pas sems kyi rgyud la bsgo bar byed ces bya ba de bzhin du lus dang / ngag gi las kyis kyang ci'i phyir bsgo bar mi byed ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: But just as the mind orders the mental continuum, in the same way, why wouldn't bodily and vocal actions also order the mind?

original: 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: In this way, the Sautrantikas respond: It is so, etc.

original: mdo sde pa dag lan 'debs pa yin no //🔽de ni zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mdo sde pa dag lan 'debs pa yin no // de ni zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The Sautrantikas respond: It is so, etc.

original: lus dang / ngag gi las so //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag gi las so //
translated: It is so refers to bodily and vocal actions.

original: sems la ltos nas dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems la ltos nas dge ba la sogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: sems la ltos nas dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems la ltos nas dge ba la sogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Virtue and nonvirtue are due to the mind means that virtue, etc., are due to the mind that instigates them.

original: rang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽sems la ltos nas @83a * //
analyzed: rang gis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // sems la ltos nas @83a * //
translated: It is not due to their own nature means that they are not due to their own nature.

original: lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur du chug na /
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dge ba la sogs pa nyid du 'gyur du chug na /
translated: Due to the mind means that bodily and vocal actions are virtue, etc., due to the mind.

original: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Even if that is so, what is the problem?

original: de'i phyir / gang zhig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / gang zhig gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, they say, If one is virtuous, etc., because of that, etc., etc.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las so //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las so //
translated: “That” refers to the actions of body and speech.

original: gang gis dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid du byas pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis byas pa'o //🔽de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang gis dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid du byas pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis byas pa'o // de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “By which it is made virtuous or nonvirtuous” refers to the mind.

original: lus dang ngag gi las kyis so //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las kyis so //
translated: “By that alone” refers to the actions of body and speech.

original: de'i rgyud la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyud la'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyud la zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyud la'o //
translated: “In its continuum” refers to the continuum of the mind.

original: de'i rgyud ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyud dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyud ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyud dge ba dang mi dge ba ste /
translated: “It is not in its continuum” refers to the continuum of the mind, which is virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: 'dir yang de'i rgyud la 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba 'byin par nus pa zhes rnal ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de'i rgyud la 'bras bu yid du 'ong ba dang / mi 'ong ba 'byin par nus pa zhes rnal ma dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Here, the correct interpretation is that “in its continuum” means that it is able to produce a pleasant or unpleasant result.

original: don ni 'di skad du sems kyi khyad par gang zhig gi lus la sogs pa'i las dge ba la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan yang byas nas rang gi rgyud la bsgo bar nus pa des de la bsgo bar bya ba brgyud pa la ltos kyi /
analyzed: don ni 'di skad du sems kyi khyad par gang zhig gi lus la sogs pa'i las dge ba la sogs pa'i gzugs gzhan yang byas nas rang gi rgyud la bsgo bar nus pa des de la bsgo bar bya ba brgyud pa la ltos kyi /
translated: The meaning of this passage is as follows: When a particular mind causes the body and so on to perform virtuous or nonvirtuous actions, it is able to plant seeds in its own continuum.

original: rang nyid mngon sum du bsgo bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rang nyid mngon sum du bsgo bar byed pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni /
translated: It is not that one is directly ordered.

original: rnar mi 'ong zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnar mi 'ong zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is taught by “it is not heard.”

original: de ltar mdo sde pa dag gis rang gi phyogs rgya cher bsgrubs pa dang / da ni slob dpon gyis phyogs de yang mi rung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mdo sde pa dag gis rang gi phyogs rgya cher bsgrubs pa dang / da ni slob dpon gyis phyogs de yang mi rung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the Sautrāntika have extensively established their position, and now the master teaches that even that position is not correct.

original: 'o na ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'o na ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “ Well then, if…” and so on is stated.

original: las nub kyang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa 'gags kyang ngo //
analyzed: las nub kyang zhes bya ba ni skyes pa 'gags kyang ngo //
translated: “ Even if the karma sets” means even if the karma that has arisen ceases.

original: des bsgos pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des bsgos pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ By it” means by the karma.

original: las kyi bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i'o //🔽tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byung na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: las kyi bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i'o // tshe phyi ma la 'bras bu 'byung na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ By the latent states of the karma” means by the latent states of the karma.🔽“ If the effect arises in the next life” means if the effect arises in the future.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'bras bu 'byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'bras bu 'byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This is the meaning of “if the effect arises in the future.”

original: de yan chad kyis ni pha rol gyis smras pa bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: de yan chad kyis ni pha rol gyis smras pa bzlas pa yin no //
translated: Up to this point, the opponent’s position is repeated.

original: sems med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun 'byin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sun 'byin pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: “ If there is no mind…” and so on is the refutation.

original: sems kyi rgyun chad pa dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun chad pa dag gi zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Those whose mind-streams have been severed” means

original: gang dag la sems kyi rgyun chad pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang dag la sems kyi rgyun chad pa yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: those who have severed their mind-streams.

original: las snga ma'i zhes bya ba ni sngar skyed pa'i'o //
analyzed: las snga ma'i zhes bya ba ni sngar skyed pa'i'o //
translated: “Of previous karma” means of karma that was previously generated.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Some say, etc.

original: mdo sde pa'i nang nas kha cig lan 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde pa'i nang nas kha cig lan 'debs pa yin no //
translated: Some Sautrāntikas respond.

original: tshe de nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: tshe de nyid la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “In that very life” means

original: tshe gang la de las skyed pa de nyid la yin gyi /
analyzed: tshe gang la de las skyed pa de nyid la yin gyi /
translated: in the very life in which it was generated,

original: tshe gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshe gnyis pa la sogs pa la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not in the second life, etc.

original: des bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyud mtshams @83b 'byor pa las so zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: des bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyud mtshams @83b 'byor pa las so zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “From the connection of the mind-stream that is imbued with it” means

original: las kyis bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyud phyir mtshams 'byor pa las so //
analyzed: las kyis bsgos pa'i sems kyi rgyud phyir mtshams 'byor pa las so //
translated: from the connection of the mind-stream that is imbued with karma.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
translated: “That also” and so on is stated by the master.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyud do //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyud do //
translated: “That” refers to the mind-stream.

original: ci'i phyir mtshams 'byor zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mtshams 'byor zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Why is it connected?”

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir mtshams ni 'byor pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir mtshams ni 'byor pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it lacks a cause, it is only a connection.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba ni mdo sde pa kha cig go //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smra ba ni mdo sde pa kha cig go //
translated: Some Sautrāntikas say: The mind of meditative attainment is the mind of entry.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni 'dir 'jug pa'i sems yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems ni 'dir 'jug pa'i sems yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The mind of meditative attainment should be regarded as the mind of entry.

original: gang gis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa des mngon sum du byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang gis 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa des mngon sum du byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the mind by which one manifests the meditative attainment of cessation and so on.

original: ring mo zhig lon pa smos pa ni shin tu mi srid pa bstan pa'i phyir te /🔽re zhig 'gags ma thag pa yang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ring mo zhig lon pa smos pa ni shin tu mi srid pa bstan pa'i phyir te / re zhig 'gags ma thag pa yang med pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “after a long period of time” is stated to indicate that it is extremely impossible.

original: rkyen du mi 'gyur na 'gags nas ring mo zhig lon pa lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rkyen du mi 'gyur na 'gags nas ring mo zhig lon pa lta ga la 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it does not become a condition because it has just ceased, then how could it be a condition after a long period of time?

original: de ni 'das pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de ni 'das pa las 'bras bu mi 'byung ngo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: The phrase “its result does not arise from the past” and so on indicates that the mind of meditative attainment is the mind of entry.

original: slob dpon nyid kyis bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bshad pa dran par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon nyid kyis bye brag tu smra ba'i phyogs bshad pa dran par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The Master himself recalls the explanation of the Vaibhāṣika position.

original: gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa pa yin no //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “from which” and so on is a summary.

original: kha cig na re de'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kha cig na re de'i sa bon zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Some say that the seed of that exists in the physical sense faculty.

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i khyad par gzhan kha cig go //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni mdo sde pa'i khyad par gzhan kha cig go //
translated: Some say is a reference to other Sautrāntikas.

original: de'i sa bon dbang po gzugs can la gnas pa las zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sa bon las te /
analyzed: de'i sa bon dbang po gzugs can la gnas pa las zhes bya ba ni sems kyi sa bon las te /
translated: The phrase the seed of that exists in the physical sense faculty means the seed of the mind exists in the physical sense faculty.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: sems kyi rgyud mtshams sbyor bar byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud mtshams sbyor bar byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “it connects the continuum of the mind” is supplied.

original: gnyis la gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ;
analyzed: gnyis la gnas pa yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ;
translated: The phrase “it exists in two” and so on

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no //🔽ci rigs su sbyar ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na ni /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i gzhung 'dzugs pa yin no // ci rigs su sbyar ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams sems dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na ni /
translated: establishes the scriptural passage as it has been explained.🔽The phrase “as appropriate” means that in the context of the desire realm and the form realm,

original: sems kyi rgyud dang / gzugs kyi rgyud la'o //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyud dang / gzugs kyi rgyud la'o //
translated: the continuum of the mind and the continuum of form exist in the physical sense faculty.

original: sems med pa'i gnas skabs na ni gzugs kyi rgyud la'o //
analyzed: sems med pa'i gnas skabs na ni gzugs kyi rgyud la'o //
translated: In the state of no-mind, it is in the stream of form.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sems kyi rgyud kho na la ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na ni sems kyi rgyud kho na la ste /
translated: In the formless realm, it is in the stream of mind alone.

original: ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don ni de yin no //
analyzed: ci rigs su sbyar ro zhes bya ba'i don ni de yin no //
translated: This is the meaning of “as appropriate.”

original: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni slob dpon gyis rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ma tshang pas lung dang 'gal ba nyid gleng bar mdzad do //🔽kha cig tu zhes @84a * //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni slob dpon gyis rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ma tshang pas lung dang 'gal ba nyid gleng bar mdzad do // kha cig tu zhes @84a * //
translated: Here, the master raises the issue of contradiction with scripture due to the incompleteness of the cause of consciousness.

original: bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo sde pa'i khyad par dag lan na 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: bya ba la sogs pa ni mdo sde pa'i khyad par dag lan na 'debs pa yin no //
translated: “ In some cases” and so on is the Sautrāntika reply.

original: kha cig tu zhes bya ba ni thams cad du ma yin gyi /
analyzed: kha cig tu zhes bya ba ni thams cad du ma yin gyi /
translated: “ In some cases” does not mean in all cases,

original: 'on kyang gang la yid mngon du gyur par 'jug pa med pa de la 'dir nye bar 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'on kyang gang la yid mngon du gyur par 'jug pa med pa de la 'dir nye bar 'dogs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but rather that it is figuratively applied to that in which the mind does not engage manifestly.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe ni go bar sla'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe ni go bar sla'o //
translated: The example beginning with “for example” is easy to understand.

original: ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
translated: “ How is that?” and so on is the master.

original: sa bon gyi rgyud gnyis su zhes bya ba ni gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i sa bon gyi rgyud gnyis su'o //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyud gnyis su zhes bya ba ni gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'i sa bon gyi rgyud gnyis su'o //
translated: The two continuums of seeds means the two continuums of seeds with form and without form.

original: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'gyur snyam pa la /
translated: Why would it not be so?

original: de'i phyir / myug la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / myug la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “the sprout, etc.”

original: chos 'di ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi rgyud tha dad pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos 'di ma mthong ngo zhes bya ba ni sa bon gyi rgyud tha dad pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This phenomenon is not seen means the nature of the different continuums of seeds.

original: brgya la gzhan dag 'di skad du /
analyzed: brgya la gzhan dag 'di skad du /
translated: If someone else were to say this,

original: sa la sogs pa rgyu du mas kyang myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa rgyu du mas kyang myu gu la sogs pa skyed par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: “Are not the sprout, etc. produced by many causes such as the earth, etc.?

original: de ji ltar na rgyu tha dad pa ma mthong ngo zhes bya /🔽zhes smra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ji ltar na rgyu tha dad pa ma mthong ngo zhes bya / zhes smra bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir /
translated: How is it that the different causes are not seen?”

original: rkyen ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rkyen ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The conditions,” etc.

original: rkyen ni zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no //🔽sa bon ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkyen ni zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin no // sa bon ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The conditions means the cooperative conditions.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu ma yin no //

analyzed: 'di thams cad kyis ni 'di skad du nang dang / phyi rol gyi mi dang / 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad pa ni nye bar len pa'i rgyu tha dad pas byas pa yin no //

analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang yin par 'dod ces bya ba ni /🔽ci mig gi rnam par shes pa yin nam /

analyzed: 'di ltar zag pa zad pa dag la tshor ba rnam pa gsum char 'byung yang sred pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is because, although the three kinds of feeling occur for those who have exhausted the defilements, craving does not arise.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Similarly, etc. indicates

original: dpe nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: dpe nye bar bstan nas /

analyzed: don gyi dngos po dang sbyor bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is applied to the actual meaning.

original: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni /
analyzed: de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni /
translated: This is what the Lord said, etc.

original: slob dpon gyis nges par gzhung 'dzugs pa nyid du mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis nges par gzhung 'dzugs pa nyid du mdzad pa'o //

analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni tshor ba'o //

analyzed: ji ltar de khyad par du mdzad ce na /

analyzed: de'i phyir ma rig pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ma rig pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i reg pa ni /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “contact associated with ignorance,” etc.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa'o //
translated: Contact associated with ignorance is contact associated with ignorance.

original: de las skyes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de las skyes pa ni ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i zhes bya'o //
translated: That which arises from that is called “arisen from contact associated with ignorance.”

original: ci ste gzhan ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa 'byung ba'i tshor ba khyad par du mdzad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i reg pa yang kha cig tu khyad par du mdzad do snyam du sems su dogs nas /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis sred pa 'byung ba'i tshor ba khyad par du mdzad pa de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa 'byung ba'i reg pa yang kha cig tu khyad par du mdzad do snyam du sems su dogs nas /
translated: But if one thinks that just as the Lord distinguished feeling that is the origin of craving, in the same way, he also distinguished contact that is the origin of feeling, etc., in some places,

original: reg pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: reg pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “Contact is threefold,” etc.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning “Therefore, . . . ” is the conclusion.

original: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag gzhan du lan 'debs pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag gzhan du lan 'debs pa yin te /
translated: Others say that the three—contact, etc.—are not different from the coming together of the sense faculty, object, and consciousness.

original: 'di skad du gal te reg pa gang du yang khyad par ma mdzad du zin kyang /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te reg pa gang du yang khyad par ma mdzad du zin kyang /
translated: They say that even though contact is not distinguished in any way,

original: 'on kyang tshor ba la sogs pa skyed pa gsum yang dag 'dus pa khyad par du 'phags pa kho na yin par brjod par 'dod de ;
analyzed: 'on kyang tshor ba la sogs pa skyed pa gsum yang dag 'dus pa khyad par du 'phags pa kho na yin par brjod par 'dod de ;
translated: it is the coming together of the three that is distinguished as the producer of feeling, etc.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is distinguished?

original: gang gi mjug thogs su reg pa 'byung ba'i 'dus pa nus pa can gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi mjug thogs su reg pa 'byung ba'i 'dus pa nus pa can gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is the coming together that is capable of producing contact immediately after it occurs.

original: de yang tshor ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa'i tshe med na ji ltar reg pa yin /🔽de med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang tshor ba la sogs pa sun 'byin pa'i tshe med na ji ltar reg pa yin / de med pa'i phyir /
translated: If that does not exist when feeling, etc., are refuted, how can there be contact?

original: tshor ba la sogs pa la ga la yod de /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa la ga la yod de /
translated: Because it does not exist, how can there be feeling, etc.?

original: de'i phyir / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir / yid kyi rnam par shes pa 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, only mental consciousness remains.

original: 'o na de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni slob dpon gyis sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, the master says if it is this... in order to refute that.

original: dge ba la sogs pa'i phyogs yongs su 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: dge ba la sogs pa'i phyogs yongs su 'dzin du 'jug par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: He causes one to take up the side of virtue, etc.

original: de las cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni @85b gzhan gyi skyon ma mthong nas smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de las cir 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni @85b gzhan gyi skyon ma mthong nas smras pa yin no //
translated: What would be the result of that? is said after not seeing the fault of the other.

original: gal te dge ba yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: gal te dge ba yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
translated: If it is virtue... and so forth is said by the master.

original: ci ste gzhan su zhig ma chags pa la sogs pa med pa yin no zhes de skad du smra snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan su zhig ma chags pa la sogs pa med pa yin no zhes de skad du smra snyam du sems na /
translated: If one thinks, But if someone else says, 'non-attachment, etc. do not exist,'

original: de'i phyir / ma chags pa la sogs pa yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ma chags pa la sogs pa yod na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: therefore, he says, Even if non-attachment, etc. exist...

original: gal te ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir dge ba ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te ma chags pa la sogs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa med pa'i phyir dge ba ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is not virtuous because it is not concomitant with non-attachment, etc.,

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa de /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa de /
translated: then what is that consciousness?

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dge ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen dge ba 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la 'jug pa'i sems kyis bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is generated by the mind entering the virtuous meditative attainment of cessation.

original: dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems par dogs na ma yin te /🔽dge ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dge ba nyid du 'gyur ro snyam du sems par dogs na ma yin te / dge ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you think that it would be virtuous, that is not so.

original: dge ba'i mjug thogs su sems rnam pa gsum 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di skad du /
analyzed: dge ba'i mjug thogs su sems rnam pa gsum 'byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ni 'di skad du /
translated: The meaning of the phrase “because three minds arise from virtue” is as follows.

original: dge ba'i mjug thos su ni dge ba la sogs pa'i sems rnam pa gsum 'byung bar gzhan na dmigs pa yin no /
analyzed: dge ba'i mjug thos su ni dge ba la sogs pa'i sems rnam pa gsum 'byung bar gzhan na dmigs pa yin no /
translated: Three minds such as virtue arise from virtue.

original: gal te de ma thag pa'i rkyen dge ba'i dbang gis dge ba nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de ma thag pa'i rkyen dge ba'i dbang gis dge ba nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: If virtue were virtuous due to the power of its immediately preceding condition,🔽then it would follow that nonvirtue and neutral states would also be virtuous.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kyang der thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa gnyis kyang der thal bar 'gyur ba zhig na de yang 'dod pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is unacceptable,

original: de bas na phan pa'i dbang gis dge ba nyid ma yin par 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phan pa'i dbang gis dge ba nyid ma yin par 'dod par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: therefore it is taught that virtue is not asserted to be virtuous due to the power of benefit.

original: gzhan yang skyon 'di yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang skyon 'di yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that this is also a fault, he says:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi stobs ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kyi stobs ni /
translated: The power of the roots of virtue

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs te nus pa nyid do //🔽des gang la dge ba nyid de /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs te nus pa nyid do // des gang la dge ba nyid de /
translated: The power of the roots of virtue is the power of the roots of virtue, i.e., their ability.

original: dge ba'i ngo bo yod pa 'phangs shing bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i ngo bo yod pa 'phangs shing bskyed pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which is projected and generated by the power of the roots of virtue, i.e., by the power of the roots of virtue, is called the nature of virtue.

original: de yang ci zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang ci zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: sems so // de lta yin na cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems so // de lta yin na cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The mind. If that is so, what follows from that?

original: de'i phyir / de ltog pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽de ldog pa ni dge ba nyid log pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ltog pa'i rgyu mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs so // de ldog pa ni dge ba nyid log pa ste /
translated: Therefore he says, “because the cause of its cessation is not tenable.”

original: med par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The cessation of that is the cessation of virtue, i.e., its non-existence.

original: de ldog pa'i rgyu ni de ldog pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de ldog pa'i rgyu ni de ldog pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The cause of its cessation is the cause of its cessation.

original: de mi rung ba ni mi 'thad pa nyid do //
analyzed: de mi rung ba ni mi 'thad pa nyid do //
translated: That is not tenable, i.e., it is not reasonable.

original: 'di skad du gal te de ma thag pa'i rkyen dge ba'i dbang gis phyi ma'i dus na 'byung ba'i sems dge ba nyid du 'gyur na /🔽de lta na 'o na ni lan cig @86a * //
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te de ma thag pa'i rkyen dge ba'i dbang gis phyi ma'i dus na 'byung ba'i sems dge ba nyid du 'gyur na / de lta na 'o na ni lan cig @86a * //
translated: This is what is being said: If the subsequent mind that arises at a later time is virtuous due to the power of the immediately preceding condition being virtuous,

original: dge ba skyes na 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du phyi ma'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba thams cad dge ba nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dge ba skyes na 'khor ba ji srid yod kyi bar du phyi ma'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba thams cad dge ba nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then, in that case, once a virtuous mind has arisen, all that arises at a later time would be virtuous for as long as samsara exists.

original: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa gnyis med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa gnyis med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: And nonvirtuous and neutral minds would not exist.

original: de ni mi dge ba la yang thal bar 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de ni mi dge ba la yang thal bar 'gyur ro /
translated: This also applies to nonvirtue.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtsis mgo bsgre ba ste /🔽ji ltar dge ba nyid mi 'thad pa de bzhin du mi dge ba yang bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pas mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtsis mgo bsgre ba ste / ji ltar dge ba nyid mi 'thad pa de bzhin du mi dge ba yang bshad ma thag pa'i rigs pas mi 'thad do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This line of reasoning is the same as the previous one.🔽Just as it is untenable that a virtuous mind arises from a virtuous mind, so it is untenable that a nonvirtuous mind arises from a nonvirtuous mind.

original: ci ste gzhan gal te 'gog pa'i sems dge ba dang / mi dge bar mi 'thad na snyoms par 'jug pa de ji ltar na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gal te 'gog pa'i sems dge ba dang / mi dge bar mi 'thad na snyoms par 'jug pa de ji ltar na /
translated: If it is untenable that the mind of meditative attainment is virtuous or nonvirtuous, then how is it?

original: dge ba zhes bya snyam du sems na /🔽de'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya snyam du sems na / de'i phyir 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni //
translated: If you think that it is virtuous,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then it is said:🔽“It is like cessation.”

original: 'gog pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'gog pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Like cessation” means

original: ji ltar thar pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba zhes bya'i /🔽dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar thar pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dge ba zhes bya'i / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: that just as liberation is called “virtuous” because it has the characteristic of the complete pacification of all suffering,🔽but is not really so because it is the nature of a non-entity,

original: yang dag par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: yang dag par ni ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: in the same way,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dus re zhig zhi bas de tsam gyis na de dge ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang dus re zhig zhi bas de tsam gyis na de dge ba yin gyi /
translated: the meditative attainment of cessation is virtuous to that extent, because it is the pacification of the mental afflictions for a period of time,🔽but is not really so.

original: yang dag par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: ci ste de dge ba dang / mi dge ba ma yin par 'gyur na /🔽'o na bsgribs la lung du ma bstan par 'gyur mod snyam du sems su dogs nas /
analyzed: ci ste de dge ba dang / mi dge ba ma yin par 'gyur na / 'o na bsgribs la lung du ma bstan par 'gyur mod snyam du sems su dogs nas /
translated: If you think that it is neither virtuous nor non-virtuous,🔽then it is said:🔽“If it were afflicted . . . ”

original: gal te nyon mongs pa can zhig yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa can zhig yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: zhu ba bcu'i mdo zhes bya ba ni /🔽mdo gang las zhu ba bcu 'byung ba de ni //
analyzed: zhu ba bcu'i mdo zhes bya ba ni / mdo gang las zhu ba bcu 'byung ba de ni //
translated: The sutra called the Sutra of the Ten Questions🔽is so called because it contains ten questions.

original: zhu ba bcu'i mdo ste des mtshon pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gzhan yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: zhu ba bcu'i mdo ste des mtshon pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzhan yang 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: It is the sutra of the ten questions.🔽Moreover, it is also a fault that the attainment of nonperception

original: skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skyon gzhan 'di yang yod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: is like the attainment of cessation.

original: ci ste gzhan gal te nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan gal te nyon mongs pa can ma yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is not afflicted,🔽then it is certainly unobscured-neutral.

original: 'o na ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan par 'gyur mod snyam du sems su dogs na /
analyzed: 'o na ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan par 'gyur mod snyam du sems su dogs na /
translated: If you think this,

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then the following is stated:

original: de la yang rnam pa bzhi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang rnam pa bzhi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it is possible that it is of four types,

original: ci ste rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtog par mdzad do //
analyzed: ci ste rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhig yin nam zhes bya ba la sogs pas rtog par mdzad do //
translated: it is investigated as to whether it is arisen from karmic maturation, etc.🔽What is the problem if it is?

original: de las ci 'gyur zhes bya ba @86b ni gzhan gyi skyon ma mthong ba'i phyir de skad smras so //
analyzed: de las ci 'gyur zhes bya ba @86b ni gzhan gyi skyon ma mthong ba'i phyir de skad smras so //
translated: This is said because the opponent does not see a problem.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhig yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis phyogs re re nas rgya cher sun dbyung ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa las skyes pa zhig yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis phyogs re re nas rgya cher sun dbyung ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The master has stated in detail the refutation of each position, beginning with the phrase, “If it arises from karmic maturation.”

original: ji ltar na zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon du 'gyur zhes bya ba bar du chod pa 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes bya ba 'di ni mngon du 'gyur zhes bya ba bar du chod pa 'di dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase “How could it be?” is to be supplied with the omitted phrase “manifest.”

original: rnal 'byor pa ni phra ba dang / phra ba'i mjug thogs su de la snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni phra ba dang / phra ba'i mjug thogs su de la snyoms par 'jug pa yin no //
translated: The yogi enters meditative attainment in that, following the subtle stage.

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mjug thogs su 'gog pa'i sems mngon sum du bya dgos na /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i mjug thogs su 'gog pa'i sems mngon sum du bya dgos na /
translated: Therefore, immediately after meditative attainment of the summit of existence, the mind of cessation must be manifested.

original: gal te rnam par smin pa las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par smin pa las skye ba yin na /
translated: If it arises from karmic maturation,

original: de 'dod pa spyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'dod pa spyod par 'gyur te /
translated: it would be a desire realm mind.

original: rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa 'dod pa na spyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the yogi is a desire realm being.

original: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems kyi mjug thogs su bsam gtan dang po la sogs pas 'og ma brgyad kyis bar du tshad pa'i sems de rnal 'byor pas ji ltar mngon sum du byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir srid pa'i rtse mo'i sems kyi mjug thogs su bsam gtan dang po la sogs pas 'og ma brgyad kyis bar du tshad pa'i sems de rnal 'byor pas ji ltar mngon sum du byed de /
translated: Therefore, how could a yogin directly manifest the mind of the summit of existence, which is separated from the eight lower levels such as the first absorption by the intervening distance of the eight levels?

original: shin tu thag ring ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu thag ring ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is too far away.

original: 'di ltar thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug par byed pa dag kyang re zhig snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su bzhi pa yang mngon sum du bya bar mi nus na /
analyzed: 'di ltar thod rgal du snyoms par 'jug par byed pa dag kyang re zhig snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su bzhi pa yang mngon sum du bya bar mi nus na /
translated: Thus, those who enter meditative attainment by skipping levels cannot manifest the fourth absorption immediately after the mind of meditative attainment, because it is too far away.

original: des sa 'og ma brgyad kyis bar du chod pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems zhig mngon sum du byed dam /
analyzed: des sa 'og ma brgyad kyis bar du chod pa 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems zhig mngon sum du byed dam /
translated: How could they manifest the mind of the desire realm, which is separated from the fourth absorption by the intervening distance of eight lower levels?

original: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: This other error also exists, because it is said,

original: 'dir yang shin tu thag ring ba nyid kyi phyir langs pa la mngon du 'gyur mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir yang shin tu thag ring ba nyid kyi phyir langs pa la mngon du 'gyur mi srid do //
translated: “The mind of the summit of existence is too far away to manifest upon rising from meditative attainment.”

original: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: The phrase “the mind of the summit of existence and so on” refers to the mind of the summit of existence and the mind of the base of nothingness.

original: ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: ci yang med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa bsdu'o //
translated: The sphere of nothingness and the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception are included in the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: ci ste pha rol po gang gis na skyon der 'gyur bar 'gog pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ba de ji ltar mi mngon zhe na zhes smra bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas lung gis bsgrub pa'i phyir
analyzed: ci ste pha rol po gang gis na skyon der 'gyur bar 'gog pa'i sems kyi mjug thogs su mi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i sems mngon du 'gyur ba de ji ltar mi mngon zhe na zhes smra bar 'gyur ro snyam du bsams nas lung gis bsgrub pa'i phyir
translated: If one says, “How is it that the mind of non-fluctuation, etc. does not manifest immediately after the mind of cessation, since it is by that other mind that the fault would occur? ” thinking that, in order to establish it by scripture,

original: / ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: / ji skad du zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “As it is said,” and so on.

original: reg pa du zhig la reg ces bya ba ni mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: reg pa du zhig la reg ces bya ba ni mngon du byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “How many contacts does one contact?” means “how many does one manifest?”

original: de la mi g-yo ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o //🔽ci yang med pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi g-yo ba ni bsam gtan bzhi pa'i sa pa'o // ci yang med pa ni ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi sa pa'o //
translated: Among them, non-fluctuation is on the level of the fourth concentration.🔽The sphere of nothingness is on the level of the sphere of nothingness.

original: mtshan ma med pa ni 'du shes phra @87a * //🔽bas mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni 'du shes phra @87a * // bas mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is on the level of the summit of existence.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is the summit of existence because it is free from all signs due to subtle perception.

original: gzhan yang sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang brjod pa'i rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang brjod pa'i rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is proper to state another reason:

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi las kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba ni tshe rabs gzhan gyi las kyis 'phangs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “projected by former karma” means “projected by the karma of another life.”

original: dus tshigs zhes bya ba ni dus mtshams so //🔽sngar bsams pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dus tshigs zhes bya ba ni dus mtshams so // sngar bsams pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “ Season” means “time.”🔽“ Previously intended” means

original: sngar brnag brnag pa'o //
analyzed: sngar brnag brnag pa'o //
translated: “previously determined.”

original: 'di la yang rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di la yang rigs pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni med pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the logic here? There is none at all.

original: 'di skad du rnam par smin pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad du rnam par smin pa ni rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba yin na /
translated: If karmic maturation arises by its own power,

analyzed: ji ltar na de rang gi chos las 'das nas /
translated: how could it transcend its own nature?

original: gang gis na des ldang ba'i dus kyi dus tshigs bsams pa las 'da' bar mi byed par rnal 'byor pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis na des ldang ba'i dus kyi dus tshigs bsams pa las 'da' bar mi byed par rnal 'byor pa'i sems kyi rjes su 'brang zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaches that the yogi’s mind follows the season that is the time for it to arise, and does not transcend the previously intended time.

original: mi 'thad pa gzhan 'di yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi 'thad pa gzhan 'di yang yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This other untenability is stated:

original: re zhig ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: re zhig ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: First, how could it be that the mind of meditative attainment🔽is prior to the mind of entry?

original: 'dir yang rnam par smin pa'i sems 'grub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa thob kyis ches snga ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba bar du chod pa 'di dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'dir yang rnam par smin pa'i sems 'grub par bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa thob kyis ches snga ba ni ma yin zhes bya ba bar du chod pa 'di dang sbyar ro //
translated: Here also, in order to establish the mind of karmic maturation, the phrase “it is not prior” is supplied as an ellipsis.

original: 'gog pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: 'gog pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: The phrase “having the cessation of feelings and discriminations as its object” means

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par tshor ba la sogs pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par tshor ba la sogs pa 'gog pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: having the cessation of feelings and so on that are classified as peaceful and so on as its object.

original: srid pa'i rtse mo'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mthar phyin pa na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: srid pa'i rtse mo'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i sems kyi mthar phyin pa na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “At the end of the mind of meditative attainment of the summit of existence” means

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthar phyin pa'i tshe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i mthar phyin pa'i tshe na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: at the time of the end of meditative attainment.

original: chos snga bar ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos snga bar ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “It is not prior” means

analyzed: ches dang po sa gzhan pa'i sems mngon sum du gyur pa na yang ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is not the case that the mind of a different level is manifest first.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa gcod par byed pa nyid kyis shin tu dgra bor gyur pa'i gnas skabs na /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa gcod par byed pa nyid kyis shin tu dgra bor gyur pa'i gnas skabs na /
translated: At the time when they are extremely hostile, because they cut off feelings, etc.,

original: bag chags 'jug pa 'thob kyi ches snga ba rjes su mthun pa'i gnas skabs su ni /
analyzed: bag chags 'jug pa 'thob kyi ches snga ba rjes su mthun pa'i gnas skabs su ni /
translated: they obtain the entry of the latent propensities, but not at the time when they are favorable.

original: lan 'ga' yang ma yin zhes bya ba de ji ltar rung zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lan 'ga' yang ma yin zhes bya ba de ji ltar rung zhes bya ba bstan pa yin no //
translated: How could that be right?

original: skyon gzhan 'di dang yang ldan no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon gzhan 'di dang yang ldan no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that there is another fault, he says:🔽Why, etc.

original: re zhig ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la ni 'di la rigs pa ci zhig @87b yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: re zhig ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la ni 'di la rigs pa ci zhig @87b yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why is this reasonable?

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs kyi khams su'o //
translated: Here means in the desire realm and the form realm.

original: yang mtshams mi 'byor la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang mtshams mi 'byor la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: And they are not connected means

original: sngon gyi las kyis 'phen pa'i dbang gis rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi las kyis 'phen pa'i dbang gis rang gi ngang gis 'byung ba'i rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that the stream of their own natural arising is cut off by the power of the projection of previous karma.

original: rnam par smin pa'i sems ni mtshams 'byor zhes bya ba ni nges par sems gzhan mngon du gyur pa'i tshe na chad pa yang mtshams 'byor te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i sems ni mtshams 'byor zhes bya ba ni nges par sems gzhan mngon du gyur pa'i tshe na chad pa yang mtshams 'byor te /
translated: When another mind definitely manifests, the maturational mind is severed and united.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “by the meditative attainment of cessation.”

original: ci ste gzhan de lta rnam par smin pa ma yin yang rung /🔽'on kyang spyod lam pa la sogs pas 'gyur mod snyam du sems su dogs nas /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan de lta rnam par smin pa ma yin yang rung / 'on kyang spyod lam pa la sogs pas 'gyur mod snyam du sems su dogs nas /
translated: If you think that it is not the maturational mind,🔽but rather the mind of regular behavior and so on,

original: 'on te spyod lam pa la sogs pa zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽spyod lam pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: 'on te spyod lam pa la sogs pa zhig yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // spyod lam pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba la stsogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: then the root text states, “If it is the mind of regular behavior and so on,” and so on.

original: bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa'i sems bsdu'o //
analyzed: bzo'i gnas dang / sprul pa'i sems bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase “the mind of regular behavior and so on” includes the minds of creativity and emanation.

original: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par tshor ba la sogs pa 'gog pa la dmigs pas rnam pa gzhan du zhugs pa'i phyir spyod lam pa la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhi ba la sogs pa'i rnam par tshor ba la sogs pa 'gog pa la dmigs pas rnam pa gzhan du zhugs pa'i phyir spyod lam pa la sogs pa mngon par 'du byed pa lta ga la yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it focuses on the cessation of feeling and so on in the aspects of peace and so on, how could it engage in the manifest compositional activity of the sphere of discipline and so on?

original: gzhan yang reg pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang reg pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
