translated: The verse beginning That which is the basis and so on is stated.

original: rnam par shes pa gang zhig go //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang zhig go //
translated: What is consciousness?

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rags pa'o // ji ltar rags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rags pa'o // ji ltar rags pa yin zhe na /
translated: It is gross. How is it gross?

original: de'i phyir / rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, it is stated, The basis and so on.

original: de la rten ni mig la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rten ni mig la sogs pa'o //
translated: The basis is the eye and so on.

original: dmigs pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan zin to //🔽gang zhig la zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa la sogs pa ni sngar bstan zin to // gang zhig la zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa la'o //
translated: The object and so on have been previously explained.

original: @94a * // ci zhe na /
analyzed: @94a * // ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is the establishment of defilement and purification.

original: de ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How is that established?

original: de'i phyir / nyon mong pa dang / de'i gnyen po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / nyon mong pa dang / de'i gnyen po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is stated, Because it is concomitant with defilement and its antidote.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dag nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir dag nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is concomitant with afflictions such as attachment, it is the antidote to the afflictions. This is the meaning.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni bya ba'o //
translated: The word result means action.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By what? means by eye consciousness, etc.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What? means

original: rjes su dpog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpog par byed pa'o //
translated: what is to be inferred.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba de ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is that which is to be inferred?🔽 Therefore, it is said,

original: de'i phyir / de'i sa bon gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: de'i phyir / de'i sa bon gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: The seed of that is the consciousness that is its seed.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag gi sa bon ni de'i sa bon no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa de dag gi sa bon ni de'i sa bon no //
translated: The seed of those eye consciousnesses, etc. is the seed of that.

original: de ni de'i sa bon yang yin la /🔽rnam par shes pa yang yin pas de'i sa bon gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i sa bon yang yin la / rnam par shes pa yang yin pas de'i sa bon gyi rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: That is the seed of that,🔽and it is consciousness. Therefore, it is the consciousness that is its seed.

original: de rjes su dpog pa ni de sa bon gyi rnam par shes pa rjes su dpog pa'o //
analyzed: de rjes su dpog pa ni de sa bon gyi rnam par shes pa rjes su dpog pa'o //
translated: The inference of that is the inference of the consciousness that is its seed.

original: de kho na 'dir rnam par shes par bstan gyi zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni rags pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa thams cad la rag pas las pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir rnam par shes par bstan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa re🔽re la sbyor ro //
analyzed: de kho na 'dir rnam par shes par bstan gyi zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ni rags pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa thams cad la rag pas las pa gang yin pa de nyid 'dir rnam par shes par bstan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa re re la sbyor ro //
translated: in the sense that “that alone is taught as consciousness here.”

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bstan pa'i mdor ro //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug bstan pa'i mdor ro //
translated: “Here” refers to the Sūtra on the Six Collections of Consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes par rig par bya'o //
translated: “Consciousness” should be understood as the active forms of consciousness.🔽It is not the causal form of consciousness.

original: rgyu'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu'i rnam par shes pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bstan pa ni zhes bya bar sbyar te /🔽kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bstan pa ni zhes bya bar sbyar te / kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “that which is taught” is supplied.

original: rgyu'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The causal form of consciousness is the storehouse consciousness, because it is the cause of the active forms of consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de'i phyir / de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de las bzlog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: To answer that, it is said that “it is the opposite of that.”

original: rags pa la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rags pa la sogs pa las bzlog pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the opposite of coarse and so on.

original: 'di ltar rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rnam pa dang / bye brag yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten dang / dmigs pa dang / rnam pa dang / rnam pa dang / bye brag yongs su ma chad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is not coarse because its basis, object, aspect, and distinction are not fully determined.

original: rags pa yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rags pa yang ma yin zhing /
translated: It is not subtle because it is not the object of the three wisdoms.

original: de la ni nyon mongs pa dang / de'i gnyen po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa yang med la 'bras bur gyur pa des /
analyzed: de la ni nyon mongs pa dang / de'i gnyen po dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pa yang med la 'bras bur gyur pa des /
translated: It is not defiled because it is not associated with defilement and its antidote, and it is not pure because it is not associated with the antidote to that.🔽It is not an effect because it is not the effect of karma and the mental afflictions, and it is not a seed because it does not project a future existence.

original: sa bon du gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gal zhig rjes su dpog par yang mi byed do /
analyzed: sa bon du gyur pa'i rnam par shes pa 'gal zhig rjes su dpog par yang mi byed do /
translated: It is not a seed because it does not project a future existence.

original: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rtsis mgos bsgre ba ste /
analyzed: 'dis ni zhes bya ba ni rtsis mgos bsgre ba ste /
translated: The phrase “by this” refers to the verse.

original: ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bstan par lan gdab pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bstan par lan gdab pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the question about the aggregate of consciousness is answered,

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo @94b rnam par dbye ba bstan pa yang lan btab pa mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i mdo @94b rnam par dbye ba bstan pa yang lan btab pa mtshungs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so too the question about the teaching of dependent origination is answered.

original: ji ltar rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byor pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byor pa ste /
translated: “As is appropriate” means “as is available.”

original: rnam par shes pa gsal bar snang bar myong ba gang yin pa de nyid bstan gyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gsal bar snang bar myong ba gang yin pa de nyid bstan gyi /
translated: It is taught that consciousness is the experience of the appearance of clarity.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rjes su dpag pas khong du chud par bya ba ni ma yin no //🔽gzhan yang rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzhi ni nub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa rjes su dpag pas khong du chud par bya ba ni ma yin no // gzhan yang rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / rnam par bshad pa'i rigs pa las yang dag par bsdus pa'i gzhi ni nub pa'i phyir la /
translated: It is not to be understood through inference of the ālaya consciousness.🔽Moreover, it is said, “The basis that is summarized in the science of exposition has disappeared.

original: gsung rab kyang deng sang rnam pa du mar 'thor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
analyzed: gsung rab kyang deng sang rnam pa du mar 'thor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas /
translated: And the scriptures are scattered in many ways in the present day.”

original: deng sang mdo sde thams cad ni mi snang ngo zhes rgya cher bsgrubs so ;
analyzed: deng sang mdo sde thams cad ni mi snang ngo zhes rgya cher bsgrubs so ;
translated: Thus it is extensively proven that in the present day, all the sūtras do not appear.

original: ; de'i phyir mdo sde dag las zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ; de'i phyir mdo sde dag las zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Therefore, in the sūtras” means

original: ji ltar dmigs pa'i mdo sde dag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa'i mdo sde dag las zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in the sūtras that are available.

original: lhangs por zhes bya ba ni gzugs bor ro //
analyzed: lhangs por zhes bya ba ni gzugs bor ro //
translated: “In a scattered way” means “in a scattered form.”

original: 'o na de lta ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag phyir rgol bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'o na de lta ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag phyir rgol bar byed pa'o //
translated: Now, in response to this, the opponent objects with But if that is so, etc.,

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: The other is the eye consciousness, etc.

original: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas rtag tu gnas pa yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bas rtag tu gnas pa yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Since the ālaya consciousness is always present, it is constantly present.

original: gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzhan yang dmigs pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa gzhan yang dmigs pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the other, such as the eye consciousness, is observed,

original: de dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa lhan cig pa yin pas /
analyzed: de dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa lhan cig pa yin pas /
translated: at that time it is simultaneous with the ālaya consciousness.

original: cig car rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cig car rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gnyis su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus it is said that there are two streams of consciousness at the same time.

original: de lta yin na ci nyes zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de lta yin na ci nyes zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: slob dpon gyis skyon ma gzigs nas gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis skyon ma gzigs nas gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The master says this because he does not see a fault.

original: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gnyis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: With two streams of consciousness, etc.,

original: pha rol po skyon brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: pha rol po skyon brjod pa yin te /
translated: the opponent states the fault.

original: sems can du gdags pa tha dad pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud tha dad pas byas pa yin na /
analyzed: sems can du gdags pa tha dad pa ni rnam par shes pa'i rgyud tha dad pas byas pa yin na /
translated: The designation of sentient beings as distinct is due to the distinctness of the continuum of consciousness.

original: gal te lus gcig la yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyun rnam pa gnyis nyid du khas len na /
analyzed: gal te lus gcig la yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyun rnam pa gnyis nyid du khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that there are two distinct continua of consciousness in one body,

original: sems can gnyis su gdags par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gnyis su gdags par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then it follows that there are two sentient beings.

original: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe ni brda phrad par sla'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe ni brda phrad par sla'o //
translated: The example of the lamp is easy to understand.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni slob dpon gyis thal ba'i lan 'debs par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni slob dpon gyis thal ba'i lan 'debs par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The master responds to this consequence with the passage beginning “No, because . . . ”

original: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyis ni zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa gnyis so //
translated: “Those two” refers to the foundation consciousness and the active consciousnesses.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i ngang tshul can ni /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa'i ngang tshul can ni /
translated: “Because they are not distinct from the state of being cause and effect” means that they are not distinct from the state of being cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / @95a * //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / @95a * //
translated: and the fact of being the cause and effect,

original: tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa'o //
translated: and not being different.

original: de'i ngo bo ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang tha dad pa ma yin par 'jug pa nyid de /
translated: Its nature is that it is not different from the fact of being the cause and effect.

original: de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that.

original: gzhan yang rnam par smin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rnam par smin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, it is said, “the maturation of the seeds,” etc.

original: cig shos kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas so //
analyzed: cig shos kyis zhes bya ba ni 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pas so //
translated: The other means the active consciousness.

original: yongs su bsgo bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su spog par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos nyid de yang med de zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid dam /
analyzed: yongs su bsgo bar byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni yongs su spog par byed pa'i phyir ro // chos nyid de yang med de zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i chos nyid dam /
translated: Because it is the controller means because it is the one that directs.🔽And that reality does not exist means that the reality that was just explained, which is not different from the cause and effect, or the reality that is the controller, does not exist.

original: yongs su bsgo bar byed pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su bsgo bar byed pa'i chos nyid gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by the phrase “that reality does not exist.”

original: 'ga' zhig la sa bon dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan yang mi srid par ston to //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la sa bon dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan yang mi srid par ston to //
translated: In some, the seeds, etc. show that something else is not possible.

original: sa bon dang / sa bon can gyi zhes bya ba de la sa bon ni rgyu'o //🔽sa bon can ni 'bras bu'i khyad par te /
analyzed: sa bon dang / sa bon can gyi zhes bya ba de la sa bon ni rgyu'o // sa bon can ni 'bras bu'i khyad par te /
translated: The seed and the one having the seed. The seed is the cause.

original: 'di las sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di las sa bon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one having the seed is the effect, because the seed exists in it.

original: autpala'i rtsa ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis srid par ston par mdzad pa'o ;
analyzed: autpala'i rtsa ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis srid par ston par mdzad pa'o ;
translated: The root of the lotus, etc. The master shows the possibility.

original: ; srid par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: ; srid par bsgrubs nas /
translated: Having established the possibility,

original: da ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gdon mi za bar khas blangs par bsgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: da ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gdon mi za bar khas blangs par bsgrub par mdzad do //
translated: now, if, etc. He establishes that the foundation consciousness must be accepted without doubt.

original: gal te ma mthong yang rung zhes bya ba ni 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong yang rung zhes bya ba ni 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa la'o //
translated: Even if it is not seen. This refers to the rice, etc.

original: de ltar mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yod par ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi 'dod na zhes bya ba ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan yod par ro //
translated: If you do not accept it in this way, i.e., that the foundation consciousness exists.

original: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon rnams su zhes bya ba ni gzhan gang zhig gis lus zin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa'i skyon rnams su zhes bya ba ni gzhan gang zhig gis lus zin par 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The faults that have been explained, i.e., “By what other is the body grasped?

original: 'o na ci'i phyir bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: Now, why do you say “I”?

original: gzhan mi 'dod par gleng bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan mi 'dod par gleng bar byed pa ste /
translated: This is a discussion of the non-acceptance of another.

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las logs shig na de dag gi rten nyid du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan zhig yod par rtog na /🔽'o na de lta na nang na byed pa'i skyes bu bdag kyang /
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las logs shig na de dag gi rten nyid du kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa gzhan zhig yod par rtog na / 'o na de lta na nang na byed pa'i skyes bu bdag kyang /
translated: If you imagine that there is another consciousness, a store-consciousness, which is the basis of eye-consciousness, etc., apart from them,

original: ci'i phyir de dag gi rten du 'gyur bar mi brtag ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag gi rten du 'gyur bar mi brtag ste /
translated: then why do you not imagine that there is also a self, an inner agent, as their basis?

original: bdag dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las logs shig na yod par ni mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag dang kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa las logs shig na yod par ni mtshungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The self and the store-consciousness are the same in that they exist apart from eye-consciousness, etc.

original: ci 'dra bar 'dod par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
analyzed: ci 'dra bar 'dod par bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni /
translated: What is it like?

original: slob dpon gyis rnam par brtags pa tha dad par mdzad nas lan 'debs par mdzad do //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis rnam par brtags pa tha dad par mdzad nas lan 'debs par mdzad do //
translated: The Master responds by making a distinction in his analysis.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas so //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas so //
translated: “ It” is the substance of the self.

original: kun gzhi'i rnams par shes pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kun gzhi'i rnams par shes pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Like the store consciousness” means

original: 'di ltar kun gzhi'i @95b rnam par shes pa ni rgyun la gnas pa yin te skad cig gcig nas gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun gzhi'i @95b rnam par shes pa ni rgyun la gnas pa yin te skad cig gcig nas gcig tu zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the store consciousness is a continuum because it is a series of moments.

original: rkyen gyis 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gyis 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: It is also a condition because

original: de dag gis gzhan du skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis gzhan du skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it produces other moments.

original: de dang de khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas de 'dra ba zhig yin na /
analyzed: de dang de khyad par ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas de 'dra ba zhig yin na /
translated: What is the difference between that and this? If the substance self is like that,

original: de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las khyad par med do //
analyzed: de kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa las khyad par med do //
translated: it is not different from the store consciousness.

original: de bas na de ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na yin pas 'grub pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na de ni kun gzhi'i rnam par shes pa kho na yin pas 'grub pa nyid bsgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is just the store consciousness, it would be established as already established.

original: 'on te gcig pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas med pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te gcig pa zhes bya ba ni cha shas med pa'o //
translated: If it is said to be “one,” it is partless.🔽If it is said to be “permanent,” it is unchanging.

original: gtan du mi 'gyur ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rtag tu rkyen gyis 'gyur ba dang bral bar 'dod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtan du mi 'gyur ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba ni gal te rtag tu rkyen gyis 'gyur ba dang bral bar 'dod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it is asserted to be always free from conditions, it is not a cause.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni bdag gi rdzas la'o //
translated: “In it” means in the substance of the self.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bsdu'o //🔽'di skad du lan cig lha rnam par shes pa rnams de la rag ci zhig lus na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag gi rim dang / cig car gnyis kyi don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni 'dod chags la sogs pa bsdu'o // 'di skad du lan cig lha rnam par shes pa rnams de la rag ci zhig lus na zhes bya ba la sogs pas bdag gi rim dang / cig car gnyis kyi don byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir /
translated: The phrase “consciousness, etc.” includes attachment, etc.

original: dngos po med pa bzhin du med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par bya mod kyi /🔽'on kyang khas blangs nas gal te de 'gyur ba med pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa bzhin du med pa nyid yin no zhes bya bar bsgrub par bya mod kyi / 'on kyang khas blangs nas gal te de 'gyur ba med pa yin na /
translated: In this way, it should be demonstrated that the self is non-existent, like a non-entity, because it is devoid of the activity of both gradual and simultaneous functioning, as stated in the lines “If the consciousnesses of gods, etc. were to exist in it, what would remain of the self?”🔽However, accepting this, we say: if the self were unchanging, how could the imprints of consciousness, etc. be established in it?

original: ji ltar na de lta bu la rnam par shes pa la sogs pas bag chags bsgo ba 'grub par 'gyur zhes smra'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar na de lta bu la rnam par shes pa la sogs pas bag chags bsgo ba 'grub par 'gyur zhes smra'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: ci'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'grub par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Why could they not be established?

original: de'i phyir / bag chags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bag chags ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said “The imprints are not established in the unchanging self, etc.”

original: bag chags kyi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bag chags kyi rang bzhin ni 'di yin te /
translated: The nature of the latent impressions is as follows.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: bsgo bar byed pas bsgo bar bya ba'i rdzas la nus pa'i khyad par skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: bsgo bar byed pas bsgo bar bya ba'i rdzas la nus pa'i khyad par skyed pa yin na /
translated: If the impelling causes a special potency to arise in the impelled substance,

original: bdag gi rdzas la ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de yang mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi rdzas la ni 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir de yang mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: then that is impossible because the substance of the self is unchanging. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: gal te bag chags mi srid du zin kyang des cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bag chags mi srid du zin kyang des cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If latent impressions are impossible, what follows from that?

original: de'i phyir / yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If there is no difference in transformation,” and so on.

original: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par med na zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du nus pa'i khyad par med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba'i khyad par med na zhes bya ba ni gong nas gong du nus pa'i khyad par med par zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If there is no difference in transformation, there is no difference in potency from one moment to the next. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: de'i bag chags med par zhes bya ba ni /🔽rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bag chags so //
analyzed: de'i bag chags med par zhes bya ba ni / rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i bag chags so //
translated: If there are no latent impressions,🔽there are no latent impressions in consciousness and so on.

original: sngon myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sngon myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa dag la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In regard to prior experience, knowledge, and attachment and so on,

original: myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ni myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa ni myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Experience, knowledge, and desire, etc. are experience, knowledge, and desire, etc.

original: de dag ni sngon byung ba'i phyir sngon yang yin la /🔽myong ba @96a * //🔽dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin pas /
analyzed: de dag ni sngon byung ba'i phyir sngon yang yin la / myong ba @96a * // dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa yang yin pas /
translated: They are prior because they have occurred previously.

original: sngon myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sngon myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: Experience, knowledge, and desire, etc. are experience, knowledge, and desire, etc.

original: de'i phyir / sngon byung ba'i myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag la ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sngon byung ba'i myong ba dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa de dag la ste /
translated: Therefore, they are the prior experience, knowledge, and desire, etc.

original: myong ba ni 'dir sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'o //
analyzed: myong ba ni 'dir sngon po la sogs pa myong ba'o //
translated: Here, experience is the experience of blue, etc.

original: shes pa ni nges pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa ni nges pa'i shes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the knowledge of ascertainment, etc.

original: goms pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa'i'o //
analyzed: goms pa'i zhes bya ba ni 'dris pa'i'o //
translated: Familiarity is the repetition of that.

original: dran pa dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dran pa dang / shes pa dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Desire, etc. are desire, hatred, and so on.

original: sngon myong ba la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: sngon myong ba la sogs pa dag dang lhan cig go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: They are connected with prior experience, etc. in order.

original: gzhan yang bdag sems med pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang bdag sems med pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa yang gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, it is said, “When the self is in a state of unconsciousness . . .”

original: gang dag bdag kho na las skye'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gang dag bdag kho na las skye'o snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that it arises from the self alone,

original: de'i phyir bdag la ni khyad par med na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag la ni khyad par med na zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: then it is said, “If the self is not different . . .”

original: de ltar re zhig bdag khas blangs nas skyon bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bdag khas blangs nas skyon bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first, having accepted the self, the error is shown.

original: da ni don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba nyid kyis de yod pa nyid mi bzod par bstan pa ni /
analyzed: da ni don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba nyid kyis de yod pa nyid mi bzod par bstan pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to show that it is unacceptable that the self exists because it is devoid of the capacity for functioning, it is said:

original: rnam par shes pa rnams ci zhig de la rag lus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa rnams ci zhig de la rag lus na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “If consciousness depends on that . . .”

original: de la rag lus zhes bya ba ni bdag la rag las pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la rag lus zhes bya ba ni bdag la rag las pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: “That” means “the self.”

original: 'dir ni rnam par brtag pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par brtag pa gnyis te /
translated: Here there are two alternatives.

original: rim gyi de la bdag rag lus pa'i dngos po la bya ba byed dam cig car yin grang na /
analyzed: rim gyi de la bdag rag lus pa'i dngos po la bya ba byed dam cig car yin grang na /
translated: Does the self function in dependence on that gradually or instantaneously?

original: de la cig car bya ba mi byed par ni gsal ba nyid de /
analyzed: de la cig car bya ba mi byed par ni gsal ba nyid de /
translated: It is clear that it does not function instantaneously.

original: cig car de la rag lus pa'i 'bras bu mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car de la rag lus pa'i 'bras bu mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect that simultaneously depends on it does not appear.

original: 'on kyang rim gyis byed pa brjod par bya ste /🔽bdag la rag las pa yang skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang rim gyis byed pa brjod par bya ste / bdag la rag las pa yang skye ba'am /
translated: However, the sequential operation should be stated.

original: yang na gnas pa zhig yin grang zhes brtags pa la //🔽gal te skye ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni re zhig skye ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: yang na gnas pa zhig yin grang zhes brtags pa la // gal te skye ba yin no zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni re zhig skye ba'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: It is to be examined whether the self is the cause of the arising or🔽the cause of the endurance of the effect that depends on it.🔽If it is the cause of the arising, etc.,

original: rim gyis byed pa dgag par mdzad de /
analyzed: rim gyis byed pa dgag par mdzad de /
translated: in the first place, the sequential operation is refuted from the point of view of the position of arising.🔽If the cause is not incomplete, it is not suitable for the arising to be sequential.

original: rgyu de ma tshang ba med pa yin na rim gyis skye bar rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu de ma tshang ba med pa yin na rim gyis skye bar rung ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: gzhan dag rgyu ni ma tshang ba med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag rgyu ni ma tshang ba med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Others say: The cause is not incomplete,

original: 'di ltar bdag de ni shes pa phyi ma phyi ma skye bar bya ba'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos so zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag de ni shes pa phyi ma phyi ma skye bar bya ba'i phyir lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos so zhe na /
translated: because the self is dependent on another cooperative cause for the production of each subsequent cognition.🔽Therefore, it is said:

original: de'i phyir / gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu //
translated: If the cooperative cause

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is not incomplete,🔽then the self is not the cause of the arising of the effect.

original: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir ro zhe na zhes bya ba ni //
translated: If you say: “Because it depends on other cooperative conditions,”

original: rim gyis skye ba yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rim gyis skye ba yin zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: then it should be applied that “arising is gradual.”

original: de dag las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen @96b dag las so //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba ni lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen @96b dag las so //
translated: “From them” means from the cooperative conditions.

original: gzhan pa la zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //
analyzed: gzhan pa la zhes bya ba ni bdag la'o //
translated: “In another” means in the self.

original: de skyed pa'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan skyed pa'i'o //
analyzed: de skyed pa'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa gzhan skyed pa'i'o //
translated: “Causing the arising” means causing the arising of another cognition.

original: nus pa yod par ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba ni khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nus pa yod par ji ltar khong du chud ces bya ba ni khong du mi chud do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “How is the existence of the capacity understood?” means it is not understood.

original: 'di skad du phan 'dogs pa la ni ltos par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad du phan 'dogs pa la ni ltos par bya ba yin na /
translated: This is what is meant: If it is said that the self depends on the benefit,

original: bdag ni gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu las cung zad kyang phan 'dogs par mi ltos te /
analyzed: bdag ni gang gis na lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu gzhan la ltos pa'i phyir rim gyis skye bar 'gyur ba lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu las cung zad kyang phan 'dogs par mi ltos te /
translated: then the self does not depend on the slightest benefit from the cooperative conditions because it arises gradually due to depending on other cooperative conditions.

original: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not produced.

original: de bas na gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de dag las shes pa phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba yin na de dag kho na'i nus pa nyid yin gyi //
analyzed: de bas na gal te lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu de dag las shes pa phyi ma phyi ma 'byung ba yin na de dag kho na'i nus pa nyid yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, if the subsequent consciousnesses arise from those co-operating causes, then they are the potential of just those causes,

original: bdag ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: and not of the self.

original: de ltar na re zhig skye ba'i phyogs mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig skye ba'i phyogs mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, first of all, the position of arising is untenable.

original: da ni gnas pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
analyzed: da ni gnas pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du mdzad nas /
translated: Now, with regard to the position of abiding,

original: 'on te 'dug pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te 'dug pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: he says, “But if it abides, etc. ”

original: 'dug pa ni rnam par shes pa rnams rab tu 'dug pa dang gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dug pa ni rnam par shes pa rnams rab tu 'dug pa dang gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Abiding means that the consciousnesses are well-established and abide.

original: de la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag la rag las pa yin no //
analyzed: de la rag las pa yin no zhes bya ba ni bdag la rag las pa yin no //
translated: It depends on that means it depends on the self.

original: skyes nas mi gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa dag yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas mi gnas pa dag ces bya ba ni skyes ma thag tu 'jig pa dag yin no //
translated: Those that do not abide after arising means those that perish immediately after arising.

original: ltung ba ma yin pa dag la zhes bya ba ni lci ba ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ltung ba ma yin pa dag la zhes bya ba ni lci ba ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: With regard to those that do not fall means with regard to those that are not heavy.

original: ltung ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ltung ba'i chos can ma yin pa dag la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means with regard to those that are not subject to falling.

original: 'dug pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin de dag la 'dug pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dug pa ci zhig yod ces bya ba ni de lta bu'i rang bzhin de dag la 'dug pa med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “What is there to remain?” means that such a nature does not remain in them.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni med par bsgrubs nas mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni med par bsgrubs nas mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: “Therefore, etc.” concludes after establishing non-existence.

original: sbyor ba ni gang don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba de ni med pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba de ni med pa yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is devoid of the capacity to perform a function does not exist,

original: dper na dngos po med pa lta bu yin la /
analyzed: dper na dngos po med pa lta bu yin la /
translated: like a non-entity.

original: bdag kyang don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba yin pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag kyang don byed pa'i nus pa dang bral ba yin pas khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: Since the self is also devoid of the capacity to perform a function, there is a non-observation of the pervasion.

original: 'di ltar yod pa nyid ni don byed pa'i nus pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa nyid ni don byed pa'i nus pas khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, existence is pervaded by the capacity to perform a function.

original: de bas na don byed pa'i nus pa log na /
analyzed: de bas na don byed pa'i nus pa log na /
translated: Therefore, when the capacity to perform a function is negated,

original: des khyab par bya ba yod pa nyid kyang ldog pa yin no //🔽de ltar rigs pas med par bsgrubs nas lung gis kyang bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des khyab par bya ba yod pa nyid kyang ldog pa yin no // de ltar rigs pas med par bsgrubs nas lung gis kyang bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: the pervaded, existence, is also negated.

original: chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Thus, after establishing non-existence through reasoning, in order to establish it through scripture, he says, “All phenomena, etc.”

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni nang na byed pa'i skyes bu bdag yod par rtogs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni nang na byed pa'i skyes bu bdag yod par rtogs na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus means if one understands that the inner agent, the self, exists.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba yin no //
translated: Therefore and so on concludes.

original: de ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med pa dang / rig pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni gyi na'o zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med pa dang / rig pa med pa can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: That is nonsense means it is without reason and without proof.

original: de ci zhe na /
analyzed: de ci zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: @97a * // de'i phyir /
analyzed: @97a * // de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it is said,

original: rang dbang can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: rang dbang can zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: independent and so on.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs kyang rgya cher bsal te /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi phyogs kyang rgya cher bsal te /
translated: Thus, having extensively refuted the opponent's position,

original: rang gi phyogs kyang bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: rang gi phyogs kyang bsgrubs nas /
translated: and having established one's own position,

original: des na sems pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
analyzed: des na sems pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud pa yin no //
translated: therefore, thought and so on concludes.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag gi las mi 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag mdo dang 'gal ba ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag gi las mi 'dod na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag mdo dang 'gal ba ston pa yin no //
translated: Thus, if one does not accept bodily and verbal karma, and so on, others show a contradiction with the sutras.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nged zer ba de ltar ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nged zer ba de ltar ro //
translated: Thus means as we say.

original: las dag ni gsum ste zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig 'di ci de gsal bar nus sam zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las dag ni gsum ste zhes bya ba mdo'i tshig 'di ci de gsal bar nus sam zhe na zhes bya ba ni mi nus so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The words the actions are three are the words of the sutra. Are they able to clarify that?  means they are not able to, which is the meaning of the passage.

original: mi nus te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis lan gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi nus te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis lan gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The master says in response, They are not able to... and so on.

original: ji ltar skyon med ce na zhes zer ba ni gzhan dag go //
analyzed: ji ltar skyon med ce na zhes zer ba ni gzhan dag go //
translated: Those who say, How is there no fault? are others.

original: 'dir las dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
analyzed: 'dir las dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa ni slob dpon no //
translated: The master says here, The actions are... and so on.

original: 'di skad du re zhig bstan pa 'di ci'i phyir yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid thog ma kho nar brjod par bya ba la phyis ni lus la sogs pa'i las ji ltar bstan pa de lta bur dgongs pa 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no
analyzed: 'di skad du re zhig bstan pa 'di ci'i phyir yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di nyid thog ma kho nar brjod par bya ba la phyis ni lus la sogs pa'i las ji ltar bstan pa de lta bur dgongs pa 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa yin no
translated: This is what is being taught: First of all, this should be stated: 'Why is this teaching?' and so on. Later, the intention regarding how the actions of body and so on are taught will be explained.

original: // ci'i phyir yin pa zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ci zhig yod do //
analyzed: // ci'i phyir yin pa zhes bya ba ni dgongs pa ci zhig yod do //
translated: Why is it?  means What is the intention?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa ni dgongs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis bstan pa ni dgongs pa ma yin no //
translated: The teachings of the Buddha Bhagavans are not intentional.

original: lus gang yin zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sgras ci zhig gsungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus gang yin zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sgras ci zhig gsungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the body? This is the same as asking, “What is referred to by the word body?”

original: las ci yin zhes bya ba ni las kyis kyang ci zhig gsungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽don gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni sgra'i don gyi dbang du mdzad nas dri ba yin te /🔽rgyu gang gis na de la lus la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las ci yin zhes bya ba ni las kyis kyang ci zhig gsungs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // don gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni sgra'i don gyi dbang du mdzad nas dri ba yin te / rgyu gang gis na de la lus la sogs pa'i sgra 'jug ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the action? This is the same as asking, “What is referred to by the word action?”🔽What is the meaning of the word? This is a question that is based on the meaning of the word.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid mthun pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mtshan nyid mthun pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the cause by which the word body is applied? This is the same as asking, “What is the meaning of the word body?”

original: las gnyis la yang rtsis mgos bsgre ba yin te /🔽de la yang dag 'di gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las gnyis la yang rtsis mgos bsgre ba yin te / de la yang dag 'di gang yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, the two actions are also to be multiplied by the three roots.🔽Here, the question is, “What is the correct one?”

original: de bzhin du ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang brjod dgos so //
analyzed: de bzhin du ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan 'di yang brjod dgos so //
translated: In the same way, the following question should be asked: “Why is it that the word ‘eye’ is applied to this?”

original: mig la sogs pa'i las rnams ni 'dir lta ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i las rnams ni 'dir lta ba la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The actions of the eye, etc., are to be understood here as seeing, etc.

original: da ni re zhig bstan pa 'di ci'i phyir yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri ba re re'i lan gdab par mdzad do //
analyzed: da ni re zhig bstan pa 'di ci'i phyir yin zhe na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dri ba re re'i lan gdab par mdzad do //
translated: Now, in response to each question, beginning with “Why is this taught?”

original: las kyi lam bcu po dag ces bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / de dag spong ba rnams so //
analyzed: las kyi lam bcu po dag ces bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa dang / de dag spong ba rnams so //
translated: The ten karmic paths are killing and so on, and their abandonment.

original: las gsum dag gis bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis bsdu @97b ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las gsum dag gis bsdus pa bstan pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i las rnams kyis bsdu @97b ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: In order to show that they are included in the three karmas, in order to show that they are included in the karmas of body and so on.

original: 'di ltar lus kyi las kyis bsdus pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus kyi las kyis bsdus pa ni gsum ste /
translated: Thus, those included in the karma of body are three:

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa rnams dang / de spong ba rnams so //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa rnams dang / de spong ba rnams so //
translated: killing, taking what is not given, and sexual misconduct, and their abandonment.

original: ngag gi las kyis ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: ngag gi las kyis ni bzhi ste /
translated: Those included in the karma of speech are four:

original: brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams dang / de spong ba rnams so //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / tshig rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa rnams dang / de spong ba rnams so //
translated: lying, slander, harsh words, and idle speech, and their abandonment.

original: yid kyi las kyis ni gsum ste /
analyzed: yid kyi las kyis ni gsum ste /
translated: Those included in the karma of mind are three:

original: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba rnams dang / de spong ba rnams bsdus so //
analyzed: brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang / log par lta ba rnams dang / de spong ba rnams bsdus so //
translated: covetousness, malice, and wrong views, and their abandonment.

original: gang zag ci 'dra ba dag la zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag ci 'dra ba dag la zhe na /
translated: What kind of person is it for?

original: de'i phyir / bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa rnams la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa rnams la zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “for those who are afraid of many activities.”

original: srog gcod pa la sogs pa spang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni bdag cag gis mang po zhig bya dgos so snyam du de ltar bsams nas gang dag bred pa de dag ni bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa la sogs pa spang ba'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba ni bdag cag gis mang po zhig bya dgos so snyam du de ltar bsams nas gang dag bred pa de dag ni bya ba mang pos 'jigs pa rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Those who are afraid, thinking, “We must perform many activities characterized by abandoning killing and so on,” are called “those who are afraid of many activities.”

original: ci 'dra ba zhig tu bsdu ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig tu bsdu ba rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: What kind of person is it for?

original: de'i phyir / bri dzi'i bu la bslab pa gsum bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / bri dzi'i bu la bslab pa gsum bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, it is said, “like the three trainings taught to Vṛjiputra.”

original: ji ltar bri dzi'i bu zhes bya ba'i mi zhig bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu lhan cig thos nas spro bar khas mi 'che ba la bri dzi'i bu khyod kyis nus sam zhes bya ba nas bri dzi'i bu khyod kyis bslab pa gsum dag la legs par
analyzed: ji ltar bri dzi'i bu zhes bya ba'i mi zhig bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu lhan cig thos nas spro bar khas mi 'che ba la bri dzi'i bu khyod kyis nus sam zhes bya ba nas bri dzi'i bu khyod kyis bslab pa gsum dag la legs par
translated: For example, a man named Brizidatta heard the two hundred and fifty precepts and did not agree to take them up.

original: bslab par spro'am zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: bslab par spro'am zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: The Buddha said, Brizidatta, can you? and so on, up to Brizidatta, are you happy to train well in the three higher trainings?

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das spro lags so //
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das spro lags so //
translated: He replied, Blessed One, I am happy.

original: bde bar gshegs pa spro bar 'tshal lags so zhes rgya cher gsol pa dang / 'o na bri dzi'i bu khyod kyis dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la slobs shig ces rgya cher gsungs te /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa spro bar 'tshal lags so zhes rgya cher gsol pa dang / 'o na bri dzi'i bu khyod kyis dus dus su lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa la slobs shig ces rgya cher gsungs te /
translated: Sugata, I am happy to do so. The Buddha said, Well then, Brizidatta, from time to time train in the higher training of ethics, the higher training of the mind, and the higher training of wisdom.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum bstan pa 'dis ni bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu lhag pa de nyid bslab pa gsum du bsdu ba mdzad nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bslab pa gsum bstan pa 'dis ni bslab pa'i gzhi nyis brgya lnga bcu lhag pa de nyid bslab pa gsum du bsdu ba mdzad nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: This teaching of the three trainings, such as the higher morality, etc., shows that the more than two hundred and fifty bases of training are included in the three trainings.

original: gzhan yang kha cig na re lus kho nas byas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang las gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang kha cig na re lus kho nas byas pa yin gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang las gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, some say that the three actions are taught for the sake of this, i.e., “It is done only by the body, etc.”

original: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed pa kha cig go //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes bya ba ni mu stegs byed pa kha cig go //
translated: Some say means some non-Buddhists.

original: rnam par rtog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni kun du rtog pa tsam yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are mere conceptualization means because they are mere imagination.

original: ngag dang yid kyi las gnyis ni kun tu rtog pa tsam kho na yin te /
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyi las gnyis ni kun tu rtog pa tsam kho na yin te /
translated: The two actions of speech and mind are mere imagination.

original: kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa ma yin par sems so zhe'o //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba chen po dang bcas pa ma yin par sems so zhe'o //
translated: They think that they are not associated with great evil.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni de skad ces zer ba dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni de skad ces zer ba dag la'o //
translated: To them means to those who say that.

original: de gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las @98a * //
analyzed: de gnyis kyang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi las @98a * //
translated: Those two means the actions of body and speech.

original: gnyis su bstan pa 'di ni de lta bu'i phyir yin no zhes bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: gnyis su bstan pa 'di ni de lta bu'i phyir yin no zhes bsgrubs nas /
translated: This is the reason for the twofold teaching.

original: da ni lus kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lus kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning expressed by the word body,

original: lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lus ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, “The body is . . .”

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i khog pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i khog pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement “the body is the collection of the faculties and the body” is the brief teaching.

original: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa'i khyad par zhes bya bas ni de nyid rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur pa 'dus pa'i khyad par zhes bya bas ni de nyid rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement “the particular collection of the elements and the derivative of the elements” is the extensive teaching.

original: las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: las ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las kyi sgra'i brjod par bya ba bstan to //
translated: The statement “action . . .” and so on teaches the meaning expressed by the word action.

original: bsags pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni lus kyi sgra bsdus pa bstan to //
analyzed: bsags pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni lus kyi sgra bsdus pa bstan to //
translated: The statement “by the meaning of accumulation . . .” and so on teaches the summary of the word body.

original: ji ltar bsags pa'i don gyis she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsags pa'i don gyis she na /
translated: How is it by the meaning of accumulation?

original: de'i phyir / 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / 'byung ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore he says, “the elements . . .” and so on.

original: kha cig na re zhes pa bya ba ni smra ba kha cig go //
analyzed: kha cig na re zhes pa bya ba ni smra ba kha cig go //
translated: The statement “some say . . .” and so on is the statement of an opponent.

original: ngan pa bsags pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ngan pa bsags pa'i don gyis te zhes bya ba ni smad pa'i don gyis so //
translated: The meaning of “bad” is the meaning of “contemptible.”

original: ji ltar smad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar smad pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it contemptible?

original: de'i phyir / mi gtsang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / mi gtsang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, “impure,” and so on.

original: phyogs 'di glags dang bcas pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis de dag gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun dbyung ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyogs 'di glags dang bcas pa'i phyir slob dpon gyis de dag gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun dbyung ba gsungs te /
translated: Since this position is vulnerable, the Master states the refutation, beginning with “According to them, the body of the gods would not be a body.”

original: gang dag ngan pa'i don gyis lus yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na lha'i lus ni lus su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag ngan pa'i don gyis lus yin par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na lha'i lus ni lus su mi 'gyur te /
translated: According to those who assert that the body has the meaning of “bad,” the body of the gods would not be a body,

original: lus kyi phyi nang dang bcas pa yin du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi phyi nang dang bcas pa yin du 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be possible that the body would be both internal and external.

original: byed pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las kyi sgra bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni las kyi sgra bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The word “action” is established by “the agent,” and so on.

original: lus g-yo bar byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus kyi las kyi sgra bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: lus g-yo bar byed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lus kyi las kyi sgra bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: The word “action of the body” is established by “the mover of the body,” and so on.

original: gal te lus g-yo bar byed pa yin na de ji ltar lus kyi las zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gal te lus g-yo bar byed pa yin na de ji ltar lus kyi las zhes bya ste /
translated: If the body is the mover, how can it be called the action of the body?

original: de ltan lus g-yo bar byed pa'i las zhes de skad bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga mas dogs nas de'i phyir de'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltan lus g-yo bar byed pa'i las zhes de skad bya dgos so zhes bya ba'i phyogs snga mas dogs nas de'i phyir de'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to establish the meaning of that passage, he says:

original: sems pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: sems pa ni rnam pa gsum ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: There are three types of intention.

original: 'dis kyang re zhig sems pa kho na rnam par 'byed pa de /
analyzed: 'dis kyang re zhig sems pa kho na rnam par 'byed pa de /
translated: This also shows that intention alone is distinguished.

original: lan ni phyis 'debs so //
analyzed: lan ni phyis 'debs so //
translated: The answer is given later.

original: 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'gro bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'gro bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis 'gro bar byed pa ste /
translated: “That which causes going” is that by which one goes.

original: 'di dang 'dis 'gro bar byed do zhes sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang 'dis 'gro bar byed do zhes sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the intention that this and this is going.

original: nges par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig ni bya'o //
analyzed: nges par byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'di dang 'di lta bu zhig ni bya'o //
translated: “That which determines” is that which analyzes in this way: “This is to be done.🔽This is not to be done.”

original: 'di lta bu zhig ni mi bya'o zhes de ltar dpyod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhig ni mi bya'o zhes de ltar dpyod pa'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is engaged in that kind of analysis.

original: g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni nges par byas nas dus phyis te zhes bya ba'i tshe'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni nges par byas nas dus phyis te zhes bya ba'i tshe'i sems pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: “That which moves” is the intention that, after determining, at the time of going, this and this is going.

original: de nyid gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: That is taught by “By which” and so on.

original: 'o na skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar des lus g-yo bar byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na skad cig pa yin pa'i phyir ji ltar des lus g-yo bar byed ce na /
translated: Well then, how does it move the body, since it is momentary?

original: de'i phyir @98b de dang ldan pa'i rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir @98b de dang ldan pa'i rgyud ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “The continuum that possesses it” and so on.

original: sems pa de dang 'brel pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de ni de dang ldan pa'i rgyud de gang yod na de skye ba'o //
analyzed: sems pa de dang 'brel pa'i rgyud gang yin pa de ni de dang ldan pa'i rgyud de gang yod na de skye ba'o //
translated: The continuum that is connected with that intention is the continuum that possesses it. When it exists, that arises.

original: de dang ldan pa'i rgyu yul gzhan du 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i rgyur gyur pa'i rlung gang yin pa de bsgrub pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i rgyu yul gzhan du 'byung ba gang yin pa de'i rgyur gyur pa'i rlung gang yin pa de bsgrub pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The cause that possesses that is the wind that becomes the cause of the arising of the object in another place. That is what is established.

original: sems pa rnam par phye nas da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar na lus g-yo bar byed pa'i las lus kyi las yin pa de lta bur ston to //
analyzed: sems pa rnam par phye nas da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ji ltar na lus g-yo bar byed pa'i las lus kyi las yin pa de lta bur ston to //
translated: Having analyzed intention, now, beginning with “How does it move the body? ” it is taught how the action that moves the body is bodily action.

original: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni g-yo bar byed pa'i tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bar gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni g-yo bar byed pa'i tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because the middle term is elided. This means that the term for the agent is elided.

original: sman pa la'i 'bru mar lta bu zhes bya ba ni sman pa la dang btsos pa'i 'bru mar la sman pa la'i 'bru mar zhes par gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sman pa la'i 'bru mar lta bu zhes bya ba ni sman pa la dang btsos pa'i 'bru mar la sman pa la'i 'bru mar zhes par gyi tshig mi mngon par byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Like oil of the la plant. Oil cooked with the la plant is called oil of the la plant. The term for the agent is elided.

original: sman pa la'i tshig gis ni 'dir sman pa tu la yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sman pa la'i tshig gis ni 'dir sman pa tu la yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The term la plant should be understood here as the plant tula.

original: rdul gyi rlung zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rdul 'thul bar byed pa'i rlung ni rdul gyi rlung ngo //
analyzed: rdul gyi rlung zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rdul 'thul bar byed pa'i rlung ni rdul gyi rlung ngo //
translated: Like the wind of dust. The wind that stirs up dust is called the wind of dust.

original: dpe sna tshogs pa smos pa ni don 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe sna tshogs pa smos pa ni don 'di gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Various examples are given to clarify this point.

original: lus kyi las kyi sgra bsgrub pa 'dis ni mdo'i tshig 'di nyid gsal bar nus sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar brtsad pa gang yin pa de'i lan btab bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus kyi las kyi sgra bsgrub pa 'dis ni mdo'i tshig 'di nyid gsal bar nus sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar brtsad pa gang yin pa de'i lan btab bar rig par bya ste /
translated: By this accomplishment of the verbal action of the body, the response to the previous objection should be understood, “Can this very statement of the sutra be clarified?”

original: sems pa'i khyad par kho na la de lta bur brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems pa'i khyad par kho na la de lta bur brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that way only in regard to the specific volition.

original: lan 'di ni phyi ma ngag gi las la yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lan 'di ni phyi ma ngag gi las la yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: This response should also be applied to the subsequent verbal action.

original: sems pa'i khyad par kho na la lus la sogs pa'i las rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'dir yang gzhan gyis 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems pa'i khyad par kho na la lus la sogs pa'i las rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'dir yang gzhan gyis 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that only the specific volition is posited as the action of body, etc., and in order to show that there is no contradiction here,

original: las kyi lam rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
analyzed: las kyi lam rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras so //
translated: he says, “The paths of action are from the ten paths of action,” and so on.

original: de skad ces bya bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa zhes bya bar ro ;🔽;'di skad du las kyi lam rnams kyi nang nas srog gcod pa la sogs pas lus kyi las rnam pa gsum du rnam par phye la /
analyzed: de skad ces bya bar 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa zhes bya bar ro ;🔽;'di skad du las kyi lam rnams kyi nang nas srog gcod pa la sogs pas lus kyi las rnam pa gsum du rnam par phye la /
translated: If you say that they are, then they would be called “killing” and so on.🔽This is because they are called “the paths of action,” and because they are called “the ten paths of action.”🔽He says, “If you say that they are,” that is, if you say that they are called “killing” and so on.🔽He says, “They would be called ‘killing’ and so on,” that is, they would be called “killing,” “taking what was not given,” and so on.

original: khyed kyi lugs kyis ni lus kyi las kyang sems pa la bya bas de'i phyir ji ltar na de la de ltar tha snyad gdags te /
analyzed: khyed kyi lugs kyis ni lus kyi las kyang sems pa la bya bas de'i phyir ji ltar na de la de ltar tha snyad gdags te /
translated: In your system, physical action is also mental, so how can you designate it in that way?

original: des ni srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa bud med rnams la log par g-yem par mi byed kyi /
analyzed: des ni srog gcod pa dang ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa bud med rnams la log par g-yem par mi byed kyi /
translated: It does not kill, steal, or commit sexual misconduct with women who are the wives of others.

original: 'on kyang lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis de lta bur byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang lus kyi rnam par rig byed kyis de lta bur byed do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: However, it does so by means of the physical intimation.

original: des de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis lan bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: des de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis lan bstan pa yin te /
translated: The master’s response is stated in the passage beginning with “It is not that action itself is done by that.”

original: des zhes bya ba ni sems pas so //🔽des bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig smos pa 'di nyid @99a * //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni sems pas so // des bskyed pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig smos pa 'di nyid @99a * //
translated: “That” refers to intention.

original: 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'grel pa yin no //
translated: The passage beginning with “It is not that action itself is done by that” explains the meaning of the statement.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar chom rkun gyis spar ba'i mes grong bsregs pa dang / de bzhin du rtsva las byung ba'i sems 'bras chan tshos pa na chom rkun rnams kyis grong bsregs pa dang / rtsvas 'bras chan tshos zhes zer te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni ji ltar chom rkun gyis spar ba'i mes grong bsregs pa dang / de bzhin du rtsva las byung ba'i sems 'bras chan tshos pa na chom rkun rnams kyis grong bsregs pa dang / rtsvas 'bras chan tshos zhes zer te /
translated: and just as the thieves say, “The village is burned by grass,”🔽and the grass says, “The village is burned by me,”

original: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so it is in this case.

original: ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽'dir gzhan gyi bsam pa ni gang gi ltar na srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin yin pa de'i ltar na ni lus dang ngag las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir las sems pa zhes bya ba'i las kyi lam nyid du
analyzed: ji ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / 'dir gzhan gyi bsam pa ni gang gi ltar na srog gcod pa la sogs pa lus dang ngag gi las kyi rang bzhin yin pa de'i ltar na ni lus dang ngag las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir las sems pa zhes bya ba'i las kyi lam nyid du
translated: The passage beginning with “How?” is as follows:🔽Here, the thought of others is this:🔽If killing and so on are by nature actions of body and speech, then they are the karmic paths called intention, since they are actions of body and speech.

original: rigs kyi / gang gi ltar na sems pa nyid lus la sogs pa'i las yin pa de'i ltar na las kyi lam du mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: rigs kyi / gang gi ltar na sems pa nyid lus la sogs pa'i las yin pa de'i ltar na las kyi lam du mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: But if intention itself is the action of body and so on, then it is not tenable that they are karmic paths.

original: de ni las kyang yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis lam bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni las kyang yin la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni slob dpon gyis lam bstan pa yin no //
translated: The master [Vasubandhu] teaches the path with the words “it is also action, etc.”

original: las kyang yin la zhes bya ba ni sems pa ni rang gi las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyang yin la zhes bya ba ni sems pa ni rang gi las kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also action because intention is the nature of its own action.

original: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro gnyis kyi lam yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin des bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro gnyis kyi lam yang yin pas na zhes bya ba ni dge ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin des bde 'gro dang ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also the path to good and bad destinies because, by that nature of being virtuous, etc., one goes to good and bad destinies.

original: lus g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni sems pa las logs shig na las kyi lam gzhan zhig yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: lus g-yo ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'dis ni sems pa las logs shig na las kyi lam gzhan zhig yod pa nyid du sgrub par byed de /
translated: By the words “movement of the body,” etc., he proves that there is a path of action separate from intention.

original: lus 'gul bar snang ba'i shes pa ni 'dir lus g-yo ba yin no //
analyzed: lus 'gul bar snang ba'i shes pa ni 'dir lus g-yo ba yin no //
translated: The consciousness that appears as the movement of the body is here the movement of the body.

original: de ni las kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: de ni las kyi lam yin te /
translated: That is the path of action.

original: lus kyi lam ni las kyi lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi lam ni las kyi lam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The path of the body is the path of action because it is the path of the body.

original: ji ltar na de las kyi lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de las kyi lam yin zhe na /
translated: How is it the path of action?

original: de'i phyir / sems pa zhes bya ba'i las rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems pa zhes bya ba'i las rnam pa gsum ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The three types of karma called volition,” and so on.

original: de la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus g-yo ba la dmigs te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la brten nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lus g-yo ba la dmigs te 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the meaning of “because it engages in dependence on that” is that it engages in dependence on the body’s movement.

original: de ni des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang las kyi lam yin te /
analyzed: de ni des kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di'i phyir yang las kyi lam yin te /
translated: It is also a karmic path because of what is said in the following, beginning with “that.”

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bskyod pas lus g-yo bas so //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni sems kyis bskyod pas lus g-yo bas so //
translated: “ That” refers to the movement of the body by the impetus of the mind.

original: gzhan yang 'jig rten dag gi rjes su mthun par de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ni las kyi lam zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang lus kyi las zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'jig rten dag gi rjes su mthun par de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de ni las kyi lam zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi 'on kyang lus kyi las zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, in accordance with the world, it is said, “that is also called bodily karma.” This means that it is not only called a karmic path, but it is also called bodily karma.

original: ji ltar na de lus kyi las zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na de lus kyi las zhes bya zhe na /
translated: How is it called bodily karma?

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten dag gi rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten dag gi rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “in accordance with the world.”

original: 'jig rten rnams la ji ltar snang ba dang bstun par yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te /🔽sems pa'i khyad @99b par kho na la de skad ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams la ji ltar snang ba dang bstun par yin gyi don dam par ni ma yin te / sems pa'i khyad @99b par kho na la de skad ces brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in accordance with how things appear to the world, not in terms of ultimate reality.🔽For it is only a specific volition that is called virtuous or nonvirtuous.🔽In that regard, there is virtue and nonvirtue, but, as for bodily movement, it does not exist in that way, because only a specific volition is virtuous or nonvirtuous, etc.

original: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba ni yod kyi zhes bya ba ni don dam par na sems pa'i khyad par kho na la dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa yong ba'i phyir lus g-yo ba la ni de lta bu med do zhes bya ba'i🔽tha tshig go //🔽'dogs par ni byed de zhes bya ba ni med mod kyi 'on kyang 'dogs par ni byed do //🔽ci'i phyir 'dogs she na /🔽de'i phyir / de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la dge ba dang mi dge ba ni yod kyi zhes bya ba ni don dam par na sems pa'i khyad par kho na la dge ba dang mi dge ba la sogs pa yong ba'i phyir lus g-yo ba la ni de lta bu med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'dogs par ni byed de zhes bya ba ni med mod kyi 'on kyang 'dogs par ni byed do // ci'i phyir 'dogs she na / de'i phyir / de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase, “it does not exist in that way.”

original: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni sems pa'i rten lus g-yo ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
