analyzed: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni sems pa'i rten lus g-yo ba'i sgo nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated, but it is designated,

original: sems pa de la zhes bya ba ni lus g-yo ba dang 'brel pa'i sems pa dge ba la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: sems pa de la zhes bya ba ni lus g-yo ba dang 'brel pa'i sems pa dge ba la sogs pa la'o //
translated: “That volition” refers to virtuous and so on volitions that are related to bodily movement.

original: 'jig rten 'jug pa dang ldog par gzud pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams la ni 'jug par gzud pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'jug pa dang ldog par gzud pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams la ni 'jug par gzud pa'i phyir la /
translated: In order to engage and turn away from worldly things means in order to engage in virtue and

original: mi dge ba rnams la ni ldog par gzud pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams la ni ldog par gzud pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in order to turn away from nonvirtue.

original: gal te sems pa kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag mdo dang 'gal bar ston pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te sems pa kho na las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan dag mdo dang 'gal bar ston pa yin no //
translated: If you think that only volition is the action that is to be instigated, then you contradict the sutras, which state:🔽“One who kills oneself, having three aspects, instigates three actions.”

original: rnam pa gsum ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum ni srog gcod pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: The three aspects are the distinctions of killing and so on.

original: ched du bsams nas zhes bya ba ni ched du bsams nas yin gyi //
analyzed: ched du bsams nas zhes bya ba ni ched du bsams nas yin gyi //
translated: Intentionally means intentionally,

original: bab col la sogs par ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bab col la sogs par ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: not by mistake and so on.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir na sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir na sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba yin no //
translated: The origin of suffering means the origin of suffering because it is the cause of suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rnam par smin pa can zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal gyi 'bras bu can yin no //
translated: The phrase “having the nature of ripening as suffering” means that suffering is its result.

original: byas shing zhes bya ba ni kun tu spyad pa'o //
analyzed: byas shing zhes bya ba ni kun tu spyad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “having been done” means having been performed.

original: bsags pa yin zhes bya ba ni brtas pa dang 'phel bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bsags pa yin zhes bya ba ni brtas pa dang 'phel bar byas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “having been accumulated” means having been increased and expanded.

original: mdo 'di las ni lus kyis zhes 'byung ba de dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: mdo 'di las ni lus kyis zhes 'byung ba de dang 'gal lo //
translated: This contradicts the sutra, which states, “having been done with the body.”

original: sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni slob dpon gyis lan btab pa yin te /
analyzed: sgo zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni slob dpon gyis lan btab pa yin te /
translated: The master [Vasubandhu] responds to this objection with the phrase “the door, etc.”

original: lus kyi sgo nas sems pa kho nas byas pa la lus kyi bya ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽sgo dang / rten dang / dmigs pa ni 'og ma 'og mas bshad pa'am /
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas sems pa kho nas byas pa la lus kyi bya ba zhes bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // sgo dang / rten dang / dmigs pa ni 'og ma 'og mas bshad pa'am /
translated: The phrase “having been done with the body” means having been done by volition alone through the door of the body.

original: rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs su rig par bya'o //
translated: The door, the basis, and the object should be understood as explained above or as synonyms.

original: ci ste gzhan dag gal te lus la sogs pa'i las kyang sems pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan dag gal te lus la sogs pa'i las kyang sems pa kho na yin na /
translated: If the actions of body, speech, and mind are volition alone,

original: 'o na yin gyi las dang de khyad par ci yod snyam du sems su dogs nas /
analyzed: 'o na yin gyi las dang de khyad par ci yod snyam du sems su dogs nas /
translated: One might wonder, Well then, what is the difference between the two?

original: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, It is different from that...

original: lus g-yo ba la sogs pa la brten pa'i sems pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lus g-yo ba la sogs pa la brten pa'i sems pa las gzhan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: It is different from the intention that is based on the movement of the body and so forth.
